Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious and Nice”
Reviews.Author: ozFinn
Reviews.Content: Booked a night here through a lastminute mystery deal. Having stayed at the Swissotel Merchant Court in Singapore I was pleased when I got the Sydney location. Whilst the room was not as nice as the one in Singapore, the staff were just as friendly and it was bigger. The bathroom (clean and tidy) was bigger than some hotel rooms I have stayed in recently. The toiletries provided were less and of less quality than what was available in Singapore, but still enough for the one night. The bed was on the harder side, which might not be to some peoples taste, but I slept very well on it. Had the Chicken Schnitzel for room service dinner. Service was prompt and the food was tasty. The schnitzel was very well cooked and a very dark brown crust, which is exactly how I like it, but I know my wife would consider it over-cooked. Overall, whilst I prefer the Singapore location I would not hesitate to stay here again when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, helpful staff, BYO pillow.”
Reviews.Author: KittyCorfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend of 20/21st April, great location, nice hotel and helpful staff. Had an issue with parking but was sorted out straight away. Room was comfortable, beds are hard which is ok, but pillows were awful! Everyone woke with sore necks. Bathroom was a little dirty, some mould/yellow staining along a row of tiles. Room preparation seemed rushed, toilet paper not on roll, just sitting on the bath and glassware missing from room. Just small niggles, but noticeable. Overall would stay again, with my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Dial one button and every request is fulfilled timely at any time day or night.”
Reviews.Author: sonajet
Reviews.Content: Nice big open plan foyer. Although you do have take the elevator up to it as there is only a ground level entry and no street front parking. Concierge offers prompt help to take your car at a price. Rooms were of high standard and quality fit out. Bathrooms were superbly clean ie. no mould in grout or corners of tiles. Staff all friendly except the breakfast maitre d who was under the pump because the restaurand was overflowing and spilling out in to the foyer bar seating area on a Sunday morning. This meant not all friends could enjoy breakfast together. All in all it was goog VFM (value for money).

Reviews.Title: “I Wouldn't stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Anjii B
Reviews.Content: Really wasn't up to scratch. At $420 a night, you'd expect to have towels.Had a great coffee machine in the suite, but.. no milk.Couldn't put drinks on the balcony table, aas the top was loose and couldn't be stabilised. 3am arrived home and couldn't turn the noisy aircon off. Then went to bed only to realise they hadn't bothered to put a top sheet on either. Spent the night either cooking under the duvet, or freezing within a few minutes of kicking it off. No useable plugs for Hair straighteners or anything in the bathroom, and no mirror to do it anywhere else. The 'Executive' breakfast, asked if they had tomatoes or anything and the waitress said, no they only have all of that in the regular breakfast buffet down on Level 8. Quality of the breakfast was very ordinary in comparison to other hotels around the CBD. No parking either. Wouldn't stay there again. Personally prefer the Westin, always a beautiful experience there, and the Westins rooms are sleek, contemporary and well, romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Anil N
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, moved from another hotel as we wanted comfort and the Swissotel was one of a few hotels which offered the rooms with two double beds as I was traveling with 3 people. The hotel staff are good at service and make you feel welcomed at the reception. The breakfast is great..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: hardysontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a "girls weekend". The rooms were spacious and modern with all the necessary 5 star luxuries.Beds were very comfortable and the pillow menu was great. The location of the hotel is fantastic situated above the best city shopping precent, and walking distance to some of the best restaurants in the city.We had breakfast included in our rate which was lovely and because we had a group of 8 were offered the private dining room which was great. The only downside to this hotel is the valet parking..... I had to double park and phone the hotel to send somebody over to collect my bags and park the car as there is minimal area to pull up in, but would not let this deter you from staying here as it was only a minor problem.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mimidlk47
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several different hotels in Sydney and prefer to be closer to the Circular Quay. However, we were more than pleasantly surprised with the Swissotel. First of all, it's in a great location, practically across from the Queen Victoria Building which means it is very convenient to the Town Hall train station. Second, the staff couldn't be more accommodating. The bellmen do double duty as concierge when the latter have not come on duty (and even when they have). The rooms are very comfortable, and we had great views of the city when we were upgraded to the executive floor. My only complaint would be that the breakfast hours are chaotic. There seems to be plenty of staff, but disorganization is evident regardless of the time that you go. We had to track down our own tea and coffee which was often quite cold by the time we poured it from the pitchers. The food in the buffet was allowed to all but disappear before a new tray is brought out, requiring us to wait for a new platter of fruit or bacon. Used dishes were seldom cleared from the table in a timely fashion; we resorted to piling them up on an adjacent table. The staff were very nice but terribly inefficient from our perspective. We were there for 4 days so had plenty of time to experience breakfast at different times and with different occupancy (which was never very full). Given that the breakfast is $25-$35 a day (depending on whether you pre-purchase or not when you check in), we felt that this was not good value. We only booked the breakfast for convenience and would probably not do it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: From check in to the end of our stay everything was a breeze. A smile and "can do "attitude was evident from the Doorman to check in to all members of staff we met. After arriving from a 20 hour flight at 7 am we were not able to check in but were offered the chance of a shower and freshen up,on returning to the hotel after a long breakfast we found our room ready with bags waiting for us along with a card and bottle of wine welcoming us back to Swissotel. The rooms are large , bright and very clean with plenty of storage space and a very comfy bed. During our stay the room was kept spotless by housekeeping and all amenities were refreshed daily. Even though the hotel was very busy the room was quiet and we heard no noise from any other rooms the entire stay. Overall Swiisotel Sydney is friendlier and has larger rooms than other hotels we have tried in Sydney (Hilton) On our next visit to Sydney Swissotel will certainly be our hotel of choice,although not cheap its well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sallykj
Reviews.Content: We had a great night here, made to feel welcome by all the staff. There are city bees on the balconies, and honey from the comb for breakfast. outdoor pool is fabulous - swimming while watching the city skyline come to life.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: panicale63
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney pretty early and headed straight to the hotel, I was apprehensive our rooms wouldn't available and was pleasantly surprised, when not only was our room available, we were upgraded to the executive floor, the checkin process was speedy and efficient. The rooms were spacious and decorated with lovely linens by 'Frette'. The buffet breakfast was incredible. The hotel, has a reasonable size pool, small gym and spa. Located in the heart of downtown, within comfortable walking distance of the Harbor Bridge, the Opera house, The Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but service not-so-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Starfish2201
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was nicely appointed and with a good city view. For a Sunday night though the food on offer was limited - as was the service. Staff had to be asked for drinks and to order food - and it did seem to be an inconvenience that we wanted service. Breakfast was the standard continental or hot and nothing very exciting. Once again the staff seemed to be inconvenienced by our presence. Given the nice rooms and good location it was disappointing that the service was so slack and uninspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Rob N
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the check in staff were very rude. Room was ok, nothing to get excited over. Room service is terrible and overpriced (dont even bother). Restaurant down stairs is nice for dinner and breakfast if you want to stay close, but very pricey. Rooms clean and internet was free for my room which was great. Would I stay again? Not at those prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: Alvin W
Reviews.Content: Stay in the hotel twice, once in late 2011 and one in March 2012. In 2011, Shower light would not switch on due to component problem, but problem was fixed quickly. In March 2012, sensor flush would not work, engineer was quick to attend to the problem, and allowed us to use the toilet in another room. Maybe I'm just unlucky? But other than that, everything about the hotel is excellent. Friendly, helpful and attentive staff. Clean public area and hotel room. 24/7 in room service. Great selection of pillows. Comfortable bed, good ambient lighting. And best of all, the location. It's right in the shopping district and very close to monorail station. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DaHoneymoonerz
Reviews.Content: Room was great and spacious, breakfast buffet was excellent and staff were friendly, went on business travel so things like Internet & express checkout were seamless .

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and I am always pleased with the quality of the service. The staff are amazingly accomodating while the rooms are up-to-date, comfortable and well equipped. The location is also fantastic for those who want to be able to get around Sydney very easily. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel central to city”
Reviews.Author: theoriginalbigc
Reviews.Content: The amenities and services are very typical of what you would find in a four-star hotel, contrast to the hotel's boasting that it's a five-star one. The main draw to this hotel is that it's located on Market and George, which is one of the busiest intersections in Sydney. The hotel also offers a nice running path towards Sydney Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ClioPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Great room, spacious, fridge, kettle, huge tv and the biggest bathroom ever!!!!! Checked in at 9.30 am not expecting to get room but were pleasantly surprised as room available so we got some sleep after long flight. Did Room Only but ate at restaurant once....sorry " Angus Scotch Fillet of Beef" was not what we expected. As Scots we know our beef..........it was ribeye at best, certainly not fillet steak and tough!! Had a pizza in bar area another night as restaurants close so early......9pm. Â£17 for large to share pizza was fine. Hotel is typical city centre with prices to match but service good and location excellent. Warning to incoming visitors....expect at least one hour at immigration/customs. Many people were late for car pick ups etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: debcox
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with this hotel which more than upheld the high standards of this chain. Our room was spotless and all the public rooms were attractive and the lift to the street is no problem at all. The staff were charming and helpful with us and we were perfectly satisfied with the food. As everyone has already said the hotel is very central in the city and I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: annabellequinn
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we had tickets to a show at the State Theatre across the road. The room was lovely and quiet (we were on one of the higher floors) and the staff were friendly and efficient. We only had a short time for dinner before the show and decided to dine in the hotel restaurant as it was pouring rain. Lovely wait staff made sure our meals arrived quickly and nothing was too much trouble. It was pricey, but well worth braving the elements outside searching for a restaurant. We were sorry that we were only there for one night - wished that we'd booked a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the night lockout at a 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roamingx
Reviews.Content: So twice I changed my keys because they stopped working. Did they bother to check the locks? No, they just cut new keys and say "sorry". So at 2am when I could not get into my room, and two newly cut keys did not work (again "sorry"), and the concierge's key at 2:15 did not work (again "sorry"), a master key finally worked at 2:20. So stuck outside of my room for 20 minutes in the middle of the night, no offer to check the locks, or change the room, or compensation or anything. Not what you would expect from a 5-star hotel? Well, first of all this is self-rated so 5 stars is generous. Second of all, this is Australia where a 5-star hotel would be considered a 4-star hotel anywhere else. And proper service? Not typical in Oz, mate. So of course the hotel behaved like a 1-star hotel and of course its locks should not be breaking down and of course I would never stay here again nor recommend it but it's not unusual for the market.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms but spa not so sure.”
Reviews.Author: ainaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a Club Room for 2 nights in September 2011. I live in Sydney but wanted a Shopping and Spa weekend for my birthday and this is the best location for it as Pitt Street Mall is literally underneath you! If you are from out of town looking to conveniently walk around Sydney then this is a good location, the bus stops and train stations are also close. Service, staff and rooms were above average actually better than what I expected. The Club Floor breakfast and cocktails were great and must say maybe one of the best I've had in terms of variety and quality of food served. There are only 2 things I would say failed to meet expectations: 1. We had an issue with room service. We ordered pizza and some dessert for dinner on one of the nights of our stay and we requested that the dessert be served maybe 15 mins after the main. It came all at once and we nicely reiterated that we requested the dessert to come later and the staff happily took it back. When it was served again, they gave us the same dessert melted and obviously put back in the freezer till it was served again! We politely complained about this and after going back and forth in calls finally a different person turned up on our door to apologise and offer us a drink if we wanted it. To be honest I think it was just a lack of communication between the person answering the phones and the people actually preparing the meals. 2. The Amrita Spa experience was a bit lack lustre. I booked the last appointment of the day for a Deluxe Chocolate Scrub. The spa receptionist was not really happy to see me when I walked in (she actually looked surprised!) and I felt rushed during the treatment. After the treatment finished and I was trying to relax before I got up and the therapist (Rose) actually whispered in my ear that I should get up as people need to get home! They also ran out of chocolate for my scrub and said they would use coffee instead. It would have been better if they rang me in advance to let me know this instead of hijacking me on the spot. Moral of the story do not book last appointments. I would stay at the Swissotel Sydney again given its location, great rooms and overall great staff. But I would stay away from the Spa! You can take your business elsewhere where it will be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Central”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneBetty
Reviews.Content: We were 4 people so we booked the presidential suite. Sounds a bit posh but on investigating 2 bedroom appartments in the city I found this was the best value as it included access to the executive club which included breakfast and drinks and canapes late afternoon. The club also had computers and a coffee machine. All very handy!! All that aside this hotel is in a great location in the heart of the city. In the reception area is a nice lounge and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Style and location”
Reviews.Author: Tarlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location which is handy to everything. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, modern and well worth the money. The restaurant in which breakfast is served has a nice atmosphere. The only negative thing I found was with the breakfast chefs having trouble cooking both poached eggs and pancakes which had to be done twice to get it right, other than that I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mad House”
Reviews.Author: Margy1_10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is above a department store the entrance is on the ground floor to get to reception you have to go up 8 floors Baggage was lost for some people who checked in ours was mislaid on departure (big panic) Not a good place for tourists or business Â£58 per person is really taking the Mickey Room typical plastic box No Character and Staff all seemed under stress

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, good service but pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: Recently had a 2 night stay at Swissotel Sydney. The hotel is in a great location, as noted by the previous reviewer its an easy walk to all the sights of Sydney from where the hotel is located. The rooms were of good size and the bathrooms were spacious with good amenities. The beds are definitely on the firm size of things which may or may not suit travellers. For me, it didn't. Our room was on the 11th floor with a view into other office towers around the hotel. The quality of the room, furnishings and amenities would be below that of other 5 star properties such as Sofitel, Shangri La, Four Seasons. Breakfast at the hotel was pricey (although discounts available upon check in) however we found a much better option at Cafe Dante which is just around the corner from the hotel - all day breakfasts on the weekend for a fraction of the cost, worth checking out! The staff were friendly and housekeeping was very efficient. Error on the bill was noted upon check out and was rectified on the spot. Overall, we were pleased with our stay at the hotel but will probably select another property upon our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “I've found My Home Away From Home In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: j_debruyn
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay in Surry Hills but decided to spend an extra $20 a night and try the Swissotel and I am glad we did. To summarise: 1) Excellent Location. Next door to the Pitt Street Mall. 15 Minutes walk to the Rocks/Opera House. Close to Chinatown and 15 MInutes walk to Oxford Street - the gay area full of great bars and shops. Its perfectly located. 2) Out of all the hotels I have stayed at, this hotel is immaculately clean. The rooms are spotless. 3) We had a room with a great view of Sydney Central Tower. A treat. 4) Large room, King size bed (firm with extra pillows) and a large bathroom. Great shower pressure. Also an ice machine on the floor - very handy. 5) The Concierges and staff are very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful in where to go, shop & eat. 6) The Amrita Spa has a heated pool and spa, and a great sauna and steam room. Well worth the visit. The only complaint I can make is that the room did not contain robe and slippers. Which I normally wouldn't notice or care about you love use the pool/sauna facilities, its a must to have a robe and slippers. It weird when you use the pool and take the lift back in a towel. But most definitely, the Swissotel is my new hotel in Sydney, and would definitely stay here again. Clean, Modern and perfectly located. My recommendation: Go to the Opera Bar on the Waterfront next to the Opera House on a Sunday and enjoy the views, music and people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but lost a point coz it didnt give me a steam iron”
Reviews.Author: whitepointer
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel but with all its good point it lets itself down with the absence of a steam iron. Call me picky - i am :) i bet there isnt a staff member in the mangement at the hotel who doesnt have a steam iron at home. Next point was lost because the cable internet (ie lan cable at the desk) didnt work - but the wifi did. Importantly wifi was free but dropped out from time to time - which is annoying. Rooms are large. Minibar prices are over the top - walk down the roard to the supermarket and buy what you need and you will save. Great airconditioning - delivered cold like a good one should - thats a big plus for me as many hotels in Syd try to cost cut and reduce the aircon cooling capacity. Small pool - good well equiped gym. Large bar area which is suitable to meet friends for a drink. No decent views from the room only other office buildings. Desk staff on checking were very well organised and processed me in a friendly and efficient manner, Beds are a little harder than most you would get in Sydney. Hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney regularly on business and have stayed at various hotels around Sydney, but my favourite is Swissotel. The location is excellent - close to shops and public transport. The service is always good. The outside pool and gym is excellent. It's the details that make the biggest difference: the bathrooms have big showers and baths, and they have donnas on the beds rather than tucked in sheets.... My only qualm: I just wish they had free WIFI. So many Australian hotels seem to be stuck in the dark ages when they keep insisting on charging exorbitant fees for in room internet access. I hope they give up the jig soon and give free web access.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Sydney Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: Doug L
Reviews.Content: Just back from an excellent stay at the Sydney Swissotel. Checked in for our wedding anniversary shopping trip and was delighted to be told that we were being upgraded to an executive room as the Hotel's anniversary gift to us! We were given access to the executive lounge on the 24th floor and a room on the 25th, which was excellent. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large. As a little gift to my wife, I'd pre-ordered some chocolate-covered strawberries to be left in the room. Unfortunately these weren;t there on our arrival, however the staff on check out were mortified by this and gave us a bottle of wine to compensate. All in all, from the moment we arrived, the staff could not have done more for us and especially the front desk staff are the very best I have ever come across. Many thanks tot he Hotel for making our stay so enjoyable. There is no need to ever stay anywhere else in Sydney - the location is SO central.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 2 night mini-break. Location is great for shopping, restaurants, transport. Room was simple, but clean and bathroom was large with a separate bath. We had problems with the door lock so receptionist organised access to the executive lounge (which included breakfast) FOC. Staff were pleasant. The street level access was a little chaotic at times. Would recommend this to anyone wanting a well-located CBD hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, warm experience and lovely accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: torneyteam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel on the weekend with my husband and 11 year old son and we were absolutely delighted with every aspect of our stay. We live in Sydney but as it was my birthday (a significant milestone one!) we wanted to do something a bit different and we chose Swissotel due to the proximity to the State Theatre and shopping. The service and warmth from the staff - starting with my experience with the friendly telephone booking agent a few weeks ago, to checking in on a very busy Saturday afternoon (where staff moved quickly and efficiently but still taking time to be friendly and interested), and even the brief chats to staff in corridors or lifts - was consistent, friendly and sincere. I was made to feel very special as it was my birthday, and we were given a beautiful room on the 25th floor as well as - to my surprise and delight - a bottle of champagne and a lovely card from management. We were amazed at this generous gesture from management to a guest who has never stayed at the hotel before. We were also given a late check out the next day, which was very welcome on the morning of my birthday! The room was large, clean and well maintained. The beds and pillows were wonderfully comfortable, and there were plenty of towels, face washers, coat hangers and toiletries (I have noticed good hotels starting to really scrimp on these things lately, no doubt due to pilfering), and the coffee machine was a real bonus. We had a delicious room service lunch that arrived quickly and still nice and warm, although it would have been good to have a children's menu. We also had the buffet breakfast the next morning which is one of the best I've ever been to. There was plenty of food being regularly refreshed, even though we arrived quite late in the session - the 'live' kitchen for eggs and omlettes etc was great and there were plenty of tasty, fresh choices which kept all of us going back to the tables time and again. We felt very welcomed by all the staff and I personally felt very special with the extra attention I was so kindly given by everyone. The staff really went the extra mile for us and I will certainly be coming back to this wonderful hotel, and recommending it to friends as a fabulous choice for Sydney any time. Many thanks to management and staff from our family for a really great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “good all round”
Reviews.Author: eckstatik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two night recently to celebrate my wife's birthday. We arrived by car and the valet parking was excellent. I left my phone and wallet in the car and the hotel retrieved it immediately. The friendly staff make this "otel" work well. The location is great if you like shopping and being right in the CBD. WE went out to dinner both evenings and were able to stroll to a great Indian in darling Harbour then jumped in a cab for a short ride to Circular Quay, to get the ferry to Aqua Restaurant in Milson's Point (I will write a very favourable report on this place soon). In other words, the location is very central and you can easily get buses or trains to anywhere from close to the "otel". The room was a comfortable, good bed, good storage and a very good spacious bathroom with a good size bath and a large separate shower compartment. There were basic cityscape views,nothing too interesting but the room was quiet. My wife has the "otel"earmarked for a couple of days shopping trip with her girlfriends later in the year...You really are right on the Pitt Street Mall and almost on the QVB and you can enjoy a walk or a run through the Botanical Gardens or Domain in the morning. We strolled over to the Art Gallery of NSW then back into the city for lunch. In summary; great location, friendly staff and comfy standard room

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Harvey412
Reviews.Content: Everyone we came in to contact with - from arrival to departure - showed a genuine commitment to delivering professional service. Staff were friendly, helpful and approachable. Our room with city views was clean, modern and very comfortable, and the meals were excellent. All these 'positives' contributed enormously to the over-all enjoyment of our 3-day stay. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will certainly consider staying there again on any future trips to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Some great, some not so great”
Reviews.Author: Kim F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for our wedding anniversary. Good location. Great for shopping and not too far to walk to The Rocks or the Quay. The initial reception area off Market Street is strange and small but don't be fooled. You get in the lift and go to the 8th floor where the real reception is, and it looks very pretty. They were renovating when we were there so it didn't look its best but you could tell it was going to be really nice. The rooftop pool area is fabulous. It has a decent sized, clean pool. Separate spa. Nice deck chairs. The gym is all sparkling new. The day spa looks lovely but I didn't use it. The service is excellent. All staff you walk past greet you with a smile and hello, and they are all very helpful. The rooms are the big let down. We had a corner room. It was tiny. It was also very old and haggard looking. It was almost as if we weren't in the same hotel when you were on the inside of the room. We could have been in a country motel. The blinds were broken. The bed was old. The furniture was worn. The bathroom was clean but needed a bit of a make over,although it seemed newer than the rest of the room so it wasn't too bad. Separate bath. Very small shower. Rooms didn't really meet the standard of the rest of the hotel. So that has brought my score down to average, from what would have been well above average for most almost everything else. The rooms I would score as poor, but really bordering on terrible for the five star standard of the hotel. It might have just been our room. Perhaps some are renovated? I would go back there provided I could get a better room. I'd ask that first before I book. Everything else was great, particularly the staff, so it was a shame about the room.

Reviews.Title: “Subtle Style, Sensational Service”
Reviews.Author: dsm1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for the second time over the weekend - for an event also held at the property. As always, the size and style of the room delights, and the service (both at the function, and overall) is polshed, calm and professional in a way that Australian hotels seldom manage. We had many friends in house who had travelled interstate to attend the event - all found the hotel both convenient and incredibly comfortable. A staged refurbishement is underway - freshening a hotel that has the core of hospitality down pat.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best in sydney”
Reviews.Author: PJBSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel last weekend and what a great experience. Could not fault any aspect of this hotel from the location to the impeccable service. I will be making . my first choice when in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a little lost”
Reviews.Author: TomG1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in the Sydney CBD shopping district. I've stayed here several times on business trips. The rooms are modern (though beginning to show some signs of age); the gym is small with limited facilities. In the past 12-18 months it feels like the hotel's clientele/focus has shifted from being a business hotel to catering for tourists. You know what I'm talking about....groups of visitors clamouring for the buffet! Still a nice hotel, in a good location and with a good bar

Reviews.Title: “NOT 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: StevoDevo45
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but not 5 star quality. More like a middle range flat 4 star. It's misleading to advertise it as 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great stay”
Reviews.Author: bluebiker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location being situated right in the centre of the Sydney shopping district and less than 200 meters or so from the St James train station, which is on the airport. Line. The St James station has a lift (elevator) so bags are not a problem. The hotel is located within walking distance to Circular Quay, the Rocks, Darling Harbour, the Botanical Gardens and the Opera House. Despite being very central the rooms are quiet. We stayed in a â€˜classic roomâ€™ on the 18th floor, which afforded good views over the city to the sea. The room has a refrigerator, tea and coffee making facilities and an iron and ironing board. In short everything a four star room should have. The bed was fine. The hotel has a spa and an attractive swimming pool area. The service in this hotel was good. Everything we asked for we received in good time. Although I travel frequently I do not generally write reviews, however the reviews of this hotel on this site are mixed and quite frankly at times a little unfair to the hotel. It is what it is; a good mid priced hotel with an excellent location and good service. This is great hotel for the location and given the price of Sydney hotels, it is a good hotel for the price. I can not of course comment on anything but the Classic room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: fstech
Reviews.Content: We chose the Swissotel because of its location to the State Theatre. On arrival, we were upgraded from a king bed suite to a 2 double bed suite with access to the Executive Club and we loved the "happy hour" which included food and beverages in the Executive Lounge which was overseen by a lovely and helpful hostess. Being right in the middle of the city, we were able to wander through the city and Hyde Park late at night and not be too far from "home". Views are not the best but the whole atmosphere and decor well and truly make up for that. Breakfast was also included in the Executive Lounge and we got there just before "rush hour" and had a relaxed and leisurely breakfast. We chose to park our own car which is at a parking station a couple of blocks away, which wasn't a problem and is cheaper than the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “secret hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: kristy d
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay, was bought as a secret hotel special. Staff were very friendly, great location. Mattress was so hard and uncomfortable! woke up several times with back pain. the room had big bathroom but overall the room wasnt 5 star quality. If you choose to valet park, it costs extra for each night even if your car wasnt taken out during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel roof top pool I have seen in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Noodlefish
Reviews.Content: Every time I got to Sydney I stay in the Swissotel, I have stayed there four times to date. The main selling point of this hotel is the rooftop pool and spa. Where you can swim, relax eat and drink in lovely Australian sunshine. The service is smooth and friendly. The hotel lobby and lounges feel modern and have been renovated recently. The rooms themselves are comfortable, an average size for Australia, which is large by European standards, and the pictures on the hotels website are a good representation of the rooms. The rooms themselves start on the 12th floor, so there is always an interesting view, if not the Sydney Harbour veiw. The breakfasts are generous with a good variety of food on offer. If you opt the Executive Club Lounge, evening canapÃ©s with an open bar and breakfast is included in the price, as is a pillow menu in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: cola_smith
Reviews.Content: My wife and 6 month-old just completed a 9-night stay (Executive Club level). The location is excellent, steps away from Pitt Street Mall, David Jones, Myer, VCB, Hyde Park, and within easy walk of Circular Quay, Opera House, Darling Harbour, etc. The front desk service was excellent. We had requested a room with a king size bed. We got one, but Woody at the front desk recommended that we also look at a room with two doubles that he thought would be more comfortable with a crib because slightly larger. He was absolutely right. We changed rooms and it made a big difference in our stay. The housekeeping service was also excellent (Lizzy most days), very accommodating of our baby's sleep/feeding schedule. The doorman staff was also very good. The pool is nice, though there usually aren't enough towels in the morning. The workout room gets very hot with the afternoon sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Aus. Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: cosy504022
Reviews.Content: This hotel located only 10 mins walk from Darling Harbour has great views of the city and very spacious well appointed rooms. There is so much space especially in the reception area, even though it is situated on the 8th floor. The food is excellent and the staff are very polite and helpful. Yes, you have to get an elevator from street level but, not a problem. Downtown shops are located right outside and the monorail to the Harbour is close by. I highly recommend this hotel as great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, but please don't knock on my door before checkout time!”
Reviews.Author: bahill42
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay in a 'good', clean room with a comfortable bed. Fabulous location, right on the doorstep of city shopping. Our only real gripe was being woken at 9:30am (late by usual standards but hey we were making the most of the stay) by a staff member who came in to check the mini bar to see if we'd consumed anything! Checkout was 11am so to be woken at 9:30 did not go down well. I've stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world and never had the mini bar checked while still in the room let alone being WOKEN by someone who came in to physically check!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Poor communication among staff”
Reviews.Author: James O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our wedding night on January the 7th. Pros: Great location, quiet, large room, very clean. Free late checkout and room upgrade. Cons: Staff. 2 things. 1. I had organized rose petals on the bed/floor as a surprise for my wife on our honeymoon. As we checked in (wife in wedding dress) the receptionist said, "That's $50 for the rose petals" - loudly in front of my wife. Was upset the surprise was ruined. Would be a good idea to fix the bill up on check on... Sent them an email 2 weeks ago but have not heard back.... 2. They gave us a late checkout (thank you) BUT at 11am, a cleaner walked in on us. A few minutes later we got a call saying it was past our checkout time. Communication among staff required!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but an excellent hotel in a great location with all the trimmings”
Reviews.Author: PDrought
Reviews.Content: As expected for a five star hotel - expensive but with faultless service. The concierge, David, was extremely helpful and a good man to get to know! One tip - avoid the breakfasts. They are $35 per person and you can get better stuff nearby for a fraction of the price (for example, in the beautiful old Steand Arcade).

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: McIntoshFamily
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel via Last minute.com as a "Mystery" booking. I was a bit nervous about what we would end up with. Well it was great, right from the start the staff that greeted us at Reception were friendly and helpful. The room was clean, and a good size with a king size bed and a large bathroom with separate bath. We were on the 13th floor with view of the city skyline (wonderful for a couple from the country). All the staff we encountered at the hotel were friendly and helpful. We had a lovely few nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katiies
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and were not dissapointed. It was within walking distance of all main tourist attractions and close to subways and buses to reach the outer suburbs. The rooms are large and clean with huge bathrooms. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, genuine friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: itchysoul
Reviews.Content: Our overnight flight had us at the hotel by 7am and we were amazed to be allowed to check in so early, provided we accepted a twin double room instead of our reserved king. No problem and we enjoyed a catch up nap uninterrupted by noise generally associated with daytime hours. The room could use a freshen up decor wise, though that did not detract from our overall comfort and the black and white tiles in the bathroom added to the European feel. In the fridge $6 for a 50gm Toblerone (?!) Not to worry - shops everywhere nearby. They might have cranked up the temperature in the rooftop pool a notch for us night dippers, thankfully the spa bubbles merrily only a step away. On check out, reception offered to secure our luggage for the day which was perfect for our evening flight. I booked here as a secret hotel deal but I wont hesitate to book direct next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “A default choice for regular trips found.”
Reviews.Author: Ljbarry89
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very little that I can fault. Great location, well appointed, comfortable (albeit sometimes slightly cold) room. The staff were also fabulous, extremly polite, professional and helpul at all times. I purchased access to the executive club on top of my room rate (which was extremely reasonable) which just added to the experience. More wonderfully professional staff and a fasntastic selection of food and drink around dinner time. Also highly reccomended. If I was to scour my brain for anything negative to say about the swissotel it woud be that being on a lower (14th) floor, I did notice there was some noise from Pitt St Mall below, and also that the window shades did not do the best job they could at keeping morning light out of the room. However neither of these things are at all sufficient to warrent any less than the excellent rating above. I also note that room service was peraps on the more expensive side, but that is not something of great consequence or indeed unexpected. Be assured the swissotel did not have outragous charges I have had at other locations (tray charge for a bucket of ice for instance). This is offset however by the highly reccomended and very reasonably (<$20) express lunch (pasta of the day and glass of wine) from the crossroads lobby bar. Certainly one of the better value lunches in Sydney. All in all, on a business/study trip like I was on I would highly reccomend the swissotel and I will certainly be staying again on my frequent trips to sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: sfergo
Reviews.Content: Whenever I got to Sydney I always try to stay here, The hotel has friendly staff, clean rooms, comfy beds and great food. What more can I say? Plus it is close to everything. I also got an upgrade last time I stayed which I thought was really nice of them. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: worldgina
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Location is perfect within walking distance to Darling Harbour and the Rocks. Myers is right next door. Staff were extremely friendly. Rooms are a good size. Very comfortable bed. Quiet. Great value for money! Had never heard of this hotel before but booked it on the secret deal on lastminute.com. Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Service is 1 Star at this self rated 5 star hotel - go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: My travel was 24th to 26th Jan 2012. They rate themself as 5 stars and thats the problem - they had to rate themself. I booked the the hotel on a discount web based hotel booking site and saved heaps off their $600 rack rate. That I suggest is the issue in part. The discounted rooms customers are made to wait in line for rooms at check in my opinion. There are many reviews that highlight the fact the the hotel simply doesn't have the 5 star feel - and I agree 100%. On the street level you walk into what is bascially a lift well which brings you to a 8th level lobby as the hotel is built on top of the Pitt Street Mall Westfield. My daughter and I walked in a bit early (1pm) and checked in being advised we were on a priority queue. I left to return about 1.45pm to be advised our room was not ready yet but to rest assured that our luggage was in our room. Check is listed as 2pm and after already speaking to 3 staff from 1pm I confronted staff again at 2.30pm. I asked what the status of my room was once again and was told my booking had a request of a King Bed which was the cause of the delay. I blew up advising the lady that I booked and payed over a week ago and checked in over 1.5 hours ago and I wanted my room. She looked at me like ..... what do you want me to do. I simply demanded the manager and a guy standing right beside her spoke up. Again I demaned my room stating check in was 2pm he said oh ... oh and said he'd up grade my room and asked me to wait again. Not a good start what so ever. The room I was given was not 5 star. Water in shower was either boiling or cold and no pressure. The towel rack was broken off the wall (and I thought for sure they'd bill me somehow) the coat rack as well. The view of this "upgraded" room was the roof top of the centre point tower. My question is what was my original room going to be back. The real issue was the fact that on my check in day heaps of people were checking in - why not me? The next day I saw many others check in. There are many other real 5 star properties around the Sydney CBD I would highly suggest you pick one the believes in the golden rules of customer service - No matter what they pay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: littleloan
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic! Within great walking distance to two malls who had a truly amazing variety of different foods. Any and all kinds of food you want. Within 5 minutes from the hotel. Great location to EVERYTHING! We stayed there for 4 nights and the rooms were extremely spacious with huge bathrooms. Gym was ok, but the sauna in the mens locker room was great! My GF and I snuck in there and they didn't say anything. When we came back after leaving for 3 nights the front desk gentleman named Woody upgraded us to a higher level room with complimentary champagne. He was the best part of the hotel. Made us feel very important and welcomed. Overall all the staff from housekeeping to front desk and to conceirge was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “harrypotterfamilies”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: Thankyou for helping make our trip enjoyable. With 5 children it can be difficult staying in a hotel but the swissotel couldn't be more accomodating to all of us. Facilities are excellent and the breakfast fantastic. The location is paradise for shoppers. Highly recommended, we will be back. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “There won't be a next time.”
Reviews.Author: Sam123_12
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews, I'm wondering if this is the same hotel. Booked one night on a secret hotel deal. First impression of this hotel is one of shear chaos. No proper setdown lane so you need to park the car in a "no parking" zone on Market St. We weren't received by anyone so we didn't have any help with luggage. Enter into the small business-like foyer and the concierge gives you a choice of $55 valet parking or Kent St parking costing $35 With the worry of getting booked and trying to work out where the parking station on Kent St was, we went valet. The main reception on level 8. Arrived after the 2.00pm check-in but the room wasn't ready. It was suggested that we wait at the drinks lounge on level 24. We went up but didn't see anyone. 2.45pm and still no room so our plans for the day were already being disrupted. A room was finally ready but it was on level 11 which was a disappointment because earlier we were told it was on level 16. The room itself was miserable as it's probably the lowest level in the hotel for accomodation. The room is marred by the half height window and to make it worse, most of the view out of the window is of a concrete parapet. I noticed the smell straight away. Definitely cigarette smoke. It was faint but if you're a non smoker it's untolerable. We had kids so that wouldn't do. I enquired and fortunately the staff were able to find another room for us. One would soon be available on level 19 but we had to wait again. It was well worth it though, we finally had a nice room with a view and we could breathe. The bathroom has everything you need and looks like it's been recently refurbished. Overal a great room. Only complaint would be that the mattress was too firm and the carpets needed a proper vaccuum. I remember, tissue in hand, I went to sweep something off the carpet and collected a bonus handful of hair and dust. Yuck. Checking out was far worse then checking in. We were initially told that Valet parking was under the hotel and we could leave the car for a while and pick it up later on in the day. Not that simple though. It turned out that our car was parked in Kent St so there was no way that we could use the car to store any of the bags we were carrying. The concierge half-heartedly suggested that we leave our bags in the hotel but after seeing the mountain of luggage around him, we weren't comfortable with that. The chaos continued as we waited forever for the valet to return with our car. There was no parking available in the "no parking" zones out front. Horns were blowing as we stopped traffic on Market St to hastily throw the luggage in the boot and say goodbye and good riddance. Our plans for the day in tatters. 5 stars.....who are you kidding? I'd give it only 1 if we were forced to stay in that miserable room on level 11. It passes with 3 stars as the room on level 19 was nice. Advice to others: Make absolutely sure that you are staying on a higher level. Don't count on your room being ready at the 2.00pm check-in. Don't take your own car to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing High Tea!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M
Reviews.Content: My work collegues throw a Congratulations on Your Engagement High Tea for myself and another recently engaged colleague. We were received well at reception and were led to the High Tea room. We were actually given a private room for the 10 of us, which was lovely! The food was delicious, and in abundance. The drinks were quickly refilled and we were given complementary champagne on arrival. We spent a few hours there, and found the entire experience absolutely wonderful! I will be taking my relatives there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, But Has Some Shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: lovers1996
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the Saturday and Sunday nights on the weekend of the City to Surf. I booked a Swiss Advantage room and buffet breakfast was included in the package. POSITIVES: We arrived at the Hotel just before midday. Hotel check-in time is 2pm. Went to reception to check-in and were told that our room was ready and we could have access to it straight away. The Swiss Advantage room we had is a step up from the base room called a Classic room. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed. We had great views from the large window which provided plenty of natural light. I mention the natural light because I have found that many Sydney hotel rooms are very dark because of a lack of natural light. The bathroom was very large with a separate shower and bath. The bathroom was very modern with good quality amenities. The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. We both slept very well. In my opinion this is the best located hotel in Sydney. Because I was running the City to Surf the hotel was convenient because it was very close to Hyde Park. The Swissotel is also close to St James Station and a short walk to Darling Harbour. My wife loves the location because it is ideal for shopping as it is right in the heart of the CBD. NEGATIVES: Half an hour after we arrived to our room our suitcases had not arrived. I rang the concierge to find out what had happened to our luggage. They said that they were busy and that bags would be delivered to our room shortly. After another 10 minutes they still hadnâ€™t arrived. So my wife suggested that I go down and collect them myself. So I had to go down two lifts to collect them. And just as well I did because they were still sitting there with a whole lot of other suitcases. If I hadnâ€™t of collected them myself, who knows how long we would have waited. The hair dryer was missing from the bathroom. My wife rang housekeeping at approximately 11am and requested a hair dryer. She was given an apology for the hair dryer not being there and was told that one would be put in the room soon. When we returned to our room later that night (around 8:30pm), there was still no hair dryer. It took another phone call to have the hair dryer sent to our room. On the Sunday morning I didnâ€™t have the buffet breakfast because I was running the City to Surf. However my wife did have the breakfast at the Jpb restaurant on her own and said that it was fine. On the Monday morning we both had the buffet breakfast and I was disappointed. Firstly there was one particular staff member who was extremely rude not just to us but also other patrons. I donâ€™t know how this young lady was allowed to work at a 5 star hotel. The table we were given was dirty and hadnâ€™t been cleaned after the previous persons had eaten. I requested to be moved to another table and this particular young lady wasnâ€™t happy but moved us anyway. This time the table was clean but the seats were full of crumbs and mess. In addition to the poor service and lack of cleanliness, the selection of food was average, but not as good as most other 5 star hotels I have stayed at. We also stayed at this hotel the previous 2 years for the City to Surf. In the last year the price of the Swissotel has skyrocketed. In 2009 and 2010 was paid approximately $210/night in a Swiss Advantage room with breakfast. In 2011 we paid nearly $300/night. SUMMARY This is a hotel with enormous potential because of its excellent location and spacious, well appointed rooms. This hotel was not so long ago ranked in the top 20 on Tripadvisor and now at the time of writing it is ranked 33rd. The Swissotel Sydney is a much better hotel than its 33rd ranking. However, it does have some shortcomings. If the relevant improvements are made then this Hotel could easily be one of the top 5 in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Atention, there is no actual photos of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMoreira
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a graphic treatment on the internet and presented no photos of the rooms. In practice there is a surprise to arrive where we find a hotel far below the stunning pictures released, but still good - not great. This has become a criterion for hiring, with no reserve PHOTO not in the future. The cost benefit is good, the hotel is very well located, their strength is the staff. However flee the restaurant JPB, we had a bad Christmas dinner, it was awful. A hotel of this standard should evaluate and offer a much better restaurant. This restaurant is so bad that marked as the downside of a long journey. I intend to return to Sydney, but will try another option hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and classy”
Reviews.Author: flipperPerth
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here on a work trip. Room was a little compact, but well fitted out - even with a Bose stereo! Bathroom was better than most, as was the toiletries pack. Breakfast was also of a higher quality than a few of the Sydney hotels I stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsDew
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in 4 months and while it was still great, it didn't feel as good as last time. The service was great except for one slightly patronising man on the reception desk at checkout. The concierge and hosekeeping staff shine through in this hotel, they are terrific. The main issue was that our room this time, while perfectly adequate, was a little shabby. Which did not hamper our stay, but did not give the 5 star feeling that this hotel is self rated at. Everything else 5 star. One recommendation is to take advantage of the breakfast deal offered if you prebook. We were not told first time and were dissappointed but this time we did for 2 of the 5 nights we stayed and it was lovely, $25 per person and kids eat free with paying adult. Will go back to this hotel - still haven't tried the lindt chocolate fondue!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Got one free night hotel from Amex, this year I choose Swiss Hotel which right at the heart of Sydney CBD. Upgrading myself to the club floor, I was given a room at the top floor (25th floor), the room is spacious, clean and tidy, so as the bathroom, the room also got the coffee machine which is handy at the night time when you enjoying your movies or TV. The excutive lounge is one floor down,the lady in the lounge is very helpful for helping me use the coffee machine and set up the WIFI (which is free of charge in the lounge) for my IPAD.The breakfast is nothing special so as the afternoon tea. The location is excellent and if you want to walk to opera house , is just about 20 mins walk and Chinatown not even 10 mins. Although it claim the hotel is 5 stars but base on the Asia standard , I can only give it 4.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: aleax4
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a wonderful holiday in Sydney made all the better by a fabulous stay at the Swissotel! Having never been to Sydney before we wanted a hotel in the city, close to attractions and transport. There are 2 stations about 2 mins away from the hotel, the revolving tower is next door, the museum is just a couple of blocks down the road, shops are right outside, Darling Harbour is a stones throw (mono rail goes past the hotel). The hotel itself was clean and the staff very friendly and accommodating. Our room had 2 double beds and was bigger than I expected. The bathroom was big and spacious with a separate shower and bath. Housekeeping was efficent in bringing up extra towels and pillows for us (choice of pillows off a pillow menu!). The conciege staff were very helpful with suggestions of where we could eat and places to see. My 2 girls loved David (concierge) and were always keen to tell him what we had been up to that day. He made us feel very much at home and when we get back to Sydney we would definitely book into the Swiss again!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Heaven”
Reviews.Author: seaspirals
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sofitel and were glad we'd been warned to look out for the entry as it is minimalist compared to other comparable hotels. We'd caught the train from Newcastle to avoid Sydney traffic & easily walked the 2 blocks from St James station. The concierge stopped us as we were heading upstairs to tell us he would take care of our bags. As we were checking in early he said he would have them sent up once we had a room assigned (and he did). At check-in we were upgraded to an executive floor and it was fabulous. Great room, extremely well appointed and even though the view was mostly tops of cranes & buildings on a rainy Sydney day we could see snatches of Darling Harbour and we were looking down on the city. Huge comfy bed, pillow menu, large bathroom with separate bath, shower and stylish swissotel branded toiletries. We also had a Nespresso coffee machine in our room. We had free drinks (a range of Nespresso coffee/tea/soft drinks/spirits and wines - self service) and canapes (hot and cold, savoury and sweet) in the executive lounge, made use of the free internet (there's also broadband and wireless in the room for a cost). There was also a smokers balcony if you were so inclined. As we were heading to the Opera House for a 6.30 show canapes were perfect so we could wait to eat after the show. The staff in the executive lounge were professional and helpful. We witnessed several instances where they were providing quality service to arriving guests. After a great night's sleep we had breakfast in the lounge the following morning and again the standard was good. I particularly liked the honeycomb in a frame dripping honey into a jug although I wouldn't like to have stood there waiting for enough for my toast! The only tiny problem was with our bags as we left. After using the express checkout (drop the door cards in a provided envelop into the lounge) we left our bags with the concierge to walk the 50m for shopping in Westfields and through to the QVB. When we got back to the desk it was apparent lots of people had the same idea as us and there were bags piled everywhere. The concierge looked and couldn't find the bags, he then sent someone upstairs to look while he looked again and finally he asked my partner into the back room to look. Eventually sanity prevailed and I was asked to look - the bags were there even though three men had failed to see them. He was very apologetic and to be fair he was extremely busy but some kind of distinguishing tag on our part may have helped him locate the bags more quickly. Oh and there are two lifts and a lobby walk to get up to the rooms - but hey - no complaints from us...incidental exercise is supposed to be good for us. We needed to walk off the lemon meringue tarts and profiteroles we'd eaten in the lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMum65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early January (me, hubby and two teenagers) after making a lastminute booking online. We were in Sydney for my mother-in-law's 80th birthday Bridge Climb. Hotel is in a great position in the middle of the city - but you wouldn't know until you came outside into the street below. It's a great place if you're visiting to shop - it is right above Myer and one block from Westfield and Pitt St Mall. Also walking distance to The Rocks for the history and Circular Quay for the ferries. Also we were close to the action for Sydney Festival First Night in Hyde Park and the Domain which was great. The room we were given (two double beds - teens shared as cost of rollaway was $70!!!) was spacious, neat and tastefully decorated. Bathroom was also roomy, well lit and clean. We didn't do breakfast ($$) at the hotel but got a few things from the 7/11 down the road - way cheaper. Staff were very helpful, particularly David the concierge (?) on the ground floor with great restaurant advice. If you have your own car, parking is a bit expensive, but we used it as we had got such an amazing deal for the 3 night stay. Can recommend this hotel for city visitors looking to shop and sightsee in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clraedc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on quite a few occasions and it has never dissapointed. It is consistantly clean. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The location is outstanding. The staff are so very polite and helpful, with no request a problem. I will continue to make reservations at this excellent hotel and I would encourage other people to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: IL0VEH0LIDAYZ
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. Great location being right next to Pitt St Mall and all the shops. Town Hall train station was an easy 2-3 min walk. The service was excellent, staff were mostly very friendly and helpful. It was nice that they always made sure they greeted you. Although when we called reception with issues with the TV and booking a taxi, they didn't sound very friendly. We were transferred to a line which no one answered. The rooms were spacious and very clean, beds comfortable. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ellyse M
Reviews.Content: This is probably my favourite hotel in Sydney and I have stayed at 10+ others in the past.. We arrived at 10pm last Friday and were greeted by the doorman who took care of our luggage and they were all so friendly and helpful. Proceeded to check-in and found we were upgraded free of charge, mind you we only paid $198 per night to begin with (thankyou wotif! ) so we were pleasantly suprised we got the upgrade. The room was large, beds were AMAZING!! Bathroom large with seperate bath and shower. Could not fault anything in the room. The only thing that was a little annoying was the walk from one set of lifts to the other..this may be a pain for some people but we got used to it quickly. Perfect location, very helpful staff. I WILL be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: mamadodo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right above Myer in the heart of the city. We did have a little trouble getting to it as it is in such a busy location and I had to jump out to check in while my husband drove around the block. We had asked about parking and they told us to stop out the front and leave our bags and we would be directed to parking. It was about 5 blocks down in Kent or Sussex St, can't quite remember. Not too far to walk but I am glad we left our bags. The room was beautiful with plenty of room for the whole family, 2 adults, 2 kids and the price was reasonable for a high quality hotel. My daughter spent quite a while in the swimming pool which is on the room of the 10th floor. We were upgraded to a higher floor with a larger room so not actually sure what the rest of the rooms are like. The only negative comment I have is that reception would not give my husband a key once he came back after parking the car. I had explained that the room was booked in my name but he had a different surname and would be returning after parking the car and picking up a few things at Myer. I had given his name to reception and his details and they told me he would be given the key, despite the different surname. He had to wait in the reception area for over 20 minutes until he finally reached us on my mobile. We had been at the pool area. We didn't get any apology for the inconvenience. Still, overall, a nice hotel if a little officious, although I suppose it better to be security conscious.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Purbaningrum_Sasmita
Reviews.Content: we just back from holiday from 5 january to 10 january 2012, great experience stayed with this hotel chain. it situated in the central of happening places in Sydney, close to sydney tower, shopping center like myer and westfield, QVB is just some steps away. darling harbor and circular quay are just walking distance. the hotel staff and reception also very nice and helpful, i took a note for very nice lady of our house keeping, Erica, she's so helpful and make our room so clean and fresh, Thanks ! i would recommend this hotel for everybody would like to discover sydney and do shopping . please take note, most of shops are closing at 5 pm daily. i can add also, that the city rail could easily access from this hotel, just walk to town hall, which you can choose underground or thru street walk.

Reviews.Title: “IN THE HEART OF SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: cathie n
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the heart of the City, great for Shopping and Site seeing.Staff very friendly. Stayed at quiet a few Hotel's on the way to QLD this was the best

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights late december. rooms were in good condition, was within walking distance to darling harbour, circular quay, st james station, and multitudes of shopping and food. entrance is not very obvious but that's fine once you've been there once. did not try the restaurant nor bar. staff were friendly. no problems with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only book if you need the location”
Reviews.Author: NinJ0
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely great if you want to do loads of shopping at the new Westfield. To get to your rooms you will need to take two lifts, which is a slight inconvenience getting to your room, expect funny ears when going on the second lift. I found the room spacious and the bathroom nice, amenities adequate. The main entrance to the hotel is very small, service is good, there are main function rooms present. When we were there some sort of gala was on so it was very loud. Breakfast is very simple. The views are average. For the price, I would say an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed while in Sydney on Business, it was a perfect spot to stay, made getting around the city easy and within walking distance. The room was lovely, bed comfy and room clean, and would have been comfortable staying for a couple of nights. Staff were friendly and efficient, made check-in and out very simple.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find right in the heart of the Sydney shopping precinct”
Reviews.Author: HelenS2866
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney every year and have stayed at several 5 star hotels - this one is the best so far. Pay a little more and stay on the Executive level - it enables you to enjoy free canapÃ©s and drinks between 5.30pm and 7pm every day - on level 22 (I think that's it??) - looking out over Sydney (although not with a view of the Harbour Bridge or Opera House, but good nevertheless. It also ensures you stay on a higher floor and can utilise the quick check out facility rather than having to go downstairs to the reception on level 8 and wait in line. You can also enjoy a quick breakfast on this floor, although we decided to have breakfast on level 8 (the reception floor), as the restaurant has meals cooked to order - a wide selection incl. pancakes, eggs anyway you like, omelettes, sausages, Asian foods and the usual toasts/cereals/fresh fruits and yoghurt. The staff working in the Executive lounge are knowledgeable, friendly and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay and I can't speak highly enough of them. The hotel is smack bang in the centre of the retail area - right next to Myer and a walk across the road to the Westfield shopping complex with its wonderful array of good food in the food court up on one of the higher floors - possibly the 5th floor if my memory serves me correctly. You won't find a hotel located closer to shopping than this one - the Hilton is the next best located, but having stayed at The Hilton last year, I can honestly say this one is better. It has much bigger rooms (particularly if staying on the Exec. level), the beds have a pillow menu and are comfortable (we had 2 doubles by choice, but otherwise the standard is a KS bed). The rooms are quiet, ours had a Nespresso coffee machine, safe and flat screen TV. The bathroom accessories were regularly replenished and the room was spotless. The room-service menu is expensive however, so we only did this once - but in Sydney there are so many options that you can always find something with a short walk - Sunday evenings being a slight exception. The reception is actually on level 8, so the ground floor is only a small opening where the porters are located - to check in you take the lift to the 8th floor, then another lift to your room. I will definitely return to this hotel - the best I have stayed in so far in my travels to Sydney. I stayed here in December 2011 - it is a 10 minute walk to the train station, and then about 6 stops to the airport - about an $18 ride but much cheaper than a taxi and very direct. You can walk under cover via the Queen Vic building, which is full of shops, or via the streets above.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline861
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Swissotel, what a beautiful hotel. The location was fantastic, right in the heart of everything yet the rooms were so quiet, we were on level 18 on the pool side of the hotel and you could hear a pin drop the whole time, we couldn't hear any noise from any other rooms, so peaceful considering its location right in the heart of the city. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend doing the valet parking, so much easier than self parking as the lot is a few blocks away. The beds were extremeley comfortable as were the pillows, I could have slept for days. Easy walking distance to darling harbour (about 10 mins), we have an 8 and 4 year old and they walked it each day no problem. There's a monorail stop about 50 metres from the hotel which is very convenient. The pool stayed open until 9pm each night much to the delight of our 8 year old. We would absolutely stay here again, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Swissotel Sydney NSW”
Reviews.Author: Jan931
Reviews.Content: Have spent many happy times at the Swissotel. The Staff are most helpful, the housekeeping is very good and the rooms are spacious. Christmas Day Dinner was not good. The Buffet was warmed food left from Lunch Time and the display of food quickly disappeared as there was so little of it. The Chef had left for the day and the wait staff did the best they could under bad cicumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: petitmonde
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Sydney for a week over the New Year and simply loved the room. We were in a corner room and the views were wonderful including the New Year's Eve fireworks. It was a nice bright, cheerful room with plenty of space. Location of the hotel cannot be faulted at all. Close to almost everywhere we wanted to go. We love walking and basically walked everywhere. Service was fantastic and at no time could I fault the level of attention we got. For what we initially booked, we got lots of extras including a bottle of wine (nice touch!!). Much appreciated. A lot of things exceeded our expectations. Also, the Swissotel did not jack up their prices over the festive period like a lot of the other hotels in Sydney! Our fellow guests were quite young and at times we did feel a little out of place as we are both over 50 years old. However, this could be due to the time of year. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing! Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Pancettaicecream
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the afternoon but couldn't check in until 5pm! Then the keys that we were given wouldn't work! Went out while they were supposed to be fixed but returned to find that they still wouldn't open our room door! The "fix-it" man then proceeded to display his annoyance at me for having to come & fix the problem twice!! How was it my fault? I was really upset by this. I'm disappointed with how things have turned out. If I could, i would pack up my bags & go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times, but the last one was one of my best stays. This hotel location is central and unparalleled in many ways as it it is just so easy to get around. My room was clean, spacious and comfortable and most importantly I slept well. Breakfast buffet has been hit and miss previously so I didnt try on this last visit, but the lobby bar was a good place for a quiet drink. Staff throughout the hotel seemed much more attentative and helpful on this trip which certainly added to the experience, although rates were higher than previous but this might have been seasonal. Will be sure to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and service, otherwise a let down.”
Reviews.Author: Belinda T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights over New Years with my daughters as it was just across from where we were celebrating. Pros: - Friendly and sincere staff and service - close proximity to most everything - food that we had in room service and at the bar was terrific Cons: - room wasn't ready at 3pm arrival - twin room as requested wasn't available, so had to sleep three of us to a rather small hard as a rock King bed. - the ironing board had stains all over it - after we were changed to a twin room, it stunk of cigarettes, the hair dyer wasn't working, the bar fridge hadn't been cleaned properly and had brown sludge and wilting brown lettuce inside and the sink didn't drain properly so we had to brush our teeth over the bath. - after having a shower it was not very pleasant to find yellow stains on the towel either. - the piece de resistance had to be being woken up at 3am on the final night by my head board banging so furiously from the love makers in the next room!! Thank goodness my girls are deep sleepers and were in the other bed. Charming. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous service and conveniently located in Sydney retail centre”
Reviews.Author: RnR_Report
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - especially if you're planning to do some shopping in the city. Located right next to Sydney Tower with plenty of shops, food halls and restaurants to choose from - right next to train, monorail, bus and taxi transport options and a 15 minute walk to the harbour. Ideal location for overseas visitors. We stayed in a junior suite with club benefits (canapes and drinks between 5.30-7.30pm) and breakfast provided in the club lounge - located on a high floor, the lounge provided good city skyline views towards Darling Harbour. While the selection of canapes was a bit limited (two hot selections, cheese platter and basic tapas) it was ample - good selection of drinks including champagne, wine, beer, spirits and other non-alco beverages which was all self serve - and the supply of food and drink was efficiently replenished by a very courteous and friendly attendant. Breakfast was a big surprise - including continental, fruit, cereals and bircher muesli plus a complete hot breakfast (eggs, potato hash, sausages, bacon etc) Our junior suite was on the top level with an expansive view over the city - spotlessly clean and everything worked (except one TV which was quickly fixed after asking). Large bathroom - oddly shaped, small lounge - good size bedroom. Bed was very comfortable. Courteous service really stood out - from the concierge and reception to the club lounge attendants and the cleaners - they have all been drilled to acknowledge guests and make an effort to be pleasant. The only major complaint for us was the cost of parking at $55 per night - other hotels in the city charge an average of $30-35 - they need to negotiate a better deal for their guests! Overall an enjoyable experience and one to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “â€œGood Stay at Swisshotelâ€�”
Reviews.Author: yv0nnet
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel. This hotel was in a great spot and the rooms were well appointed. The staff was awesome from the front desk all the way through housekeeping. Room is spacious and clean. The only improvement I can think of is the breakfast buffet, which lack of variety. A great stay otherwise !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
