Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel before, this visit was based on location, however the standard we received this time was amazing from check in which was quick and easy to the room which for a city hotel was a very good size and well presented and VERY clean with a large bathroom, housekeeping throughout our stay was excellent and thorough, The service and attitude of the lounge staff was faultless with a "can do" attitude. The usual charged internet access was free all the time in the lounge, the maintenance team were efficient and very courtious, when we had a problem with a window blind at 22,30 one night it was fixed within 15 minutes with a smile. Having stayed at the Hilton recently I found this hotel to be far the better choice and will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5-star material”
Reviews.Author: pigsyACT
Reviews.Content: My family are frequent visitors to Sydney CBD & stayed in many hotels, mostly Citigate @ Central. First timer for Swissotel. Stayed on X'mas & Boxing Day 2011. I rated Swissotel at most 4-star for room & service (but paid 5-star). Would not come back again for the price. Pro: Location - heart of CBD, great for shopping. Good size room. Good size bathroom. Con: Room fittings (in fact the whole hotel) not 5-star standard. No free wi-fi. No newspaper. Bed & mattress in need of renewal. Asked maid personally for extra towel in morning, not there in afternoon, rang housekeeping who delivered after 30+ minutes. Problem parking - difficult drop-off & pick-up. Too many homeless around after dark (society problem).

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: karenko111
Reviews.Content: Just had another stay at this hotel. It is so centrally located it's amazing. We were upgraded to a larger room, with pretty standard city views but lots of room. The staff are always very friendly and helpful. Conceirge are really helpful with leaving the shopping bags there to be delivered up to the room. Wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Sheets”
Reviews.Author: Natalie788
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a place to crash after a Christmas party at Town Hall. Returned late at night to find the sheets were far from clean (a big yellow stain on one side). On check-out, the receptionist did absolutely nothing and when I emailed to complain further all swissotel wanted to do was put together another package for us - like I'd spend more money at a place that couldn't even put clean sheets on the bed!!!! Especially when they are claiming to be a 5 star hotel. Certainly not on cleanliness or service.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Meljadeb
Reviews.Content: Location - fantastic. Cannot fault it. Yes, if you don't know Sydney well it can be a little tricky tucked in there amongst Myer, but once you have your bearings it is a gem. Close to public transport (St James or Town Hall Station). Right near Centrepoint Tower (Just look up - you can always find your way there from the tower). Arrival was an odd experience. The concierge staff were completely bombarded by the Cruise Ship crowds.The hotel cannot help who they have as guests, but I found these 'Cruisers' to be loud, annoying, disrespectful and a general pain!! Check-in was fast and my room was ready early - something I didn't expect. While service was efficient, it wasn't special. The rooms were of great size and the full bathroom was excellent. The only slight complaint I have that there was no power point in the bathroom. Although there was one in the entrance near a full length mirror. The bed was much harder than I anticipated, but surprisingly comfortable. The pillow selection was fantastic. Linen was uninspiring. While the Hotel is nice, the service and atmosphere is lacking something. Not sure what, wish I would put my finger on it - just a certain wow factor. But if it is a big room in a central location you are after - this is your hotel! The best service I received was from Lance, a concierge who can hail a cab like I have never seen! Great customer service. The hotel often has deals on discount sites (eg wotif/lastminute) so look for deals there to get a budget stay! I would be hesitant to book this hotel at 'full price'.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: favourites
Reviews.Content: Great location above Myer and central for shopping. Close to the Monorail. Staff very helpful. We stayed in an Executive Floor room with access to the Executive Club - limited choice of canapes and breakfast choices also limited. Not really a 5 star hotel (I usually stay at the Shangri-La or the Intercontinental) but a good 4 star hotel. I booked erly direct with the hotel by phone and got a very good deal - otherwise a bit pricey for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Woeful experience”
Reviews.Author: Poshladdie
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about staying here but it was a debacle. Noisy room next to elevator. Sub-optimal service. Rip off.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shnapps
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying with the Swissotel people when in Sydney. It is central to everything you may need. Close to trains, monorail and every sort of shopping you could expect to find in the city centre. The staff at the hotel are helpful, hospitable and obliging in the extreme and the ambiance of the hotel is just lovely. Thanks Swissotel, you are second to none!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: cabsavie
Reviews.Content: To get to receptiion you enter at street level via the baggage storage room and take the lift to the 8th level. Arrived just prior to check in time to be informed that their system was down. Presented our copy of the reservation and was advised that our room wasn't ready and to take a seat, they would see how long this would be and advise from here. 20 mins later and no contact from the reservation staff advising any progress we approached the desk to be told yes the room was ready, on Level 13, Our reservation quite clearly stated a 1 bedroom suite on either of the top two levels of the hotel with club access etc! when I asked why we were being placed on lvl 13 the respose was that our room had been allocated to another guest!! I pointed out that our reservation was not subject to availability that it was a confirmed reservation booked 5 weeks earlier and paid for this drew the response of there is nothing they could or would do about it. I actually suspect they had not wanted to honor our booking, asked to speak with management again take a seat and someone would talk to us, another 30 minutes later we were given a change of room a downgrade from the suite to a corner room with balcony on level 20, compensation was offered that to be honest was an insult, after considerable haggling we were compensated a more realistic amount, Only to proceed to the desk to arrange the credit to our card to be told that the amount of compensation per day was now to be for the stay, bear in mind it was now 2 hours after arriving at the hotel, that was it for us, game on needless to say we got what was offered, but by this stage the whole experience was starting to feel like a bad nightmare...... We were booked for three nights, the room was tired, in need of an upgrade and the bed far from what is expected of a five star hotel even if it is self rated! Both mornings we left the hotel only to return to an unseviced room, on the first day a phone call resulted in a room service over an hour later on the second day after a phone call we left the hotel returned two hours later still no room service another phone call and the room was serviced but none of the tea making supplies or bar were refurbished. On the day of check out we were gone by 6.30am we had had enough of the Swissotel Sydney. I strongly advise anyone contemplating a stay here to think twice, there are far better hotels in Sydney, this hotel really is a disgrace. At check out we were asked if we enjoyed our stay!!! our response drew as is quite the norm with the Swissotel Sydney another shallow meaningless apology, this hotel is very good at them, but then again I have no doubt they are well experienced at offering them.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice and in good condition”
Reviews.Author: ContributinTraveller
Reviews.Content: To be honest I've only stayed here before because this hotel was one of the few in Sydney to offer smoking rooms. Sadly, the receptionist told me when I checked in yesterday that those days when the hotel catered to the needs of both sorts of customers - i.e. smoking and non-smoking - ended about 6 months go when Swissotel caved in to external pressures, one can only assume. Having said that my stay for a night this week was quite OK. The room is larger than average. Everything was perfectly clean and the bathroom very good in appearance and function. Very quiet, the television worked and showed a good range of channels in good quality. You can tell the rooms in this place have at least been looked at by designers who've stayed in hotels before. They are functional. Room service was prompt, although ordering something with cheese and finding out it was Swiss cheese was an unpleasant surprise. I would be happy to stay there again, happier if they offered some sort of facility, even basic, to a not small group of visitors i.e. smokers. Then I would give the hotel 5 stars. Location is fantastic, rooms are very good, facilities are also quite OK including the pool area. It is also less than 5 minutes walk from St James Railway station which is 4 stops from Sydney Domestic Airport in 14 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “good and very bad”
Reviews.Author: newgirl3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last night as we were going to a show at the state theatre across the road. No signage as to where reception desk is located just a small concierge area, asked for directions, told it was on the 8th floor. Check in very matter of fact. We were happy with the room on the 19th floor,quite comfortable for a one night stay, not much of a view but quiet and we slept extremely well. Very disappointed with the Crossroads Bar, the service was down right terrible. They ignored constant requests for drink order to be taken and then on one occassion did not deliver a drink at all after ordering, it took 3 requests to different staff members before the waitress who took original order came over and said "Did you want something? 25 mins after original order. Food overpriced and unimaginative, chicken snitzel was not nice. I complained to reception staff on check out, she was very obliging and understood my complaint as they have received similar. She gave me discount on my beverage and food account, which was a nice gesture but as i said to her you can't get the night back again, as it was a special night meeting up with our son and girlfriend, which left us all less than impressed and annoyed to enjoy a show we had been looking forward to seeing.The cafe under Myer a few doors away was great for breakfast and very reasonable. Would stay again if got a good deal but would not utilise the crossroads bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: waggers999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week whilst on business. The location is great as you can walk to Darling Harbour, the rocks, circular quay and you are basically on George street. Hotel was clean and staff friendly. Bit of a pain having to get the lift from street level to reception and then another to you room. Pool area was nice - just a pity an Out the weather!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gabbyw83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend and where quite impressed! As soon as we stepped in we were greeted by the friendly concierge and told where to go to get to the foyer, going up to level 8 we were surprised with how it opened into this large and beautiful area! We were on the 25th floor right next to the cetrepoint tower, it was a nice view! We enjoyed a cocktail in the bar downstairs and again the service was great! Room service and breakfast where also impressive! Overall it was a pleasant experience and we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Little Problems Add Up”
Reviews.Author: Stormeh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a busy weekend, the hotel is a short walk from Town Hall station & you can walk through the QVB if it's raining. Room wasn't ready despite letting the hotel know I would be checking in a couple of hours early but checkin staff made up for this by giving a comp late checkout which was greatly appreciated. Went for a walk through Westfield downstairs, and then up to Hyde park so hotel is in a great location. Lift from street level to lobby (level 8) is slow but from there hotel lifts are quick. I stayed on level 23 which features larger rooms although I noticed that the whole hotel had a sense of spaciousness which is a positive. Loved the actual room again much bigger than average city hotel room, comfy bed & lounge, overlooking city & swimming pool. As others have already said make sure you've planned ahead for internet access because the prices here are steep. The TV seemed a bit old or at least it didn't seem to tune into any HD channels which is odd plus it is turned up full volume each time you turn it on! Bathroom is fine even if the shower is fairly small. Liked the idea of the nespresso machine but unfortunately couldn't get it to work so ended up using nespresso at the exec club. Disappointed to note that no slippers, bath robe, or newspaper were included so I phoned "Swiss Service" to request the bath robe & newspaper. A shabby bath robe turned up hours later presumably when the cleaner had done their work but no newspaper at all. Tried again following day & after 2 hours had to followup on the newspaper request. Ten minutes later it finally arrived! Perhaps the staff are spread quite thin helping out the Concierge (due to valet issue) but the point is one shouldn't have to ask for these basic things at a supposed 5 star hotel. Elected to pay $20 for the brekky once and whilst the omelette was outstanding the rest of the food was average, and the 10min wait for ordinary coffee again disappointing. Outdoor heated swimming pool is very good and there are lockers available. Swissotel has so much potential but is let down by quite basic little issues which accumulate & frustrate. Next time I may pay the little bit extra to stay a couple of doors down at the Hilton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & efficient but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: MaisieGus
Reviews.Content: We recently had to travel to Sydney for business travel reasons and decided to extend the stay by a couple of nights to do some activities with our kids. Staff were very accomodating, even when my 3 year old wet his bed and we needed a mid-afternoon bed change. We dined in the bar one night and this was fine. It's of course very well located in the heart of Sydney but unfortunately you pay a high price for this. If I could extend the budget, I would stay here again for the service and convenience. Unfortunately not much for the kids to do but we brought toys and books for them and the time in the room was minimal. A play area would have been great, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare for travellers with car”
Reviews.Author: Mikkelmann
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in Sydney center. The loctaion is full of work at the moment - Not the hotel itself but around the hotel there is a lot of work going on, Some buildings are build. The Valet Parking is AUD 45 per night and it took them 1 hour to get the car back. They apologized and made the remark on the work going on in the streets, but sorry, they can tell you about the delay when you call to get the car! Rooms are quite big and the bath is as well very nice. Breakfast is not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: annabelle2904
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for Australia Day 2011 and what a gem of a place. Our room was immaculate and the bathroom was big enough to have a party. The view was not the greatest from our room but we weren't that high so maybe some of the others may have been better. But this did not detract from the comfortable bed and quiet room we enjoyed. We also got a package that included breakfast and we were very pleased that the breakfast was so good it exceeded all of our expectations. Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden”
Reviews.Author: W0rldW1de
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is a bit difficult to find, and apparently not well known. location is supreme however in between george and pitt street. also very near darling harbour and town hall rail station. service was not much above average. the biggest disgust experienced was indeed the exceedingly high cost of internet and difficulty accessing once you have registered. during my trips back to sydney, i will definitely compare other hotels before here, such as Hilton or Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: conciergecollection
Reviews.Content: Since the Hilton was fully booked, I took my sister in law's recommendation to try the Swissotel as she stays there as a corporate. Having not visited the hotel since it's original opening I found it to be excellent value. The valet service was seamless on arrival and although the hotel was at 100% occupancy when we checked in, the front desk staff were happy to allocate an Executive floor room.The rooms were spacious, very clean and modern and reasonably soundproof (even close to the lifts). It did take a very long time for our luggage to be delivered to our room on arrival (just under 1 hour). The staff were complaining of a group booking from a cruise ship arriving that day, so I expect this was the cause of the delay. On check-out, several groups in front of us were complaining about the wait time for their cars to be returned from the valet, as the parking station was a few streets over. The concierge desk seemed consistently overwhelmed, but remained professional and friendly. Overall, I would return to this hotel on another occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Not really business hotel”
Reviews.Author: koroua
Reviews.Content: Pros: fabulous location, great staff Cons: interesting weekend crowd, general rooms not great for business travellers The hotel room felt like an Ikea display room (lots of blond wood), but the layout does not factor in people who work from their rooms for many hours. The bathroom was great though - love a decent sized separate shower. Some of the things that should be looked at (since in another response the hotel has marked they are looking at a refurb) include: * Glass topped desks are a problem for a mouse - maybe have a mouse pad available (you can incorporate advertising if need be) * Having the desk chair facing into the room is not great - should look out instead of in which would also then allow you to watch the tv if need be * TV Channels - please, why are there three with advertising on them (hotel, room service and Sydney) !. For those of us that work late into the night and early morning, having the tv on is normal., However when the channels are so limited (no digital and only 2 non-sport/news satellite channels) and very male orientated, it just becomes a bone of contention. * The Bed - not having a top sheet was very strange and actually not sure I was overly comfortable with it. One other noticeable area was the Reception desk, while there are four computers, there was normally two staff on and there were periods of the day when trying to walk past to get to the lifts was extremely difficult because of the backup of people waiting to be served. Would I stay there again - probably, but I will be aware of its limitations. The staff made up for a lot of them. I encountered restaurant, room service, engineering, bell and front desk staff and the training they undergo is a credit to swissotel as they cope with the issues that are raised very well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: geoffps
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to be right smack in the centre of Sydney. We've stayed here a few times and each visit was great. Godd sized room, nice bathroom. Service was a little slow when we asked for more pillows ... but so what? One negative: In-room internet was expensive. That's a no-no nowadays! It should be complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel website misleading!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 - 6 Nov 2011. We believe the Swissotel is a good 3 star hotel. The rooms are in desperate need of renovating, the photos on their website are nothing like the two rooms we saw. Very ordinary. Need more towels, no top sheet. We stayed on the Executive level 25th floor, view was not what we expected. City views yes, but of dingy roof tops....not appealing at all. To be positive, the staff were all fantastic, very helpful. Breakfast was very nice.Overall, a dissapointment as we paid NZD$1000 for two nights, we believe that we could have stayed somewhere much nicer for this money but we were mislead by the hotels own write up and photos.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Salman_QLD
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Swissotel Sydney and this time around we really enjoyed ourselves! First time round - front desk was rude, bell boys didn't have a clue and room key wouldn't work. This time - front desk staff were very polite (even, dare I say it, conversational!), bell boys were also polite and saved us from an over-zealous cabbie and the room keys worked every single time (in the elevator and in the door) - HUZZAH! Overall, a fantastic hotel. The location is the hotel's best asset. Around the corner from shops, restaurants, theatres, etc etc. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_UK_09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above the shopping centre on Market Street so very central. It wasn't a problem that breakfast wasn't included as there was a food court right round the corner that did it's job and lots to choose from too. The room was a good size, had the usual amenities, the bathroom had a separate shower and bath tub. There were laundry facilities on the 11th floor which was convenient although a little pricey given the rubbish Â£/$ exchange rate at the moment! We dined in one evening and didn't have to wait long for our food. The staff were pleasant and helpful especially the concierge who were very informative about how to get to Katoomba. The only minor disadvantage is there wasn't free wifi in the hotel ($10 a day) but I think that's across most Australian hotels which is a little behind the times in that respect, but not to worry there was free wifi in the shopping centre round the corner so we just used that =) All in all, I'd recommend this hotel because it was friendly, pleasant and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fair deal”
Reviews.Author: csansare
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Swissotel in June 2011 and found it to be a average place to stay in considering the rates they charge. Food options are limited and not value for money. The good part of the hotel is the fact that its in the heart of Sydney CBD and close to loads of offices and shopping joints like the Myer's. I was on the 11th floor but the view was not great at all

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Belip
Reviews.Content: :Congratulations on your fantastic staff at the Sydney location. At every encounter from the front door to the domestic staff we have had nothing but positive and courteous assistance. We have stayed at many different hotels in many cities throughout Australia and while often there is one person who excells at customer service I can not ever remember an instance where it has been the whole team to the extent it is here. Travelling with a four year old means a guarded reception at best but every member of your team was great. Thank you so much for making our trip so enjoyable and for your assistance during the testing time of the Qantas grounding.

Reviews.Title: “from bad to worse”
Reviews.Author: c m
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I checked in on a Sunday evening. We needed somewhere for a good nights' sleep before starting a long flight early on Monday morning. Our expectations weren't high to begin with, but we were completely shocked at how bad our experience was. Check in was so-so. The clerk couldn't find our reservation and broke off in the middle of helping us to attend to a very pushy guest who needed attention immediately. OK.... The room was clean and a decent size but outdated and with very pedestrian decor. Despite the reservation and the extra charge for our son to stay in the room with us, only 2 skimpy towels were provided. When we called housekeeping another cheap little towel was promptly delivered. it seemed odd that the Swissotel should be so stingy with towels - but no big deal. There was nowhere convenient to eat dinner outside of the hotel as it was a Sunday night. Our only options in the hotel were the bar area or room service. We opted for the bar thinking it would be quicker. We waited 10 minutes while our waiter ignored us and chatted with her friends. When I finally asked for a menu she was friendly and pleasant enough. Whatever - Australia is not famous for it's good service. Back to the room and off to sleep and everything was fine for a half hour. Then all of a sudden the room lights started flashing on and off. We fiddled with the key card that controlled the lights and finally got all the lights to stay off. And finally went back to sleep. Half an hour later the same thing happened. We called the front desk who sent someone from engineering. He told us to take the key card out and that would ensure that the lights wouldn't come on again. He was right. But when our alarm went off at 4am and we inserted the card to turn on the lights, we were back to disco flashing lights in the bedroom and none in the bathroom. After enduring this nonsense for twenty minutes while trying to pack and get ready to leave, we finally tried our second key card and everything was fine for our last five minutes at the hotel. If only we had been told on the phone or by the engineer that it was a problem with the card, we could have used the other one all along, or had the bad one reprogrammed. I informed the night manager as we left the hotel and he offered a lukewarm and tired apology. After getting home and having some time to cool off, I got in touch with the hotel and suggested a refund or free accommodation at a Swissotel as fair compensation. In the end I was finally offered a free nights accommodation but only valid for the same hotel. If I ever find myself in Sydney again and I have time, I might take them up on it. But I will never ever pay to stay at a Swissotel anywhere else ever again. Apologies are cheap and the Swissotel in Sydney is generous with them. But it's no way to run a business. How about investing in updates including your silly lighting system, and training your staff properly? Maybe then you wouldn't need to spend so much time apologizing to ticked off customers, and you could concentrate on running a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine.”
Reviews.Author: oliver86
Reviews.Content: My title probably implies my sentiment: it was adequate accommodation and nothing more. The rooms were outdated, and I'm not too sure how it's still classed as five stars, but, apparently it is... Essentially, we just needed a place to sleep after dinner, and so it was... fine. Although I enjoyed watching the embarrassment on my brother's (and his wife's) face as member of the desk staff openly hit onto my him, it became really inappropriate and he embarrassed himself big time in front of a lot of guests. My brother was polite, but he kept touching his arm and back, and the tension got so bad I had to walk away! Never do this! It's so unprofessional. His co-workers saw too, so hopefully they have a quiet word to their over-excited friend.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 5 star service!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria36
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying seven nights at this hotel. The location is very good however very dissappointing service for a five star hotel! Check in was smooth and both rooms were immediately available which was good after a long flight. The room was a good size, on checking the room I found three hairs in the bath which would have been quite obvious to the cleaner and another day there was another in one of the cups!!! The service at breakfast is appauling for a five star hotel, I would rate this service as a two star!! We were taken to tables that were not set and then we had to ask for cutlery and cups. The waitresses just walk past and egnore plates that need to be taken away not once but a few times regularly, really annoying to say the least and we got quite fed up of having to ask the staff. On one occassion we spoke to a manager after being taken to a table not ready yet again and then being egnored a few times by staff, he then went away after we told him we needed the table setting, he clearly had not taken any notice and we had to remind him again, he then sent over a waitress immediately, he apologised he had forgotten, not a good example to his staff ( a free cappucino cannot make up for bad service)! The food is ok but often cold, we witnessed a guest complaining about the food being cold. On a positive the young man that greeted us for breakfast was always very cheerfull and polite and it's a shame all the other staff let him down! Yesterday we saw a slight improvement in service but we think that may of been due to the presence of another manager who greeted us very cheerfully, shame this were our last breakfast in this hotel as a far better experience than the other six days! This hotel is excellent for location but if you expect 5 star service then I recommend staying at The Westin or Shangri La! Also a tip if you do stay, if you like a strong cup of tea then ask for your own pot of tea!

Reviews.Title: “Central, efficient, and very busy”
Reviews.Author: stargazeypie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for seven nights at the Swissotel in Sydney. Despite my travel agent advising them of my early arrival after 24hrs flying there was no room ready for me. I was only given one after making quite a fuss. The duvets are rediculously thin and I had to have two extra blankets, both of which had seen better days. The bath towels are small and quite tired. There is no free water in the rooms which I think all 5 star hotels should provide. The pool was constantly over run with noisy screaming children and the tiny gym very difficult to get into. The hotel is however very central, efficiently run, modern and clean. The fact it is on the 8th floor and you need to constantly wait for different lifts (one from the street level to the reception and another to any of the rooms) I found very irritating as they are so slow in coming and very crowded as it is such a large hotel. It does lack the personal service and slick attention of The Sheraton though and comes a poor second. The public areas of the hotel are far too busy and noisy and breakfast, one of my markers in any hotel, is just too like a busy airport. The staff are very helpful and lovely but it just doesnt quite hit the mark for me.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic shopping break!”
Reviews.Author: Dons17
Reviews.Content: I booked one nights accommodation at the swissotel for my sister and I and our two daughters. We had tikets to see Mary Poppins and were looking for a hotel in the heart of the city to do some serious retail therapy!! Staff at conceirge directed us to the 8th floor where reception was located. This was our first time at the hotel and they were very friendly. A great first impression! 'Sue' at check in was professional, warm and extremely welcoming. It was so lovely to be greeted and looked ater by someone so down to earth. Our room was lovely - very clean and spacious with two double beds. It is true about the power point in the bathroom (or lack of) but honestly it was not a problem as there is one just outside of the bathroom - no big deal and probably safer. We had a great view of the city, centrpoint tower and St.Mary's Cathedral. The location was brilliant. Pitt street Mall, QVB, Myer, David Jones all at our doorstep. We caught the monorail down to the Capitol Theatre and absolutely loved the show - it was a quick trip back to the hotel by cab.... The buffet breakfast was very plentiful, fresh and full of variety. I enjoyed a beautiful omeltte made to order and the girls especially loved the fluffy pancakes made on the spot for us (chef wouldn't part with the recipe!!) My only complaint was that our stay was too short! Absolutely every staff member we encountered was friendly, cheerful, helpful and very professional. We left our bags with concierge after check out and did more shopping - not a problem. I would LOVE to stay again. Perfect hotel and location for a mid week city break. Thank you to all the staff at Swissotel - especially Sue!

Reviews.Title: “UP YOU GO, AND THEN UP YOU GO AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: TedJohns
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in a Swissotel, and I expect it will be our last. The location, in central Sydney, is brilliant - right next door to the fabulous Victoria Arcade which has some splendid shops (though the prices, as for the whole of Australia, are steep), and only about five minutes' walk from Darling Harbour. Our room, too, was fine - a comfortable bed (in many ways the most important thing), quietly located and kitted out with all the things you'd expect to find in a five-star hotel. But it was all the other bits which made us feel irritable. First, the entrance to the hotel is a dingy concierge doorway in Market Street, not at all impressive. Second,you must then travel up eight floors to the lobby and the reception area - which is a depressing mixture of brown and minimalist furniture, with lots of empty space, no welcoming colours and a lift (a different lift) that takes you up to the floor where your room is located. The staff are officious and seem to have trouble telling their left from their right, because we were told that the lift was on our right when in fact it wasn't. In the room we found that instead of curtains the windows are covered with functional blinds in an objectionable shade of brown - perhaps this group has decided to follow the mantra that any potentially exciting or dramatic colours might upset someone, so they've opted instead for a sort of uniform drabness. The breakfast is a total rip-off. They wanted to charge us 35 Australian dollars each - that's about 24 English pounds - for something that was pedestrian, mundane and in parts totally offputting. The fruit salad was tinned; the hot buffet wasn't hot; our replenishment cups of coffee didn't come automatically. We actually had the cost of breakfast taken off our bill, because it just wasn't worthy anywhere near 35 dollars. You could do much better than the Swissotel. The Swissotel itself could do much better. It has no personality, no style, no pzzazz. It's all right if you're Swiss, I suppose. TED JOHNS

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sfergo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had an event in the state theatre. The hotel was right across from it and central to everything else, I could even walk to Darling Harbor. I found the staff friendly and the hotel concierge helpful. I also enjoyed the breakfast, I found the price to be quite reasonable compared to other hotels. I couldnâ€™t find anything wrong with the hotel, except maybe the air conditioning outside but earplugs took care of that and the rooms were a lot quieter then other hotel's. I didn't hear any guests throughout the night and had a great sleep. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the middle of town.”
Reviews.Author: Vicki-Anne J
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless and the staff helpful and friendly. The restaurant was exellent great oysters. Everything is just outside door we spent our weekend visiting just one block of Sydney did not need to go anywhere else. My only disapointent was I could only get a New Zealnd reisling by the glass which was not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in downtown Sydney. Great service”
Reviews.Author: Noosatravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September and had 2 x Classic rooms interconnecting for the kids in one room - great bathrooms and fantastic beds with lots of pillows to chose from. Service was fantastic from Concierge (on the ground floor, reception on the 8th !) - breakfast great (because it was included) but disappointed with our dinner in the restaurant. Had to send the steak back because it was overcooked - for almost $40 I expected better. But in all fairness it came back perfect and the French hostess was very apologetic. Gym was great and kids enjoyed the pool. Location is perfect for shopping and you can walk to Circular Quay - bit of a hike but good to tire the kids out. We did the Jetboating which was great but expect to get wet (especially if you sit on the last row !) They gave you a discount too if you say you saw it on the hotel's tv add. If you don't have Breakfast included you can easily go down to the ground floor, turn right, walk about 20 steps and you in the Myer Centre with a great little baquette shop where you can pickup a cheap coffee and roll. This hotel certainly offers great service - we had a problem with the tv remote and called and technician was there in less than a minute I think - If you rang for anything they were there so quickly. We would definitely stay again !

Reviews.Title: “Dreary, overpriced claustraphobic hotel - don't stay”
Reviews.Author: kzw4nc
Reviews.Content: Disappointing hotel in so many respects. Only positive is the central location. On the negative side there are no views (odd since so high up). The furniture is very worn out - see photos. Always queues at reception. Room, although large was very dull. Wireless internet, while expensive, was also difficult to operate, and was constantly failing. * Room didn't have the 'fabulous city views' as promised. On level 13 so only views of other buildings nearby. I was really wanting a fantastic city view, like the harbour view I'd had at Sydney Shangri-la for the same price, earlier that week. * No plasma tvs as promised - both were the smaller screen LCDs. * Wireless internet difficult to set up and required several calls on 59 to the help desk. Wireless rate was per device not per room, making it even more expensive. Most hotels have not charged for wireless internet for many years! * safe too small so laptop wouldn't fit inside it. * I ordered some food from room service. It never turned up. * Furniture in room poor quality. The sofa collapsed when I sat on it! * Fridge contents not replaced day to day, once I'd used anything. * fabric on armchairs very frayed and worn through (photo) * noisy - could hear the buskers down on the street from the room. No double glazing in room to reduce noise. All in all a big dud of a hotel. Paid AUD359 per night for a 1 bedroom suite...

Reviews.Title: “Business Type Hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: glenio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Nice big rooms, very friendly staff. Downside was price of breakfast which was very pricey! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “reaaly well done”
Reviews.Author: brainlessAL
Reviews.Content: this hotel clearly strives to make visitors welcome - service was first class fast and efficient without fuss and all the time friendly and courteous. A little expensive but worth it for the lack of stress and efficiency of a well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ralee21
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to mall. Spacious room, good room service - fantastic Club Sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Good service!~”
Reviews.Author: Canise
Reviews.Content: Staffs are very nice and friendly. Location is very good. Room is spacious. Only downside is that they do not have free wireless..

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Yourerightthereted
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as you would expect for the price. Wifi extremely expensive. Some staff quite rude, trying to run a business and being rude doesn't work! Overall: Ok, but lots of other options in town.

Reviews.Title: “Well up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bruce in West Oz
Reviews.Content: Being from the west (Perth), I haven't really been a fan of Sydney. To me, it was grey, crowded and just plain frenetic. My accommodation experiences were underwhelming too. However, this time was different. The entrance to the hotel is a little off-putting, stuck in the middle of a Myer store, but once up to the lobby on the 8th floor, the situation changes. Let me say from the outset that the hotel's largest asset is, undoubtedly, its staff. They were, unfailingly, pleasant, considerate, courteous and gave the impression that they were there only to help you enjoy your stay. I like that; it reflects very well on management. I hope they continue to see this as a priority. The hotel may not have all the whiz-bang bling of some, but it was well maintained and scrupulously clean. My room on the 21st floor (non-smoking, thankfully) was more than large enough for my needs, with a good quality bed, flatscreen TV, desk, a couple of chairs, a pod coffee maker (yes!) and a large, clean bathroom with bath and separate shower. Water pressure was good and it was hot. If I have a niggle it's this; c'mon guys, a few more channels on the TV wouldn't hurt, surely ... not everyone likes Fox Sport ... In-room internet access is available ... at a price. I'm not a fan of paying, but it is pretty standard in Australia, I know. The location is great, right in the CBD. Darling Harbour (what a great job they've done of that!) is just an easy 10-minute walk or, if you're particularly lazy, there's a monorail station even closer than that -- $9.95 for a day pass from memory. All the shopping areas/stores are also within easy walking distance, if that's your particular bent. Food in the hotel was good without being spectacular; it was fairly standard fare at fairly standard prices. Full buffet breakfast was $35; the wagyu burger in the bar area was very good. Drinks are standard prices; that is, by overseas standards they are expensive ... welcome to Australia. However, there is a Coles Liquorland just a couple of blocks away if you prefer a quiet drink in your room. I have to make particular mention of the dining room staff ... they all deserve a pay rise just for being so pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and weekend!”
Reviews.Author: jesad87
Reviews.Content: Great location and amazing service but for the money the rooms were not the best - terrible spring beds and a poor quality tv. Although, considering the location we were not staying there to watch movies. The staff were friendly and made an effort to create a personal touch to our stay. Although the bathrooms could be considered dated they were immaculate. Overall a great location and lovely service just be mindful of the quality of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed on a number of occasions and will again”
Reviews.Author: JeremyC-99
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed 3 nights at the Swissotel and have stayed here on a number of occasions previously over several years. This is a very good hotel option in central Sydney. The strong positives are: the rooms are typically a good size with large bathrooms; I have always found the staff at reception and the concierge service to be extremely friendly and helpful; the hotel is well maintained and in clean line tasteful decor throughout; the cocktail bar area is well appointed and pleasant and a good place to rendezvous with people; the hotel will match best available rates for the hotel offerred by other providers (ie you can deal with the hotel direct); WiFi is now free .... Well Done on this last point Swissotel I find the charging for internet in most hotels in Sydney inappropriate and increasingly out of step with hotels overseas. The hotel really is in a great central city location - easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Hyde Park and the Museums and Galleries at that end of town and not an unpleasant walk down to Circular Quay. The location is bang in the middle of Sydney shopping and on the doorstep of the QVB. Despite the central city location every room I have ever stayed in has been quiet - not true of many other hotels I have used in the CBD area My points of caution are for car travellers. There is no drive way off the road if driving yourself which means you have to find on-street parking outside of the hotel on busy Market Street and the hotel entrance can be hard to spot. Tip: Get in the hard right lane on Market Street and pull into the first free spot you find along the kerb as you pass the Pitt Street Mall then walk to the entrance - the concierge will deal with the car parking from there. The other observation for car travellers is the cost of overnight car-parking. At $55 per night this is a bit more than I usually get charged at other Sydney hotels - be aware of that extra cost. I will continue to use Swissotel as a very good hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service and large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lukmi
Reviews.Content: I don't know whether I was plain lucky or what but I got one large room and bathroom this time around. My first stay at the Sydney Swissotel was terrific. The staff was lovely and quick at both check-in and check-out. Nice looking room, comfortable beds and clean all round. The location is terrific, right in the middle of the city. If you get a good online deal like I did, I totally recommend it for business and leisure travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jodie A
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed another fantastic stay at Swissotel Sydney on the weekend. We couldn't fault any area of our stay. Our room was perfect, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the facilities & restaurants etc were perfect! We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when staying in the city. And wouldn't hesitate to reccomend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel, excellent service. Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: 2happyvisitors
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute. Amazing views from room. Excellent service in foyer bar. Classic rooms spacious, clean, comfortable, lovely bathroom. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour, 2 mins to Myer. Room service breakfast was on time and tasty. Wine selection and evening meal very good. Stayed here on my own on business for 2 nights and felt very comfortable. All staff excellent from front of house to room service. Very impressed. Booked on late rooms.com for less than half price. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Swissotel Sydney after getting the deal from Lastminute.com.au's secret hotel at AUD190. Pros : - Right in the heart of CBD and shopping area. Just steps away from Queen Victoria Building, Myers, David Jones, Pitt Street Mall, Westfiled etc - Fast check in - Clean bathroom Cons - Located at Market street, which is always jammed especially during office hour - Hotel room (furniture and fittings) very dated. Needs to be refurbished asap - no free wifi in lobby / common area - Parking at AUD55 for 24 hours - Concierge needs approximately 20mins+ to get the car driven to the hotel door step, especially during peak hours - Bed not very comfortable - The smell of clorine/detergent used to clean the bathroom was very strong. Could still smell it after hours it was cleaned

Reviews.Title: “Still Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: Having stayed to the SwissÃ´tel Sydney before we knew it would be superb! We were excited to be taking the family with me to the hotel (for their first visit) as we were all in the city for a 21st birthday celebration. Â  On check in, we were met by the General Manager, who thanked me for returning to his superb hotel, introduced himself to all of our party, and confirmed we had all been upgraded to suites - absolutely superb! The rooms are large, airy, light and well appointed with a Nespeesso Machine, huge bathroom (with both a shower and separate bath) LCD TV, couch and huge comfy bed.Â  The hotel has a beautiful reception area with a very trendy bar and lounge.Â  It's close to everything including the new Westfield Sydney, Centrepoint Tower, a short walk to Darling Harbour and close to the CBD.Â  The concierge and desk staff are friendly and professional. The room service and house keeping staff are very very attentive.Â  This is a superb hotel - my favorite in Sydney! Thank you SwissÃ´tel!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Colin S
Reviews.Content: It was our 40th anniversary and we spent night cellebrating. From the minute we arrived at the Swissotel we were made to feel important. We were given an upgrade to the executive level and found a welcome gift of chocolate dipped strawberries in our room which set the mood for the stay. The staff was great, nothing we asked for was too much, the food was amazing, (a 770gram rib eye steak!) wow. The wine was resonably priced was perfectly suited to our meal. Overall a wonderful experience my wife and I recommend the place to everyone. Col Stead

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mj02
Reviews.Content: Booked a bed and breakfast package and so glad we did. The buffet breakfast was delicious, with a vast selection of food to choose from. Ordered room service and very pleased with quality of food. Room was very clean and comfortable even with an extra cot for our baby. Handy location for city shopping and short walk to darling harbour or monorail station.

Reviews.Title: “only ok”
Reviews.Author: bagobones33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon, when i booked the hotel I asked for early check in but when we arrived the receptionist said the room wasnt ready yet but that she would ring us to let us know when it was. Lets just say Im still waiting on the phone call. The hotel was nice, with the room we booked it gave you admission to the executive lounge which was ok for breakfast but you wouldnt spend alot of time there. Its a good location but i wont be returning as for the money we paid it just wasnt worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: GrooveJunky
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I are from Sydney but decided to stay at the Swissotel on a Saturday night to treat ourselves. We know Sydney very well of course and have to agree with the other reviews - the location is fantastic. It is right in the heart of the city and is close to shopping, restaurants and bars. Highly recommend the QVB for shopping and the Ivy entertainment complex nearby. From the street you can't really see much of the hotel but once you get to the lobby it opens out into a beautiful space. This is a plus as it is quiet and you don't feel like you are right in the middle of a noisy city. The room we stayed in was top class. Very clean, nice selection of pillows, great bathroom and nice views of the city skyline. Couldn't be better. The only thing that could be improved would be to have closer parking but that can't really be helped. The parking at Kent street a few blocks away is fine.($25 flat rate). A special mention must go to the doorman that greeted us. He was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful with directions to parking. Good job! From the street level, this hotel is hidden but once you reach the lobby on level 8 it is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ooiandfamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 2 nights from 13/8 - 15/8. We had the KidsFull Room comprising of 2 adjoining rooms. The rooms were very spacious. Service was efficient and breakfast was good. THe location is good with shopping just at your doorstep. Darling Harbour is 5 minutes walk and the Rocks and Opera House about 10minutes walk.The only complain from our children (9 and 13) was that their rooms was a bit too childish. Thank you to all the staff at the hotel for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSpecialistNL
Reviews.Content: This is my absolute favourite Hotel in Sydney! From the street there is just a tiny hall with a concierge and the lifts. The lobby is located on the 8th floor (above the Myers department store). Lovely lobby with a lobby bar/restaurant. Reception were very efficient and friendly, room was great, with a Nespresso coffee machine in the room, so not only do they offer free coffee facilities in the room but it's good coffee and not powder! Housekeeping was good, the lovely Australian lady even asked me if I would like some extra coffee as she noticed I was a real coffee drinker! Location of the Hotel is great, right in the heart of the city, Opera House, Circular Quay and Botanical gardens all within walking distance. Breakfast was also good. I can certainly recommend this Hotel for a stay in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “City to Surf Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Vanderhum46
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the 2011 C2S. The room was great, noise minimal and the air conditioning controls a life saver. After our pre race pasta dinner, we returned to the room to a flier wishing us luck and three bottles of water, muesli bars and boxes of sultanas. The pool was heated just enough to make a post run dip bearable (several runners had the same idea) and the massaging shower head perfect for the cold water shower. The valet parking takes about 30 mins to retrieve your car, not the 20 they advise; keep this in mind if you have an appointment. The attendants at the concierge always asked if we needed directions as they handed over keys. Drop off can be tricky with the limited spots, Sydney traffic and naughty drivers illegally parked. When arriving, stay in the most right lane.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. My sister and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. Our room was beautiful with a huge bathroom. Friendly staff, beautiful cocktails and the buffet breakfast was pretty delicious. Fantasitc location to all the best shops!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with decent price”
Reviews.Author: LinenBank
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in the same price range Swissotel Sydney has more to offer. It has nicely designed rooms and the whole atmosphere is relaxing and stylish. If you are able to get to the executive lounge you will admire the views from there and enjoy the good service. And when you go back the staff will remember you.

Reviews.Title: “Central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Vicki C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very central on Market Street. It was very friendly with the general manager personally welcoming us as we checked in. It was a very pleasant stay and I will recommend the hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot Top Service”
Reviews.Author: Susie D
Reviews.Content: Really top location.... and the service was above and beyond in the most friendly and genuine way. It felt like a little haven in the centre of the hub of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1989
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Swissotel for one romantic night in Sydney and we thought it was great! Service was wonderful, rooms are huge and welcoming, the outdoor pool even though we didn't use it was amazing! there are only 2 downfalls 1- The breakfast is really expensive if its not included in your room rate, $35pp.. 2- The beds are really hard!!!! all in all we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Citikitty
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is its location. Smack bang in the middle of town right near Town Hall station. Most other things are pretty ordinary. The food service is very expensive and simply not worth it. $50 for a steak: come on. It was tough and not cooked to order. I asked for a particular sidd and it didn't come. The wine is expensive but not goof value forth quality. The rooms themselves were ok but nothing to write home about. The hand vasin in my room had a big crack across it. To be fair, the linen was very well laundered and the beds comfortable (although better pillows would have been better). All in all not worth the money -- when everything was put together I'd paid hundreds of dollars for an ordinary experience. Not bad just ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: noel81
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic night at this hotel. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. May did a fab checkin for us and the guys on the concierge desk were oustanding. The hotel is in a great central location, easy walk to shops, movies, restaurants and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Best location! Next to everything!”
Reviews.Author: AthenaTravelManiac
Reviews.Content: I have to say how I love this propety. Large room, large bathroom with big bathtub. Bed quality is not too bad. Just a second walk to big shopping centers & food court. 1 min walk to Queen Victoria Building and George Street. And the Central Park is not so far from this hotel. That's all we need for our Sydney Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: AlexofMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here years ago, and couldn't remember much of what to expect. What I received was sensational location, friendly staff from wo to go, lovely room - not huge perhaps but big bathroom and perfectly comfortable room. What was impressive was how clean it was, how well it was appointed ...very few scuff etc. Buffet breaky good if service patchy - though very friendly. Room service I had the burger and the burger was delicious. The accompanying fries a little on the cold side. Overall, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Bravo you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Seyahbiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 5 nights. Good hotel, good room, but just a little pricey for what you get. Prices in Sydney are getting a little out of hand now, and $35 for buffet breakfast is quite excessive. We were in a group that paid $215 pn average for room only. That means if you were an international business customer paying for breakfast, Internet, and maybe some laundry might mean you won't have much change from $300 per day. Having stayed at other Swissotel locations in more expensive cities, I have received Club Room for the same price. Supply and demand, but there comes a time when the value doesn't follow the price. The hotel has an 18m lap heated outdoor pool, just long enough to keep the fitness up, and all weather which made the stay better. In summary, great hotel, food ok, but a bit overpriced, at least when I stayed there. And, as per most Aussie hotels, service is good but not perfect due to overall lack of staff numbers to serve the clientele.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hospitality with a spacious, quiet room.”
Reviews.Author: ResearchGeophysicist
Reviews.Content: In addition, it is a great location. A few blocks from both St. James and Town Hall railway stations (you walk through Queen Victoria building, which is full of shops, to get to Town Hall station). Really nice, spacious room with a luxiurious bathroom that was very quiet, even with the heat going (it was winter after all). I was on the 23rd floor with a nice view of Sydney high rises. Small refrigerator, coffee machine (that we might call an espresso machine) and mini-bar were in the room. Hyde Park, shops, restaurants are all nearby. The hotel actually starts on the 8th floor and goes on up, although the concierge is at street level. This makes it private and quiet. I had a special rate with free internet, based on a more-than-3-nights stay. The internet was good -- I could either plug in directly or use the wireless. The very best thing was the hospitality. My colleague and I were talking in the hall before checking out, knowing that we were about to face a delayed international flight back to the U.S. when the general manager stopped by and offered to help. He sensed our distress, which was thoughtful in itself. Although he couldn't do much about the airline situation, he did arrange for us to get a free coffee and croissant to take with us on the way to the airport, which certainly lifted our attitudes! Once I was back in the U.S., I realized that I had left an item of clothing behind. They found it and agreed to send it back (I paid the postage). I have left quite a few items behind in motel rooms, and this is the first time that it was actually in the lost-and-found. I would definitely go back to Swissotel Sydney, and recommend it to others. My only complaints are that the bed was too firm for me (but I like softer beds than most people) and that the associated restaurant seemed over priced.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobsterSG
Reviews.Content: Excellent room & housekeeping services provided by the hotel. Rooms are nicely decor and comfort. Feels like home away from home. Only had one request with the hotel is to have those disposable slippers available for guest as business travellers tends to travel light without that in our luggage. Other than this, it's a good hotel with an excellent location in the city. Food court is just around the corner and shopping malls are just downstairs of the hotel. Ideal place for business travellers and family stay too. Will be back soon again to stay. Good job Swissotel! Never disappoint me so far.... =)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel...service was a bit dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: PacificPrincess075
Reviews.Content: The reason for selecting this hotel out of many Sydney CBD Hotels was due to it's location. Right in the heart of the city, immeadiate proximity to the Pitt Street Mall and Westfield's shopping precincts and as we had tickets to see a show at the Theatre Royal, it was the perfect walking distance to the Theatre. Word of Warning: If you are a Sydney sider and are driving to the hotel....the parking can be a nightmare! You need to battle the one way traffic of Market Street and pretty much just pull up where you can. The hotel does provide enough standing zone space for three cars maximum however, these spaces are usually taken up by Taxi's, loading vehicles, motorbikes, mopeds or scooters, so if you are lucky enough to snare a spot, grab it or risk pulling up and getting out for a valet to take your car. Note; if you miss the hotel it is a big trip back around two blocks to get back to the hotel...in Sydney traffic! The check in process was smooth and easy with impeccable friendly staff at valet, concierge and reception and our room was ready. Our room was impeccable. We had chosen a Junior Suite which also gave us access to the Executive Club Lounge for canapes, drinks and breakfast. The bathroom was large with a bath, shower and separate toilet however, I was baffled that there was not one power point in the bathroom to plug any appliance into. There is already a small hairdryer provided which is plugged into a concealed vanity, so you cant unplug it to use the power point for any other appliance such a a hair straightener. I had to use the power point at the office desk, to which the hall mirror was too far away so I didn't have a mirror to use...as we were going out int h evening, this was quite annoying and frustrating. Prior to our show, we decided to go into the Executive Club Lounge for some pre-dinner drinks and canapes. There was only one staff member on who was friendly and pleasant upon our arrival and mentioned to us in conversation that "itwas a quiet night there that night". Unfortunately, quiet or not, the service offered in the Executive Club that evening was very, very poor and really unacceptable for the price paid for the suite and extra's. Bottle's of spirits ran out and were not replaced. I had glasses piled up on my table with plates and cutlery that sat there while the staff member on duty just walked around and talked to people an d at one stage was not even on the floor for a good 20 minutes or so. The ice ran out and was not replaced and the wine and small glasses also ran out and were not replaced. I was really very dissapointed in the way the Executive Lounge was attended to that evening. It is such a shame as the rest of our stay was wonderful, with great service in all other area's of the hotel. Finally on my return home, the Swissotel emailed me with a review of which I gave my honest opinion and now a month after completing that review, I have not had any response to it by the hotel. Why bother emailing out a review if you cant be bothered responding to the comments and constructive critisisim given ? With so many other choices in Sydney I am not sure if I will return...

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Held high hopes on booking swissotel but it was a reasonably forgettable stay in hindsight. The Room was spacious but in need of a refurb. Room service food was below average. The Breakfast selection was wide but service wasn't very attentive. Location is the main thing in it's favor.

Reviews.Title: “Return visitor. Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelbyken
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel. Amazing service! On our recent wedding anniversary we stayed for our second time here. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and the staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable and relaxing. This is a first class hotel, with first class service and food. Thanks Swissotel for another memorable stay. We'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsNRyan
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our weekend; Great location near all the premium shop and the theatre we were attending Felt like we were staying at a very posh private club Service and attitude of staff was genuine and pleasant. The concierge has to be the coolest man under pressure that I have ever seen, and so very welcoming. Room was lovely and spotless and we loved the pillow menu Try breakfast in the window seats, what a great start to the morning We only had breaky but is was super fresh and well serviced. Overall a lovely hotel with service we have only ever experienced in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “good location bed very firm”
Reviews.Author: tobey4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night for our wedding anniversary. We got upgraded on check in to a high level room which was well equipped and pleasant. We had a nice meal at restaurant assiette in surrey hills. checkout was reasonable at 11am and they stored bags etc. The only issue we had was the bed. It was firm on a scale of 1 to 10 it was an 11. We were there on a credit card fee night so I am not sure on the pricing

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Tanya1511
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at the Swissotel Sydney in June of 2011 for our Ten year wedding aniversary. The experience could not be faulted. From the moment of check in we felt welcome (Sue did an outstanding job) and were excited to be back. They hotel upgraded our room to the executive level (wonderful) and also gifted us some Champagne. The staff took an active interest in our activites during our stay and we will be back. Room was great, well maintained and the view fantastic. Location is not to be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10 overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: scottbaxter77
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Swissotel Sydney on a couple of occasions now and have absolutely loved the experience every time. A terrific location right in the centre of the Sydney CBD but due to the nature of the hotel it is peaceful and quiet. Stunning Sydney views from our room with everything Sydney has to offer at the hotel front door. The hotel staff are terrific, and the rooms and the hotel facilities are first class. We love the fact that we are recognised as regular customers and the team at the Swissotel go the extra mile to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. I cannot speak highly enough of our overall experience at the Swissotel Sydney. Absolute 10 out of 10 experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just right, and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: OzWino
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there for work for 3 days, and I was suitably impressed. I'm lucky/unlucky enough to travel a lot for work and generally focus on high-end travel and experiences. Usually it is the service which makes a visit. And in this case service was very good. Yes it has all the usual 5 star things (I dont really pay much attention to star ratings anyway). But the staff were very good. The hotel was at 100% capacity due to ashcloud-flight cancellations and it appeared (from the guests perspective) that everything was running perfectly. Lots of staff to help tired and frustrated guests. The welcome and check-in was fast, efficient, and very friendly. I requested a pillow from the pillow menu, and it was delivered within a few minutes. The room was a very good size, with the usual contemporary finishes. I'm not up with my Swiss design, but it didnt leap-out as being Swiss/European, or even Australian. I rated sleep quality less than normal as I didnt sleep very well. But this is nothing to do with the room/pillow etc. I guess sometimes I take a while get used to a new place. There was a problem the television, which housekeeping helped with; needed to be turned off and on at the wall, then turned on with the remote. Annoying, and probably shouldnt happen, but no major issue. The location is perfect, both for business and pleasure. Would I stay here again? Most certainly. Well done to the whole team at Swissotel. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyMetcalfe
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on the weekend 24th and 25th June for his Birthday and we loved every minute of staying at the hotel. The premier corner balcony room was gorgeous and had a beautiful bathroom that was very large. The shower had excellent water pressure and was very large and easy to move around in, unlike other hotel showers. The only thing that was negative was that we ran out of time to indulge in a bath in one of the deepest baths I've ever seen!! The bed provided a much needed deep sleep and the room boasted amazing city views especially from the balcony. The Reception service was impeccable! Absolutely delightful and could not fault it both ladies we dealt with treated us very well and did everything they could to make us happy, including a late checkout. The room attendants did an excellent job and even left chocolates for us on our bed. We will definitely stay at Swissotel again and this time we will remember our bathers for the very inviting pool!! A big thanks to the staff for makiing our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “7 hour stay.”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SwissÃ´tel again for a brief stop in Sydney.Â  The check in staff were superb as always - very friendly and welcoming.Â  The room was good, with two large windows and ample closet space. It was a bit hard to adjust the air-conditioning making the room quite cold, bit otherwise no complaints.Â  The bathroom was good with a very nice spacious hot shower, a welcoming thing in winter! Room service breakfast can be ordered the night before via a breakfast card located in the bed side drawer.Â  Breakfast was continental for me but a full english is available.Â  Check out was professional, friendly and quick.Â  A short walk from the seminar I was attending, the concierge offer to get you a taxi and take your bags without being prompted - as expected from a 5-star hotel.Â  Will be back to SwissÃ´tel.Â

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: onthewaythere
Reviews.Content: Went to Sydney for conference. very reasonably priced room. Its quoted as 5 star but its really 4.5 in my view. Staff friendly. Room large, clean with nice decor. Would stay again on price

Reviews.Title: “Good, but lifts annoying”
Reviews.Author: DadTravelOrganiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, well appointed and has a good location right in the heart of the main shopping precinct. Breakfast is good, but nothing special. The lift situation is, however, my major complaint. Every time you come and go you must catch one of three lifts to the reception area, walk a distance across this, and then get in another of three lifts to go to your room. It is slow and annoying if you come and go (eg for a run in the morning, return to your room, then leave for work).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: KevinMichelle
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is in an excellent location - right in the heart of the city and for those who love to shop Pitt Street Mall is right outside the door! The staff at the hotel immediately made us feel welcome - from concierge through to the staff at reception all were friendly and incredibly helpful. Check-in was quick and easy and the twin room great. Our room on the 19th floor had two double beds and was clean, modern and lovely. Traffic noise - we couldn't even hear it! On leaving, concierge arranged our return taxi to the airport. What a find this hotel is, we would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cparkes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night break with 2 small children, i believe we were in a classic room-which was great for the 4 of us. The hotel is in a fantastic location, just around the corner to Pitt St mall and close to monorail and train stations. Concierge staff were very helpful and the hotel is well maintained. It appears more suited to business/corporate travellers, so we didnt eat in the restuarants or bar which looked nice if we hadnt had the children with us. Would definitely stay again based on location. We did brave the heated pool/spa which was pleasantly warm for this time of year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good breakfast, very simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: Trident1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located and offers a nice breakfast buffet. Prices at restaurant are far too high, rooms are ok but not charming nor luxurious at all and noise from neighbouring rooms can be heard, I expected much more from a hotel in this price category. Still, the location compensates for it!

Reviews.Title: “great new menu cant wait to return to eat again!”
Reviews.Author: fastapasta
Reviews.Content: i travel to sydney often and have stayed at the hotel before. The food has always been good but the new menu is exceptional. I had room service and ate in the restaurant, both were fantastic.Highlight was the scallops and pork belly. Service was ok, the restaurant is need of a refurbishment. Overall a good stay location is a1.

Reviews.Title: “Crossroads Bar a Shambles”
Reviews.Author: BigRedAl99
Reviews.Content: This bar should be good. Great location and ambience, spacious, cool. Unfortunately, management systems and staff let it down. We had drinks and snacks for 4. Only a few other people around so no rush. The drinks ordering system is cumbersome. Waiter takes order, drops it at bar, somebody else prepares it, waiter eventually comes back and then serves. Takes about 20 minutes to get a drink. They forgot a complex order (2 Coronas please) and I had to chase it. The snacks were a couple of pizzas and salad. The salads were OK. Pizza was dry and overcooked. I expect a lot better for $26 per pie. I paid the bill for $142 by card, then later found they'd billed me three times and refunded it once. After a week I still haven't managed to get that sorted out. Staff seem to try, but the result is inept. The hotel needs to take a long hard look at itself.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sydney, international standard, but deals available”
Reviews.Author: GeoffW1
Reviews.Content: From an unassuming entrance on Market St in the Sydney CBD, this hotel seems to open out like a flower into an impressive space on L6 for check in, with a large attractive atrium containing a bar/coffee lounge, very light and high-ceilinged, and charmingly decorated. After check in, a security lift takes you to floors which have wide corridors, and rooms which, if all like ours (R2125), feature large windows with drapes and sun screens, large well finished bathrooms with a bath, and very adequate cupboards and bag space. There was a small coffee perc machine which was very welcome, although the steam feature is disabled for child safety. Understandable. Rooms are well insulated against noise, we never heard any intrusive effect from anywhere. You should ask for a room looking to the East, since this would be the best outlook, although North would also be good. The windows do not open, however A/C was very good and quiet. The bed was large and quite firm, and a selection of different pillows is available, from foam filling to pine shavings! This would be good to try out. Breakfast is very good, with a wide selection of cereals, excellent hot and cold food, and eggs made to order. The staff are numerous and attentive, although cutlery was a bit hard to get hold of. Check in and check out and baggage handling is efficiently run, if a bit fragmented. Parking and bags are handled by the concierge staff at street level, not by the check in staff, so you have to ask for lots of details from everyone if unsure. Outside the street entrance there are only about 4-6 places for cars to pull in at the kerb, so for parking, make sure you are fully informed before you go there. Valet parking was $55 (possibly worthwhile), self parking $25, at this date. There is also a very well equipped fitness centre on L10 with exercise eq't, spas, and an outdoor heated pool. The appearance of the pool area however was spoiled by many cigarette butts scattered around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy&Gary
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Swissotel and as there was a group of us we stayed in various styled rooms which were all a good size with lovely views and absolutely spotless. The bathrooms are fantastic, nice & big with all Swiss good quality toiletries provided. The beds are huge and very comfortable and the pillow menu is the best we have seen, so many choices! From check in to check out everything was a breeze with very helpful, friendly front desk staff, whenever they saw us there would be a smile and a chat about what we were doing for the day etc. We spent quite a lot of time during our stay at Crossroads Bar where once again service was quick and always with a smile. Breakfast choices were excellent; there is enough to keep the fussiest eater happy. I must say a special thank you to Phill Thomas from the Executive Club Lounge, what a gem he is, always so happy and full of advice on places for us to visit in Sydney. I am sure this guy is a walking encyclopedia, we did everything he suggested and had a great time Without his help our holiday would not have been anywhere near so special. Also thank you to Iche, what a lovely lady, we loved chatting to her.
