The location of Swissotel is so central to absolutely everything, though it was a bit dangerous having a huge Myers next door, so needless to say there was quite a few shopping bags upon checkout!. Pit Street Mall is a 2 minute walk away and Darling Harbor about 5 minutes. I would have no hesitation in staying at the Swissotel again and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jenny239
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the night of my wedding, payed for everything online under my husbands name but was refused check in when i only had my ID and Credit card. Was left at the reception counter in my wedding dress and after asking if i could sit in a lounge of some sort, reception lady by the name of "CRISTINA" said "NO." I was then told that "anyone off the street could be doing what i did" my response was "In a wedding dress with my own ID and CREDIT CARD?" She showed no sympathy and I was told to move aside so she could serve other customers! I'm not saying that all the staff were bad but this particular lady was hopeless!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: FionaLambert
Reviews.Content: we booked to stay here through wotif.com after initially looking to rent a self catered apartment from which to explore sydney we found this to be a very good price for us to have a very comfortable room, our flight landed at 0530 the day we were checking in so i wrote to the hotel to ask how early we could check in not expecting a positive response but we got a nice reply and when we arrived after a 24hr flight from france we were given our room at 6am!!, very good..... staff very nice would reccommend here for a good base in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but disconnection between booking site and hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We got a classic room for the weekend. We booked the 'Endless Weekend' package which gives you late breakfast and late checkout. The stay was nice, room was clean and quiet with lovely view of the Centerpoint Towel, Hyde Park, the harbour and more. Service was good. Bathroom was nice and big. There was a big disconnection between Swissotel's global booking site and the hotel itself though. The booking site says breakfast till 2pm but the hotel says till 10.30. We told the hotel that we wanted late breakfast hence the reason we booked this package. So the front desk staff told us we could order in-room breakfast. But at checkout a different staff wanted to charge us $80 and told us the breakfast had to be eaten in the hotel restaurant (this was later sorted after a lot of checking and explanation). Also the housekeeping staff came into the room at their usual cleaning time which was before our late checkout time. All in all we had a pretty good experience but the miscommunication did add some unneccessary stress to our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Sydney; Sydney at Heart”
Reviews.Author: Shameek
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for 1 week at end of Sep 2010. I was booked on Swiss AdvantageTwin Room on 11th Floor. The room rate was 215 AUD. The room was big with a proportionate bathroom. From the window, I could see the Sydney Tower and tall skyline of Sydney's business district. On my arrical, I was told that internet was not included in my package and breakfast was included. Then next morning, we observed that we were being asked for breakfast options. On our enquiry, the staff told us that we can avail of a coupon for week's internet access but our breakfast was not included. The breakfast cost us at 17 AUD. The hotel has a large lobby (with restaurant, reception and conf rooms) at 3rd level. The hotel is on busy market street just next to Myers and Monorail station. Darling harbor and sydney opera house is on walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bar area needs a major review”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie2000
Reviews.Content: We had the "pleasure" of having a few friends for drinks and dinner at the Crossroads Bar on Saturday night prior to a show over the road. We arrived at 6pm with plenty of time for drinks and a bite to eat. After waiting 15 minutes to order our first round of drinks, we ordered at the bar and they arrived without fuss. We then ordered food which was slow in coming and after about 50 minutes, we inquired where it was. We were informed that it had not been ordered, and that it would be ordered now and would come soon. A hastily prepared steak sandwich arrived, which was raw and duly sent back. We left with a weak apology, no food, an offer of more drinks and arrived at the show reflecting on a poor experience, with little in the way of remorse. I live in Sydney, so I doubt I would stay at this hotel, but I am certain that the 10 of us will not return. GM from Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, right in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: rhyskatrina
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently with my partner and the Swissotel was one of the best hotels we've stayed in! The staff at reception were very welcoming and they even upgraded us. Our room had a great view of the city, which we could see to Circular Quay and also had a great view of Sydney tower. The executive club lounge was awesome as well. The hotel is located between Pitt st mall and QVB, and next to the new Westfield, so there is plenty of shopping and sight seeing very close by! Highly recommend staying there. Any by the way, make sure you have the buffet breakfast in the restaurant. Delicious.

Reviews.Title: “The executive apartment was all one could want and more”
Reviews.Author: alibarber45
Reviews.Content: I experianced a most enjoyable stay with a nice room the location to my business appointment was just ideal and the service in the resturant caould not be faulted. Nice and friendly. Unfortunately the sign out was very frustrating - too long.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, classy, central.”
Reviews.Author: MalibuGeoFF
Reviews.Content: Wifi needs updating, wired Internet excellent. Maids can be very noisy in hallways, use the earplugs in your night table. Breakfast buffet in lobby one of the best hotel buffets in the city. Elegant bathrooms with soaker tub and glass shower. Nespresso coffeemakers in some rooms a nice touch. Convenient to everything in the business district.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: KayTravelsAgain
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a great central location with a rooftop swimming pool. Donâ€™t eat breakfast here as there are so many great little places in the neighbourhood that are better value for money and much better for people watching. I was surprised at the decent room sizes. This is not an amazing hotel, but we securing it for a good rate and it served us well as a base for shopping and exploring. Itsâ€™ right near all the shopping and 15 mins walk to either Darling Harbour or Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MegNh
Reviews.Content: We held a week long conference here this January and we couldn't have picked a better location. The Swissotel is right in the center of downtown Sydney. The staff were always friendly and accommodating, particularly at the lobby bar and executive lounge. The pool could use a little upgrading (the few chairs were falling apart). Great place to stay if you want to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with great shopping spots!”
Reviews.Author: tree5
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with great shopping spots! Eateries like Japanese take-away shop, McDonald and supermarket are just a stone throw away! 10 minutes walk to Hyde park and NSW Parliament House only. Monorail station 3 mins walk away which can bring you to darling harbour, chinatown and many more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Above Par, Ultra Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: When I heard that this property is being refurbished this year I feared the worst but the rooms are on par with some of the best hotels in Sydney and the service is not far behind. Over 3 separate stays in the past month I enjoyed every room I stayed in, they are bright, clean, modern and functional. Despite fewer TV channels than other properties the technology is modern and in top condition. The Nespresso machines are a small addition to the rooms that most 5-star hotels don't even offer. Views from most rooms are uniquely stunning but what can't be overlooked is Sydney's most convenient location that make it a delight regardless of whether you are a first-timer to Sydney or a seasoned traveller. The bathrooms are spacious to the point you almost question why extra space wasn't proportioned to the bedroom? (Perhaps this is something that will be addressed with the refurbishment as the rooms could definitely benefit from a sofa.) The Swissotel Sydney is perfect for a luxurious stay without the expensive cost; for convenience without the compromise; and a party in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: Zimbyzim
Reviews.Content: Outdated decor. Bad service. Plenty more issues add up to bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Nokasan
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is fantastic, right in the heart of downtown Sydney with numerous malls and restaurants all within a short walk from the hotel. Darling Harbour is just a 5 minute walk away. The Opera House and Harbour Bridge are a good 15-20 minute walk but there's a free daytime shuttle bus around the corner that drops you right in front of Circular Quay. Town Hall subway is just one block away which connects you to local and commuter trains. We stayed for 6 nights and were told the standard rooms were fully booked, so we shelled out $30/night more for the next higher category which on the website appeared to have a couch/sitting area. But, when we checked into our room it looked like the standard room! I complained to the reception who said they would look into it but failed to call back after 15 minutes, so I went down in person to follow up. After which, the assistant manager advised the website pictures were wrong (which I hardly believe for such an established hotel chain) but she did offer to upgrade us to a suite for no additional charge! That saved an otherwise unfortunate start to our holiday. However, the suite was right next to the elevator and we could hear a constant buzzing/rattling whenever we were in the bathroom which was just on the other side of the elevator bank. The hotel amenities are somewhat standard and I was disappointed that you had to buy a separate password for each computer/Iphone you wanted to connect to the internet (either via LAN or wifi). I was there with my wife and we both had a laptop plus Iphone, so it would be good if they allowed you to share passwords provided only one login at a time like in other hotels I've stayed in, but I guess they're catering to business travelers who may only have one laptop or would be willing to pay for multiple passwords. All in all, good value for money compared to the other major hotel chains but service and options for leisure travelers could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfortable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl02
Reviews.Content: My two children and I recently stayed at the Swissotel. Location is perfect. Close to great shopping and cafes. Very clean and comfortable. Staff were very helpful and polite. Meals were delicious. If you are driving use the valet parking! So nice to step out of the car and into the lobby after battling Sydney traffic! We will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Would choose again”
Reviews.Author: W4Peter
Reviews.Content: I'm a native Sydneysider, visiting from London. I wanted a hotel in the centre of Sydney that wouldn't break the bank (the AUD is very strong). My wife smokes a little so the option of a smoking room was a welcome bonus - it's a little fascistic in Australia at some places. The service was first-rate - fast, efficient and friendly. The lifts can become a little busy but all the other guests were pleasant types, not party-goers, and the wait was never very long. The room did not have much of a view but that's fine - I've seen Sydney before, and we were only on the 11th floor after all, and nobody could look in It was the best night's sleep I'd had in three weeks of travelling. The bed was firm, had crisp, fresh linen and the bath was wonderful for my wife. I prefer a shower - it was powerful and invigorating. The location cannot be faulted, even if you are from Sydney. If you would like to buy wine there is a bottle shop on Park St just one block away. The minibar could be a little expensive but they always are. Normally we stay with family outside Sydney but I decided to treat my wife this time for our last night. I think we'll be seeing more of the Swissotel in the future. It's less stressful than staying with the family!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, little value, a shame because the location is great.”
Reviews.Author: Hangaroundgirl
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at this hotel because we are going to Singapore and i wanted to know what this chain is like before we decide. The pics looked good and the location is great. i was on the 17th floor. the decor was old and shabby, the room very small, and the bed was very very hard - similar to what the beds are like in Seoul hotels - not at all to my comfort. I ordered an evening meal at 9.09 and was told that it would be 30 minutes. At 9.50 I rang to be told that someone would ring me. 15 minutes later it arrived. To pay $35 for a prawn, noodle and rice, Asian-style dish, with far too much chilli and only 4 prawns was just excessive in the max. i didn't bother trying room service again. My towels were changed but no face cloths were brought for the second day - I find this really annoying. There were no newspapers and no options for ordering breakfast the night before - so I didn't bother and went across the road to a charming little cafe - art deco style. How hard can it be to add that little bit of value to ensure repeat customers??? And I am so peeved that swimming pools in hotels close at 9pm - why is that stupid rule there? if you are staying for business then its impossible to get to it before it closes. Sorry, I won't be a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely short break in sydney”
Reviews.Author: locpoppykt
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the swissotel. Â We loved our stay. The hotel is right around the corner from the Pitt St mall with lots of great shops. But we actually liked the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff the most. They called a cafe for us when we left a bag there and happily let us store our bags while we went off to shop. We also appreciated the no fuss attitude when we queried our bill on checkout. Happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location is it's best feature”
Reviews.Author: gail2803
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the city and close to Pitt Street, this hotel provides a good location for exploring Sydney. As this was our last leg of our trip in Australia, we decided to treat ourselves to a 1 bedroom suite. Upon entering the hotel, you have to get in a lift to the reception floor from the ground, where we were greeted warmly, this was the only time we were greeted warmly! When we got to our room we noticed it was next door to the lifts so you hear the lifts constantly going up and down, noisy even with the tv on. My husband asked if we could be moved to a quieter room but was informed that this was the only option as due to the floor layout, all the 1 bedroom suites are in the same location on each floor, he was then given some ear plugs! Fortunately due to lots of sight seeing we managed to fall asleep ok, but I would not recommend this if you are a light sleeper. I was also annoyed that if I had booked a cheaper room, then it would have been quieter. The staff were quite passive and weren't bothered about guests, there was also a function on everyday which spilled into the bar and lobby so we always felt in the way. I would not stay here again and this experience has dimmed my view of the swissotel brand.

Reviews.Title: “1 Star service at 5 Star prices”
Reviews.Author: SpeedoSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife had booked a Romance package for my birthday at the Swissotel Sydney . We arrived at 1.50pm to be told our room wasn't ready and it would be approx 30 minutes . I told the receptionist we had a guaranteed time of a 2pm check in.. After standing at reception for 30 minutes and continually checking if the room was ready we were finally given the room key at 2.20pm.. The package included sparkling wine a chocolate strawberries on arrival.. We eventually received these at 4.45pm after making 3 phone calls to see where they were.. it was delivered with a card wishing my wife Happy Birthday when she had clearly stated on booking it that it was her husbands birthday. We ventured down for dinner to the hotels JPB restaurant at 7.30pm to be greeted by a waitress who had no personality , and we were told to sit where we liked. There were tables full of dirty plates and glasses and these were not cleared when we left the restaurant 2 hours later !! After 10 minutes we were given menus and we were not even asked if we wanted a drink. After a further 15 minutes another waitress came and took our order and I ordered a bottle of red wine... 30 minutes later we were still sitting there with no drinks or food. A couple who had come in 10 minutes after we did had drinks and food.. In the next 5 minutes 3 couples stood up and left the restaurant as they had arrived before we had and still had no food ! A gentleman who had been waiting over 30 minutes for a glass of wine also walked out..... The waitress did not even notice and brought his meal out 15 minutes later !! The only reason we stayed was that dinner was included in the package my wife had booked.. There was complete and utter confusion in the restaurant and no supervisor or manager present at any time.. When we got back to the room after our unique dining experience I called down to speak to the duty manager to explain my dissatisfaction of the service we had experienced since we arrived at the hotel and the restaurant chaos had just topped the day. She explained she was aware of the issues in the restaurant and would get the manager to meet and speak with me when we checked out the next day. When we checked out the next morning they had charged us for the parking and breakfast that was part of the package , which we then had to get taken off the bill. There was no sign of the duty manager so we left the hotel feeling very dissatisfied .

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located but quite spartan”
Reviews.Author: Tousson
Reviews.Content: Rather than write a long paragraph, here's a "Pros vs. Cons" review: PROS: -Excellent location; walk out and you're in the middle of the Sydney buzz. -Nice bathrooms; spacious with walk-in shower and separate bathtub (large and deep enough for an adult to actually use) -Room and bathroom were kept impeccably clean and restocked daily with toiletries. -Generous breakfast buffet with a daily variation on some hot items (only flaw here is that whole grain bread was missing, there were only white breads and "multi grain" toast available which is basically white toast with some seeds, but no rye/pumpernickel/german or swiss bread etc). -Reception provides currency exchange at very reasonable rates. CONS: - Room safe too small for a laptop. - The room was large enough but missed certain essentials for a luxury hotel, such as chair/ottoman or coffee table. Net curtain behind the blinds also missing, meaning to avoid construction workers across the street looking in, we had to put down the blinds completely and the room was dark. Usually there is some kind of curtain which allows light to come in but blocks views from outside. Strangely enough, our friends who stayed in the same room category on the same floor had a larger room which did include these furnishings. - Housekeeping only available until 3 or 4pm (We were there for Mardi Gras festivities, so sleeping in was a priority). Other 4-5 star hotels in Sydney and elsewhere provide housekeeping & turndown service until 9pm. - Pool and spa area small and minimalistic. You have to turn on the sauna & steam room 30-45 minutes ahead of time yourself, and even then the Sauna did not heat up properly. No aromas, no flasks of water or ice tea, no music or bar at the pool, no toiletries in the changing rooms. Disappointing for a 5-star hotel (though it is not officially ranked 5 stars, but declares itself so). - No robes or slippers in room. - No iPod connection or radio in room. There are supposedly 2 radio stations accessible through the small TV, but those did not work (on the first day the technician said it would be fixed after the weekend, but we stayed a whole week and nothing happened). -Self-laundry room available, but $18 for one load of washing is ridiculous! -No free wifi even for Club Swiss Gold members. The hotel is decent and well-located, but don't expect to be impressed. Most suitable for people who want to do a lot of sightseeing and spend most of their day outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff and luxury rooms”
Reviews.Author: Abbey_11
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel offered us a great location across from the QVB and 2 blocks from Darling Harbour. The rooms are large and we had a really comfortable king bed. The bathroom was luxurious with the most comfortable bath tub I've ever experienced and also had a huge walk-in shower. All the staff throughout our stay were more than helpful and always smiling and courteous - the Swiss way. They also had an outdoor pool which was on the 10th floor and sheltered from the wind. We would highly recommend staying here and can't wait for the opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night bliss”
Reviews.Author: sall13h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Sydney on our wedding night, booking through needitnow with a secret stay. This secret stay included late checkout of 2pm, two half our massages in the day spa, and breakfast. I was worried that we wouldn't get a double bed as it was not guaranteed but we did in fact get the king bed so it was not an issue. This hotel is located alongside the QVB and opposite the Myer. It is a fantastic location but if you want to go further it is also very close to all the buses, the train station and also the monorail. The room itself was beautiful, quite large with a balcony and a huge bathroom. They have all the amenities you need including nail file, dental kit etc. The reception staff are wonderful, very courteous and friendly. Don't be put off that the entrance is a door with some lifts, these lifts take you up above the Myer to the foyer which is expansive and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel and would certainly recommend anyone to stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: Adam_potter
Reviews.Content: My girlfreind and i stayed for 4 nights the swissotel, Sydney while we were traveling around austraila. I must say it was a trip of a lifetime and this great hotel topped off are stopover in sydney! The location was excellent (a stones throw away from darling harbour). All attractions were within walking distance even bondi beach! ( Hour walk through!) The hotel it self is located on market street which is above a big shopping mall and 10 minute walk to sydeny oprea house and the harbour bridge. The hotel is 5* with out a doubt and the staff are polite and helpful. There is a roof top swimming pool and gym and spa. Even though the hotel is located in a hot spot the noise at night is very quite. All in all this hotel i very high class and would recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable and not in a good way!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: worktoholiday99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Swissotel before so I was looking forward to a night away. I booked direct with the hotel about 1pm approx. an hour before I arrived. I told the person on the phone that took my reservation that I would be at the hotel between 1/2 hour to an hour; she said this would be no problem. So I arrived at the hotel 1 hour later only to find they did not have my booking and the guy behind the desk (Woody) was bordering on rude. He made some comment about well if you book through third party websites, this is what you can expect, so I explained to him that I had called the hotel direct and then he said well our central reservations is in Canada, so at this stage I was wondering how this was my fault and why I had to be informed of this so abruptly. So out the back he goes for the 2nd time, then he comes back in and starts pushing a few buttons on the keyboard to tell me that they have no rooms ready only a room with twin beds, I said not I would prefer a room with a king bed, thatâ€™s what I had booked. So eventually he found me a room and I was on my way, this process took 25 minutes. I enter the room and itâ€™s on the 12th floor, not a great view and was very noisy, I am guessing thatâ€™s why they have ear plugs in the drawers beside the bed. I went out for a walk and when I came back the room key didn't work, back down to reception again. Not happy. Had room service for dinner and I must say the food was quite nice and was delivered by the first friendly staff member I had met in the hotel. I checked out the next morning and about an hour after I received a call from the hotel telling me that I had "no showed" on my booking and the full amount would be charged to my credit card. WHAT!!!!! I had only just checked out, and then I felt like I had to prove I had actually only just checked out. What a drama, I will NEVER stay at the Swissotel again; there are lots of other hotels in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant rooms”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: As you would expect from anything Swiss, this hotel is clean and efficient. The location is simply fabulous, walk out of the door and you are in the middle of Sydney's shopping and city centre. A short stroll to the QV building, or a gentle walk to many of Sydney's attractions. The room is a reasonable size with a large bathroom with separate bath and enormous shower. Room service is excellent. The pool is fabulous and breakfast generous.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that count”
Reviews.Author: papalotta
Reviews.Content: Okay so first up the positives: great location right near QVB, the State Theatre and the main shopping mall, nice foyer, pleasant staff, room clean and well appointed (if a bit of a strange layout), okayish view of city, lovely coffee machine in the room. Negatives: Internet didn't work, despite calls to the helpline, rang for a new cable which took a few hours to turn up (not great when you're using the hotel for business), there's no wireless in the lobby, so you have to use the pokey little business centre. Had my 'Do not disturb' sign on, but despite this I was still woken up at 7am by housekeeping entering my room (nice surprise) as 'the computer said I'd checked out'. This is a little thing and an easy mistake but it really naffed me off!! Was desperate for a lie in. Also isn't it standard these days in a 4star plus hotel to give you one free bottle of water? In summary the hotel is okay, but not amazing. For the price there are many much better hotels in Sydney. .

Reviews.Title: “central, well appointed, cheery staff”
Reviews.Author: grenwood
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in the heart of Sydney city with easy access to all transoprt and sights. Conceirge entrance is off Market Street right next to Myer. Dedicated guests lifts to 8th flloor for reception and we did not find this a hassle. The Hotel maintains a peaceful atmosphere as it up high and off the street. Rooms very spacious and super clean. Breakfast buffet -big hot & cold selection and also waffles, pancakes, and rosti Eggs and omlettes all cooked to order. Delicious. Crossroads Bar good for a drink before heading out or after returning late at night. Excellent pizzas. Staff were helpful and cheery. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally food in a hotel that competes with cbd restaurants”
Reviews.Author: fastapasta
Reviews.Content: The room size is good and staff generally were a pleasure to deal with. Check in was seamless however the bed was a little firm for my liking. It rained on one of the nights of our stay so decided to give the restaurant a shot. A shame for the hotel that the restaurant would be a little hard to find if you were not staying there but the food was fantastic. Menu variety was good with a large grill option available. i had the pork for main with boudin noir-yum yum, my wife had the salmon cooked to perfection. The night ended with a great Lindt chocolate souffle. Also have to mention the high tea buffet- Lindt-chocolate-heaven. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences we have had”
Reviews.Author: Family_Traveller78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Australia Day holiday for 2 nights, and can i just say it was fantastic. I booked through Wotif.com that included an upgrade, buffet breakfast and a late checkout. Checkin was polite, friendly and professionalâ€¦ We were on the 22nd floor and had an Advantage Room which was greatâ€¦ 2 double beds and a cot for the little one. Plenty of room for 2 adults and two kids. (It's very hard to find a hotel that accommodates families) Room was well appointed with nice bathroom with separate shower and bath, beds comfy and a pillow menu where you can select from a number of different pillows for your stay. My wife loved the Nespresso Coffee Machine. Pool area was great, though it would have been nice for a stack of towels at the pool instead of using room ones. Buffet breakfast in the restaurant was very nice. Staff were friendly and everything was well stocked. A chef was on hand to cook omelettes and eggs and the rest of the buffet was very nice. The thing i liked most about this hotel was the staff. I do not think we encountered anyone that was rude or arrogant. They all seem to want to be there and nothing was too much trouble. They were attentive but not intrusive which is what i want in a hotel. The management of this hotel should be proud of their staff because it can make or break a hotel. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone, but especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Well intentioned, but definitely issues”
Reviews.Author: JodesLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Swissotel many years ago and had good memories of it, but for this stay there were a number of issues, which individually would not be much of a problem at all, but when combined make me think Fawlty Towers. Firstly, I phoned in advance of my booking to confirm there will be a cot in my room as requested through wotif. I was told I had made no such request (when I had written evidence that I had) . The phone operator whilst being very nice was the FASTEST talker I have ever heard and was obviously in a rush, and combined with his accent - I could not understand a single word of what he was saying because he really was so fast. When I asked if he could slow down a little, he didn't. In the end he had to call me back to confirm my cot- which he ultimately did and when I arrived the cot was in the room. I also sent my wotif confirmation to the hotel showing absolutely that I had asked for a cot in the first instance. But it was only the day after I arrived that I got a response from someone else. She apologised and informed me that on my SECOND night I would get a cot. Obviously people were thoroughly confused when this cot then arrived and I said I actually already had a cot and the problem had been sorted on day 1. Obviously staff are not communicating with each other or checking the computer system. Then late at night on day 1 I ordered room service. I asked what the soup of the day was and then I had to be phoned back regarding that request as the staff member had no idea. When he did phone back I ordered the mushroom soup (not very nice) and when delivered the soup had no accompanying roll as promised, and came with a knife and fork but no spoon!!!! I think Swissotel Sydney has the world's hardest beds (I had a twin room, so maybe the Kings are better) with a doona and no sheet and felt hot all night. In the morning I asked if I could have a blanket and sheet. I got the blanket, but no sheet (asked again, along with face washers which were not provided when the room was serviced). Instant coffee and tea was also not replenished on day two of my stay and so I just went without for the rest of my time as I was sick of asking for stuff. Then a friend visited and got the third degree when she gave both my married name and my maiden (professional) name. They apparently could not understand why she would be saying two names and treated her as suspect. After she called up and I confirmed I knew her, the staff member then idly watched her walk all the way over to the lift by herself without the necessary access card and then watched her walk all the way back and he was still standing there - and just said 'yeah you need a card'. Finally breakfast on day three arrived, and once again the salt and pepper shakers were empty, like I found them on day 1. Same salt and pepper shakers or are they all like that and always like that and why is it that no-one ever bothers checking these things? The concierge I found to be really good and all the staff members (other than my friend's encounter) seemed nice and friendly, but there is point where you kind of want them to get their act together and stop making mistakes. The rooms are also starting to look a little dated and methinks an upgrade is in order sooner than later. The location is really handy to the shopping precinct of Sydney. Not a pretty spot, but a very handy spot. If you can brush off the other stuff and the uncomfortable planks, I mean beds, it wouldn't be a bad place to stay, but it still wouldn't be that great either.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and enjoyable in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: funkate
Reviews.Content: Most comfortable bed and pillow I have slept in for a long time. I had the best nights sleep and could have stayed longer just to enjoy this aspect - I did manage to get out and visit Sydney in the 2 days we stayed. Room was very clean and quiet and had everything we needed. Only disappointing part was having drinks in the bar and I ordered a non alcoholic drink (not allowed to drink for medical reasons) and I was given an alcoholic drink - not too sure how a bitters, lime and lemon becomes a whisky and lemonade and then we had to pay for it. Other than that - can't fault the service and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “central with heaps of quality service”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandDave0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Sydney last weekend - its very central (you can't really get more central I don't think) and the quality of service was excellent from check-in all they way through to check-out. The rooms could be freshened up a bit (we were on the 23rd floor "advantage room") and it was very clean and tidy. Great size bathroom, but the room was only an average size. The bed was firm - a little too firm, but better than being all saggy and baggy. Breakfast was included in our rate - a fantastic range of hot and cold buffet, but trying to get a coffee refill was near impossible. I gave up in the end and used the Nespresso machine back in our room. If you choose to self-park ($25) instead of valet ($55), then you end up parking about 4 blocks away and its a real hike. The real bonus is that the validated park ticket is good for all day. So, we checked-out at 11am and could have left the car parked all day if need be - bonus. We'd stay again, its right at the end of the Pitt St Mall (almost attached to the Myer shopping centre), so very good for a shopping weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great for retail therapy”
Reviews.Author: allanne
Reviews.Content: My sister & I both live in country towns at opposite ends of NSW & recently had a 2-night rendezvous in Sydney for a catch-up & some retail therapy. We chose the Swissotel as we had stayed there 5 years previously & found it excellent then. Also we were able to obtain an excellent "winter package" room rate in Summer? We like the hotel's location in the heart of the retail precinct. It's possible to be in DJs, Myer, the new Centrepoint Westfield or the QVB within a minute or two of leaving the hotel. Unfortunately on check-in the computer systen was down & the manual check-in resulted in us being booked into a room on the 15th floor which was also allocated to someone else. Staff came & fetched us to rectify the problem, reallocating us to the 12th floor. Straight away our room key didn't work, so it was back down to reception again. We were told that it was probably the battery in the lock & that a technician woukd be called. We were issued with new keys. A technician never arrived, & everytime we left the hotel we couldn't get into our room on our return. As there was someone different on the desk each time they would just issue us with new keys, or come up & let us in. This was very frustrating & should have been better addressed. Another small complaint is that we asked the concierge about 5.30pm where we could purchase some wine & we were directed to a bottle shop about a 5min walk away in Park St where we had a choice of only 2 very cheap & ordinary wines. We had to find out for ourselves that the DJs food hall is open till 7pm & that it provides an extensive product range of the type required. Our room was spacious & clean & the bathroom was beautifully appointed with a great shower & separate bath. We liked the pillow menu & the fact that we could listen to the TV through a speaker while in the bathroom. We think that Digital free to air TV channels should be available in a 5* hotel. One power point that we tried to use to recharge a phone didn't work. We ate dinner in the restaurant on one night, enjoying excellent service & a high quality, delicious meal. We will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Left the hotel in tears I was so humiliated by their staff”
Reviews.Author: keluc1
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a "secret hotel" with a dinner package through last minute. Hotel was nice, but we had to continually fight for the inclusions that we had paid for (dinners, breakfasts, room upgrade) and then when we checked out, they had added everything to the bill anyway!!! So had to start all over again, showing them our booking confirmation and what we had already paid for. Was humiliating and totally ruined the "relaxing" experience that it was meant to be. Nice hotel, but clearly their administration is incompetent. Left there in tears and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “A good pick for comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: mwynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the historic center of town just a few minutes walk from the city rail stop. It takes up several high floors of a building where you'll get views of the city, but not the marina. My room was nicely furnished, but overall it felt like a hotel mainly for business travelers - styled modern, sharp, clean and smart. Also, carefully review your bill. Mine reflected that someone went to the hotel bar and had mistakenly or fraudulently charged drinks to my room, but when I explained that the charges weren't mine, the hotel wrote it off without any questions.

Reviews.Title: “This should suit everyone”
Reviews.Author: sickaworkin
Reviews.Content: Although raised in the country, I worked and lived in Sydney for 6 years, so I know my way around. We bought recent Bon Jovi Concert tickets and decided to make a weekend of it. Unfortunately, due to Bon Jovi, Carols in the Domain, U2, Oprah Winfrey and a hole host of other things, we were struggling to find a room anywhere. We decided to whoop it up 5 star and booked this as a Last Minute Mystery Hotel, as they were about the only rooms left. When we got the location details, we were stoked. I knew straight away we were where we wanted to be. Right on top of Pitt St Mall, Adjacent to Centre Point Tower and Queen Victoria Buildings. Town Hall Train Station is 5 mins away. Buses and Taxis run left, right and centre. It really is convenient to everywhere. The monorail is across the street at The Hilton, which provides easy access to Darling Harbour and the Casino. We drove down to Sydney and used the Valet Parking Service, but never touched the car. It was much easier to cab, train or bus. We ate both nights in the JBP Restaurant and the food was exquisite and reasonably priced. The Breakfast Buffet just had too many things to choose from, and all fresh. Maitre D Ronnie did everything and more to accommodate us very early the first night and 10pm the second. Waitress Ana (I think) stayed back and happily chatted and served us even though everyone else was gone. One minor complaint was the bar shut at midnight on Sat night, with at least 20 people still drinking and happy to be there. This could be a licensing thing, but it was such a good place to sit, chat and relax, we could have stayed another hour or three. As all the good pubs an clubs have entry lines by that time of night, we pulled the pin and just went to bed. Our room was on the 12th floor and we heard nothing. The Hotel only starts on Level 8, as The Myer Department Store occupies the first 7 levels. The room was beautifully appointed and very spacious. Everything about the bathrooms were first class. We had a corner room looking up Market St toward Hyde Park. It was Xmas shopping mayhem, but you wouldn't know it in the rooms. It was silent. The room faced East, but blockout curtains allowed us to sleep in late. We didn't use the gym, but we went to use the pool and spa. It was a cool day and the pool was barely chilled, certainly not "heated." The spa was about the temperature I'd expect the pool, and certainly not hot enough to be a spa. This was only a minor thing as we did so much over the two days, we had little time to swim. On an extended stay, I would've liked to have used it. Executive Assistant Gina REES deserves a special mention for her assistance and personal touch. We'll definitely be back, and by choice next time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location. Outstanding staff. Okay room...just a bit too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: AshleeSydney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Swwishotel in Sydney in late December 2010 for just 2 nights. We stayed in an executive room - which essentially meant that we had access to the executive club lounge for breakfast and evening canapes and drinks. First the good: Swisshotel in Sydney is located right above Pitt Street Mall (Sydney City's main shopping destination) - it doesn't get much more central than this - particularly if you love shopping...even window shopping! There are restaurants, cafes and entertainment right at your doorstep. Other points of interest such as Circular Quay and Darling Harbour are a mere 10-15 minutes' walk away. And when you get tired of all the shopping and eating and people, just jump into the Swisshotel's lift and be whisked 8 storeys above the sity, into the hotel's main lobby for some peace and quiet and maybe a drink at the lobby bar. Check in is smooth and easy. The staff are gracious and very responsive to guests' needs. We were very happy to be given a room on level 24 - its fun to be high up and on the same level as the executive lounge. It was room 2401. Now may I give advice: if they put you in room 2401, ask for a different room. This is the not-so-good. The room was smaller than I expected - mainly because the hotel had referred to its executive rooms as very spacious - this room did not feel so spacious - it was a normal sized hotel room. No big deal. On the other hand, the bathroom was very spacious and the shower was fantastic. I could have stayed in there all day! BUT the problem was not that the room was not as spacious as expected - the problem was that the room was located right next to the hotel's service lifts, which were neatly concealed behind a door that said 'Private'. The consequence of this was that we heard staff going up and down the lifts, in and out the private door, with their service trolleys and whetever else, till very late at night and then starting again very early in the morning. Now the staff were merely going about their business and not trying to disturb us at all, but each time I was woken by the private door openning or shutting, I felt pretty unhappy. After one night of this, I contemplated requesting a different room. But the fact was that we were only staying 2 nights so I guess it didn't bother me enough to change rooms for one more night - but it did bother me enough to leave me feeling irritable. And that's sad, because otherwise the hotel was pretty good. And as I said before, the staff were excellent. Night 2 was much the same with respect to the lifts and staff movements, but this time we knew to expect it and didn't feel quite as put out as the first night. Now, moving back to the good: The executive lounge is an oasis. The staff are outstanding. A lady called Iche hosted breakfast in the lounge. Iche was so kind and helpful and ready to offer service - she is an outstanding example of good hospitality management. In the evenings, we had Stewart as our host. He too was outstanding - taking time to speak with all guests, making sure that everything was taken care of well and also knowing when people wanted to be left alone. We were very impressed. Overall, Swisshotel is good and its personnel are its finest feature. Make sure to ask for a quiet room - away from all lifts - guest lifts and service lifts - and pay a little bit extra to get access to the executive lounge - its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: levi2225
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Sydney to attend a show and catch up with old friends, so we needed a hotel that was in the middle of everything and to sleep in relative peace and comfort. We arrive early and asked if we can check in earlier than expected and surprise, surprise they said our room has already been made up. Construction at the nearby Westfield mall has been completed, but to be sure ask for a room in the upper floors in order not to catch the traffic noise. A bit pricey, but book via Tripadvisor and they give 20% off with complimentary breakfast. The room was clean, the bed firm (which I like) and all amenities as listed on the website. They even have a pillow menu (complimentary) and you can choose which pillows you like, from soft to firm and allergy resistant. The heat in Sydney was overwhelming and thankfully their airconditioning in our room worked perfectly - choose 19 degrees on the unit and it does feel 19 degrees. We did not use the pool, spa or gym so we cannot comment on them. Buffet breakfast served early at 6 am and has all the kind of food that would cater to a lot of people, from traditional pancake, bacon, sausage, baked beans (yummy) and scrambled egg, to healthy muesli, cereal, yoghurt, assorted fruits and breads with all the accouterments. They also serve Asian style breakfast like congee. Coffee is topped up at your request. The only hiccup during the stay is when I was charged full price on the room when I booked it at discounted price. Showed the printed email with the discounted price and the early morning receptionist, Assam, promptly dealt with it and changed the prices. All in all, satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced hotel, with reasonable service”
Reviews.Author: jimbob317
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good location in central Sydney, very close to the main shopping centre, 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and 25 minute walk to Circular Quay. For the price I paid Â£120 per night I cannot argue or moan, however the service was somewhat lacking. The room had been cleaned however there were no towels, it was not turned down at night and I had to wait over 45 minutes for my bag to be bought up and even then I had to go and get another which was not bought up at all. The rooms was of a good size, bed was quality and a pillow choice is offered. The en suite was also of an excellent size. I didn't eat and the restaurant or drink at the var however it did appear popular. I had not problems checking in at 3 in the afternoon however 11am check out to me was a little early, when the Four Seasons and several others hotels I have stayed in within Sydney offer midday check out. The other minor annoyance was the fact that as it is above a shopping centre reception is located on the 8th floor and therefore you get one lift there and then another to your room. Its minor, but takes time. Overall it was OK, but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: davidkc
Reviews.Content: There isnt one bad thing i would say about this fantastic place! Initially we had trouble trying to get a park out front, we rang the motel and the staff were there to meet us and take our car and bags . Our room was also ready early. We checked in with ease with our bags arriving only 10 min later, brilliant service. The room was to die for! We had Corner room which gave us a great view over the city. Furnishing was also 1st Class, bathroom very clean and modern, shining clean. Impressive. My wife and i really didnt want to leave, it was a nice treat for us. Thanks again. We will be back. Dave

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean room with very helpful staffs”
Reviews.Author: Naluwan
Reviews.Content: The hotel has perfect location, directly facing to Victoria Queen Shopping mall, it's also easy to MRT station and various supermarkets â€“ convenient for buying fruit, fresh milk..etc. If you're going on holiday. We were particularly impressed by the hotel's staff's thoughtfulness. We booked our hotel package including breakfast, however, we overslept in the first morning and the buffet was closed whilst we got here. The hotel's "Guest agent" Sikunia very kindly went to the kitchen 'n' brought us some simple hot food, her kindness really made our feeling to this hotel and this city different. We enjoyed our stay also because of the cleanness of the room â€“ very clean, even the details â€“ very reliable!

Reviews.Title: “Superb find in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: stevecook
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights and what a gem. From the moment we arrived at the door, the Concierge was brilliant and whisked our cases away and directed us up to Reception on the 8th floor. The reception staff were superb and even though we arrivedat 0800 we were allocated a room immediately. The rooms are great and the bathrooms brilliant. We had breakfast in our rate and that was an experience in its own right. Staff were pleasant and food selection great. We used the gym which was small and the pool which was a little cold and only got the sun in the afternoon All the staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to solve any problems. When we returned 4 weeks later for an overnight stay, we were greeted like long lost friends at the concierge desk and throughout the hotel The hotel is ideally located for Darling Harbour, is in the centre of the shopping area including a new Westfield store and easy walking to the Opera House

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city activities”
Reviews.Author: robmigrates
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and beds comfortable. Decor is a little dated in the bathrooms - however showers etc are huge. I love the service. Staff have that knack of maintaining a respectful distance but seeming to be one step ahead of your needs. They also use your name which is a small thing but makes the world of difference. Some of the best service I have experienced in Australia. Try the day spa for a relaxing afternoon. Breakfast was A1.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: BP62
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you want to shop. But shocking for dropping off/picking up as traffic is a nightmare. No problems on arrival, but an offer of a morning newspaper would have been nice. Internet was VERY slow. Mattress was like sleeping on a slab of concrete. I like a firm mattress but it was ridiculous. Decided to order breakfast in room the next morning - Don't! Apart from no robes to wear, the order was completely wrong and what was there was almost cold. Spent a long hot day socialising (just out of town) and were so tired that we tried room service for dinner. Food was much better, as ordered & still warm. Only problem was about 3 hours later (both fast asleep) we had a knock on our door with more room service! Wrong room?? Next morning we opted to eat in the restaurant, but guess what? No tables(8.30am). We were offered a seat in the bar area (to wait for a table). They couldn't give us an approximate wait time. Decided to walk out & found a lovely cafe in the Queen Vic building just around the corner. Overall just ok, won't be rushing back.

Reviews.Title: “A poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Pyrenees50DS
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many five star hotels and this does not come close to even three star for service. Inner city location is excellent close to everything but the level of service was substandard. Hotel staff lacked professionalism, food was terrible (in room Dining), Concierge extremely slow - ended up collecting own car from basement after waiting half an hour with no service - not what you would expect from five star.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAgent
Reviews.Content: As a travel professional with almost a decade of experience not only selling travel but living it, travelling to all four corners of the globe, Iâ€™d have to say my recent experience at Swissotel Sydney was one of the least impressive hotel experiences Iâ€™ve ever had. Not to suggest I havenâ€™t stayed in lower standard hotels, but at least when you stay at a 3 star hotel and they deliver a 3 star product you leave feeling like you got what you paid for, however Swissotel Sydney promotes themselves as a 5 star hotel but delivers at best a 4 star product leaving the guest disappointed and feeling ripped off. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location, the location is fantastic, but unfortunately for me, it isnâ€™t enough to recommend it to either my clients or my family and friends. The staff whilst friendly enough are not anywhere near a 5 star standard and need serious retraining on how to deal with guests. The rate I pre-paid through a wholesaler included breakfast daily, yet every single day for my 5 night stay I went down for breakfast, I was told by the restaurant that breakfast wasnâ€™t included and it would be an additional cost; this was despite bringing it to the receptions attention on day 2 and being promised it was fixed (it wasnâ€™t!) The attention to detail with the breakfast offerings was extremely low; the fruit looked like it had been cut with a samurai sword, and on one occasion I had to bring attention to the fact the watermelon (which was clearly days old) had serious mould growing on it...there just doesnâ€™t seem to be a lot of care in the way things are done. The internet charges at this hotel are ridiculous given the extremely poor reception and bandwidth you get for you $25 per 24 hours or $10 per hour; the wireless is around dialup speed and the modem died on me 10 minutes into using it at 11pm at night, leaving me without internet coverage. The rooms at this hotel are in serious need of a refurb if they want to promote the hotel as 5 star, the TV is a cheap 32â€� plasma which in my room wasnâ€™t even working. As someone who puts their reputation on the line every single time I recommend a hotel, thereâ€™s no way I could ever recommend this hotel in its current condition or under its current management, there are so many better options for accommodation in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic friendly staff,great Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Janine029
Reviews.Content: So many Hotels to choose from and we would definately go back to this one, great location, light spacious room,clean and most of all wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “An unimpressive stay but good location”
Reviews.Author: Expl0rergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel in Sydney for business. Pros: Location - close to Darling Harbour and restaurants. Modern feel and decor. Bathroom is quite spacious. Good breakfast selection and friendly staff at breakfast restaurant and check-in. Has a small gym with 2 treadmills, a cross trainer, an exercise bike and another one or two weight machines and pool. Cons: Construction noise from Westfield next door (earplugs in room provided - tells a story), hard and uncomfortable beds, poor service from congierge (left bags at congierge when we checked in, waited 30 minutes and still no sign of bags, went downstairs to congierge and bags were still right there where we left it) so got it ourselves - not acceptable for a 5 star hotel. Overall I unfortunately did not get a good night's sleep so if I had a choice would not stay here again as there are many other hotels in Sydney to stay at. Hopefully when the Westfield construction finishes the hotel will be less noisy (construction continues well into the early hours of the morning), and hopefully they do something about the uncomfortable, hard beds soon. I have stayed at much better 5 star hotels - this one is really nothing special and lacklustre so do not have your expecations set very high.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ1955
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely. The price is a little steep- but the restaurant is fantastic. I would suggest it to a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel is fine but no luxury”
Reviews.Author: spipit
Reviews.Content: I can't really say anything bad about the Swissotel Sydney, it's fine but that's just it - it's just fine - not great, not brilliant, not wonderful. The room was ok, nothing special. The breakfast was good, quite a large selection and very tasty. The same cannot be said for a la carte dining in the evening, of the four of us who had dinner, not one was satisfied with the quality of the food. The staff were fairly helpful and the hotel is in quite a good location. We walked to both Darling Harbour and the main harbour no problem although the latter is about a 20 minute walk. I would say this is a 3.5 - 4 star hotel, definately not a 5 star. If you get a really good deal this is a good place to stay however I would choose somewhere else if I had to pay full price One other thing - there is no free internet, there doesn't seem to be in many hotels in Australia - we found it quite annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the bill - but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: miffymoo
Reviews.Content: There are many good reasons to stay at Swissotel Sydney. I stayed there with friends after my bridal shower and there was certainly nothing to fault, however I do agree with other reviewers that state the hotel is not 5 star and lacks luxury. The hotel is located in a good position, is quiet (this will be even better again once Westfield across the road has finished being built) and is excellent value for money. I would certainly recommend for family and friends to stay here although I wouldn't quite recommend it for a romantic getaway or in any situation where you truly wanted to 'impress' someone. I had a good experience at this hotel and would recommend it to people wanting a shopping or business trip to Sydney. The hotel is super clean, the staff friendly and location convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasoble price”
Reviews.Author: Mogadish
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my young children. Location is very good - a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour, across the street from a monorail station, next door to City Tower, a block away from St. James train station and not too far from Circular Quay. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of the city, shopping and restaurants. Not too far from the Rocks either. The rooms are adequate and extremely clean. But they don't have a 5 star feel about them because they are not luxurious enough. The main lobby too, while nice is also not to a 5 star level. I know that the hotel is limited by the architecture of the building, but arriving on the ground floor is rather unwelcoming as you have to navigate your way around hoardes of people and luggage. There wasn't any room for my taxi on arrival, so he had to double park about 20 m from the hotel and we both made a quick dash to the sidewalk with my luggage before potentially getting run over by another car. I was on the executive floor and I rate that as quite average. The staff in the executive lounge are excellent and extremely friendly, but the amenities were poor. Most executive lounges that I have been to around the world usually have at least chips, cookies or nuts outside of the breakfast and cocktail hours, but there was nothing but fridge drinks (which were also rather limited) and the Nespresso machine. The breakfast was also very average with limited choice (was kind of gluggy and cold anyway). The JPB restaurant was okay (not fabulous but good enough). Food was pretty good but service was a little slow and unattentive. Would I stay here again? Yes, but not a any price and certainly not at regular rack rate. It's okay at the $220-$275 range, I would not pay more than that. For anything more than $300, I'd rather spend a little bit more and stay at a more luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: JasonandSally
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and took my heavily pregnant wife with me. It was booked by the company travel agent. The location is good and the door staff are friendly, but the place felt souless to us - it was a typical chain hotel, albeit a fairly nice one. It was clean, tidy, and comfortable but it just didn't have any wow factor / character which for a 5 star hotel I would expect. There were some building works going on across from the room window which were a bit noisy but that didn't worry us as I was up early for work anyway. Would I stay here again? Yes if other places weren't available / too expensive. This has the feel of a business hotel rather than somewhere you'd want to stay when on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Ingimay
Reviews.Content: We are currently guests at the hotel. This will be our third night at the hotel. Great location, but the noise from the renovations in the mall is disruptive! This morning we were woken at 5:50am by the sound of a jack hammer! This continued for over an hour!

Reviews.Title: “how all SwissÃ´tels should be..”
Reviews.Author: Buquing
Reviews.Content: stayed here last year for 3 nights...I'm only writing this review because in the past few months I've chosen to stay at SwissÃ´tels in different locations and expected the same level of service...they weren't bad at all but the attitude of the staff was what marked the difference...while the staff at the Sydney hotel were attentive and addressed you by name (even from the housekeeper!), the staff at the other SwissÃ´tels were just OK though I got a feeling they're not encouraged to pay attention to those little details...nothing more to say but a nice stay at a great location..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Freedy1001
Reviews.Content: Spent a fantastic weekend in this well maintained Hotel. Staff were great on arrival and thru our stay. The room was clean, roomy, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond, fabulous location and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Gowake14
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for a weekend. Despite the hotel being very very busy the staff allowed us to check in 4 hours early, they were absolutely amazing. They greeted you in the elevator, in passing, whenever they could. The room and hotel was immaculate. We had the tastiest buffet breakfast we have ever had and once again the staff bent over backwards to help and even took the time to ask us how we were enjoying our stay. There was so much attention to detail paid to the presentation of the food. The hotels location was perfect. Smack bang in the middle of the shopping hub, close to Town Hall Station. The hotel organised an airport shuttle for only $12. We could not fault the hotel and the staff and will definitely be staying at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Burl0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel in Sydney for a recent business trip. Whilst the room layout, breakfast, general location were terrific, I was appalled at the service and standard of housekeeping. On arrival the bed was turned down with a note from housekeeping stating that as per my instructions that the bed linen had not been changed. I rang housekeeping to clarify and was 'snapped at' and advised that the note had obviously been misplaced. i left for my meetings, returned late and wasn't until the next morning that I noticed yesterday's newspaper that had been read, a dirty glass beside the bed and a half drink bottle of water! When I complained at check out, I was told that I should have advised them earlier - which I did, and an apology was provided with a 'shrug'. I have subsequently sent a complaint via the hotel's website with no reply. Not good enough. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding surprise stay for my 40th birthday.”
Reviews.Author: Toju2010
Reviews.Content: We came as a family of four with young children aged 5 and 7 years and stayed in their amazing Chairman's suite on th 25th floor to celebrate my 40th birthday. The rooms were amazing and we completely adored the attention to detail in the kids' bedroom all decked out in kid-friendly linen, stuffed toys, tv and games. The kids were so excited with their own kids-decorated bathroom with kids' toiletries. They were so over the moon that they didn't want to leave the hotel. The views were lovely and it was hard to believe we were staying literally above the busy Pitt St mall. We also received VIP treatment with champagne and flowers and a special room for breakfast in the morning - what an absolute treat ! The spaciousness of the rooms, the attention to detail in the furnisings, selection of pillows, the warm and welcoming service have provided our family with wonderful memories on this most special occasion. Thank you Swissotel for an outstanding VIP stay ! You have set a benchmark for your competitors to follow. The only thing we didn't like was having to leave after one nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “SWISSOTEL DOESN'T MAKE THE 5 STAR MARK”
Reviews.Author: blibin
Reviews.Content: I am currently a guest at the Swissotel Sydney. Night three of a three night stay. The hotel has a great location, very central to all shopping, business and Hyde Park. There is no driveway to enter the hotel on Market Street and only a small loading zone usually taken by cabs. We arrived by car and were given a choice of valet parking ($55.00 a night) or self park (two blocks away for $25.) The door men were ok, but not real welcoming. The lobby is on th 8th floor, accessible by elevator. Attractive high ceiling lobby with a bar as the main feature opposite the front desk. . At the front desk we were politely greeted. We managed to get upgraded to a club swiss executive room on the 23rd floor, but only after mentioning that we were Club Swiss members and asking for an upgrade. Our room has a city vie on the 23rd floor. Large bright room. Large bathroom with tub and separate shower. Lots of ammenities provided. King size bed, low (euro style),firm. Very small flat screen TV. Lots of close space with illumination. Not enough electrical outlets for 21st century electronics and gadgets. Lots of room, decent furniture, blackout blinds, good lighting. No free internet. On the 24th floor there is the Club Swiss Gold lounge available for frequent guests who qualify. Includes breakfast, free wireless, coffee tea, canapes and drinks in the late afternoon. I am fortunate to be staying directly above the lounge. My laptop has picked up the free wireless signal. The Spa, outdoor pool and gym are on the 10th floor. Smaller pool,lots of deck chairs with direct sun. Well equipped modern gym. The Spa has the usual available treatments, sauna and steam. Towels and lockers are provided. Towels only available at the spa reception desk. Make sure to take two or three. Small towels. The Men's steam is fibreglass lined, too much illumination and it stinks. The sauna heated up quickly and was the better choice. The keys provided for the locker were attached to a laminated card. Would be more convenient for spa users if it were on an elastized bracelet. The hotel has business centre. Very basic, no fax machine, no attendant. Room service was very good, and delivered to the room promptly. We have asked for a late checkout and were most graciously accomodated. This hotel is not a Fairmont, in service. The five star designation is a bit of a stretch. There are reasonable prices online including the hotel's own website.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location!”
Reviews.Author: sueom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at The Swissotel.Fantastic location. Very helpful and friendly staff. Thank you Yuslinda our room was terrific and you were most helpful. The rooms are slightly dated but spotlessly clean.Spacious bathroom with full size bath and shower.Lots of hot water,soft towels and nice toiletries.Room service was excellent and there was a nexpresso machine in the room.There is also a well equipped gym and a pool. A few things were missing,there were no glasses in the bathroom, no bathrobes and the bed only had a duvet, a top sheet and maybe a comforter or something like that would have made it look more like a 5 star hotel. However the view was stunning and the cleanliness, friendly manner of the staff and location could not be faulted. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Just another soulless business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: Acceptable I suppose and at least they have more people on the Check in than the nearby Hilton, which seems only ever to have one person at the reception desk. I stayed here because of the wireless network, when other better hotels such as the Sofitel were full. No luck, after an hour of trying to set up my phones etc the front desk eventually told me that only Australian iphones worked ..thanks for wasting my time. "Express check" out had a telephone number that went nowhere etc.etc. Totally unmemorable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but dated hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: RocketAus
Reviews.Content: Let's get this clear from the start, you stay here for the location not for luxury. If you want luxury go to the Westin or other similar expensive 5 star hotels. I stayed for 5 nights and found the room very large, it was clean and in reasonable condition. I honestly couldn't really fault it. Everything worked, the bed was comfortable, I had a good sleep and got to go for a run on the beach in the morning. The place is due/ready for an upgrade, but for the price - I booked the room through a discount site - it is good value. Would have no trouble recommending it to others knowing what you are getting. I would also happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontario_flutist
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, rooms were nice, the bathroom was quite generous in size - separate shower too. Location is good depending on where you need to be. It was a nice walk to Darling Harbour, and right in a shopping area. Easy to access the trains too. If you need to walk to Circular Quay or the Opera House, it's a bit far. We went to an opera in the evening and should have taken a taxi, the 25 min walk each way was a bit much in heels! Biggest negative (other than having to pay for the internet, which it seemed every hotel in Australia charged for) was the cost to valet park. It was $55 per night, which seems steep but since I'd never been to Sydney before I have nothing to compare it to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service...however with me, 3 strikes and your out”
Reviews.Author: brunobds66
Reviews.Content: Really like the swiss hotel but have decided not to stay there again. Great hotel, good location with really good service. Have stayed there 3 times in the past 3 years, each time the construction on the east side has kept us awake all hours of the night and really early in the morning. The constant noise of reversing construction vehicles, jack hammers at 5 am and general construction noise have really made this great hotel undesirable. Since our last stay a year ago we thought for sure the construction would have finished. I guess you can see why the price is so good for a great hotel......however in fairness they should tell the guest to expect the noise from the Sydney Center point construction next door. We stayed on the 22 nd floor this time but it did not make much difference. Check to make sure you either have a room on the west side or expect to be woken up by a pleasant jack hammer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: mantabargara
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Swissotel for a conference being held at the hotel. We booked interconnecting rooms, one room had a king and the other 2 x double beds (beds to hard for my liking, but the pillows were good). The rooms were large and well appointed and the bathrooms were lovely with separate bath and shower. A crib (not porta cot, which was a great feature) was free of charge for the baby, the breakfast buffet had many choices and the staff made us feel at ease, even though we had two young boys making a bit of a mess. A huge thank you to the concierge for all his help with booking an avis car for us (wish I could remember his name!), he made the whole process very quick and easy and the car was ready and waiting for us in the garage the next morning. If we come back to Sydney we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RosebudRosebud
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at Swissotel recenty based largely on negative Tripadvisor feedback on hotels in Darling Harbour. And how glad am I that I did! It was an easy and enjoyable 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour each morning. Breakfast was big and hearty with lots of food choices, room was large, extremly comfortable and super clean. Gym was well maintained and although it rained while I was there, the rooftop pool looked inviting even-so. In room service meals were delicious too and the check-in check-out process was painless. The complimentary bathroom thingies, especially the moisturiser, was fantastic. Also had nice views out the window. All up, five stars for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: Our junior suite on the 25th floor was a lovely room: oversized bathroom with deep soaking tub, nice big bedroom, cozy sitting room, and second half-bath in the hall. The decor is classy and understated, with some Asian touches, and overall very elegant. The room was spotless from top to bottom which is really important to us, and the bathroom amenities (shampoo, body wash, etc) were top-of-the-line. We were very surprised to find free wi-fi in our room; our other two Sydney hotels charged insane amounts for wired Internet access so this was a nice surprise. Service was, for the most part, helpful and friendly, although the bellman couldn't tear himself away from his newspaper to help us with bags or hailing a taxi when we were departing (relatively early in the morning with lots of baggage, in a light rain). The central bar (Crossroads) is relaxing and comfortable; the food menu is quite limited. We shared a Margherita pizza which was very tasty and a generous portion, and some beer-battered potatoes which weren't very nice (a little overdone so the batter formed a hard shell, and a heavy oily flavor as if the oil needed changing; the big bowl of potatoes came with a minted yogurt dip which was overpowered by the potatoes; this dish really needs a rework). The cocktail menu is really creative and had some lovely choices, but like most cocktails in Sydney (especially hotels and other tourist areas) there are no bargains. Service in the lounge was on par with other Sydney lounges (which means a little lackadaisical-- that's just how they do it in Sydney--- you're not in America any more so don't expect American service standards). The location can't be beat: right in the middle of the CBD, a quick walk to Darling Harbour and next door to a David Jones store plus tons of other shops. The beds are quite firm but there are pillow-top mattress pads available by calling housekeeping. There is very little hallway noise although (as with many older buildings) there is some street noise, even on the far-up floors. The view from our private balcony was breathtaking day and night, and one of the most memorable bits of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and even better location”
Reviews.Author: theretreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel Sydney for four nights during our stay in Sydney. For me this place ticked all the boxes and I was pleasantly surprised to find such classy accommodation that deep into the CBD. We were checked in early to our large room with a superb, large bathroom and comfy bed. The pillow menu was a great feature. The room was comfy and large with updated magazines letting us know the great attractions of Sydney. Breakfast in the restaurant offered a vast selection of hot and cold foods with the fresh honeycomb a nice feature. We didn't eat at the restaurant as it looked quite expensive but no doubt the food would have been on par with the room service dinner we had, which was excellent. While staying at the resort we chose to eat at Matt Moran's restaurant Aria, highly recommended. Also 360 at the top of the Sydney Tower was a must eat venue with an amazing view. Staff were friendly and helpful. The best part about staying at the Swissotel was the location. Literally a five minute walk to Darling Harbour and ten minutes to the Rocks. A taxi ride to the outskirts of the CBD was less than $10. If you are looking to stay in central Sydney, Swissotel is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: FromBrisbane
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable stay. Had conference at venue. Rooms clean and well appointed. Breakfast worked well, porters were efficient and friendly, front office great, function staff very helpful, bar staff six stars. All in all a really great stay....the signs of a tight well run "ship".

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience in their JPB Restaurant re: Frequent Flyer points”
Reviews.Author: rodgersg
Reviews.Content: Be warned if you try to use your Qantas Frequent Flyer card to earn points in their JPB Restaurant because, although they're listed as a Qantas Frequent Flyer partner, they will pretend their machine isn't working and thereby scam you out of valuable points. It happened to us: The waiter claimed the machine stopped working (although the Amex payment sure went through) and refused to try again.
