Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Ameglio
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the city. Within walking distance of all city centre sights. However, if your business trip doesn't involve visiting in the CBD (Central Business District) you might be better off basing yourself somewhere cheaper and travelling in to the sights by public transport. Beware - the hotel doesn't have a car park but offers valet parking at A$55 per day. I tried parking the car myself and was stung A$72 (Â£50 !!!!!!!) for overnight parking a the nearby Victoria Building. Everything was hideously expensive - exchange rate to blame, I think, with even a small bottle of water costing Â£2.00.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for people who arent fussy.”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends in October 2009, but it was for one night because we were doing a night out of the town. Even though this hotel is considered to be a 5 Star hotel but to me it felt average. You didnt have that feeling of WOW factor that your suppose to feel in a 5 star hotel. We chose this hotel last minute because it had a special rates which was cheaper than your usual 5 star in sydney. The Location was great, your surrounded by plenty shops, bars and only minutes away from pitt street mall and the centre point tower. So location is very very convienient. Views not so great, the room we got was the normal classic room. It was clean so no complaints about that. The bed is alright but not as comfortable as other 5 star hotel beds. Service was ok but it does take a while to check in and out. Overall this hotel did cover all the criteria but it just lacks a certain something, although we were very happy with the warm welcome we got from the Concierge and Luggage guys upon our arrival. The entrance of the hotel is hard to find but you'll find it in the end. Would I stay there again? answer is NO if i was going to stay as a getaway but I would stay here as a last resort if all the 5 star hotels were booked out. I would recommend this hotel if your not fuss and you want good rates. Dont expect it to be something you walk in and you feel your in luxury cause its not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Holidaying_Aussie
Reviews.Content: We booked a winter escape which included the full buffet breakfast (excellent) and free internet. The rooms were comfortable, and quiet, albeit not large,. The location is fantastic - short walk from one of the airport train stops, 15 minutes walk to The Rocks, and Darling Harbour, and the bus to Bondi is only a block away. If you have kids who are keen shoppers, the location above Myer (one of the biggest department stores) and opposite David Jones, is handy - although being from Melbourne, I couldn't get excited about Sydney shopping. The bar is a good place to relax after a hard day being a tourist. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goku86
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Swissotel on a weekend away and absolutely loved it! My partner and I are both from Sydney and thought the location was fantastic! There aren't too many other top hotels that really put you in the heart of the City but this was great; the buzz of Sydney is right on your doorstep. As for the hotel, it really is very nice. We had one of the corner suites, which was beautiful! Huge room with a gorgeous bathroom and even a balcony. I didn't even know you could have balconies in hotels up this high but that was a great surprise! We could even see Darling Harbour from the balcony :D. I have read a few other reviews on here saying rooms were too small or what not... I'm not sure what the standard rooms are like but I can tell you the corner suite was fantastic; large room, beautiful big bathroom, great comfy bed and the balcony too :D I would definitely recommend getting this one. We had a great stay and were very happy with the service. Everyone was very nice, we also got room service for dinner one night too and the food was very great. Will stay again on my next visit to my own city ;)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - Exceptional staff who made our stay fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jimali
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Wotif Secret Stays and what a find! At first we were a little concerned reading some of the reviews, but we needn't have been as the whole experience was fantastic from checkin to leaving. Staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful allowing us to check in when we arrived on an early morning flight (We had only expected to be able to leave our bags) We were upgraded to a room with great views over St Mary's Cathedral which was lit up for the festival at the time. Sydney was beautiful, and the Swissotel was the perfect location to see if from. Minutes from the train station to airport and elsewhere, to Darling Harbour and the ferries, to the Monorail and of course right in the heart of town next to Sydney Tower and the beautiful Queen Vic Building. One day pass allows you to travel on any bus, train or ferry all over Sydney, and even gets you to or from the airport, although you need to also pay an extra levy for the airport station. Great value and brilliant staff / managment. Thanks for all your help and suggestions! Jim & Alison (1718 - June 11-13)

Reviews.Title: “A bit up and down”
Reviews.Author: Citikitty
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Swiss a fair bit. Sometimes it's terrific, but often it's not. Onthe good side, I really like the fact that the check-in staff are so professional and recognise you with a friendly greeting. They are good. The beds are very comfortable and beautifully laundered, a real pleasure at the end of a long day. The rooms, whilst a little plain, are spotlessly clean and well maintained, consistently so: very Swiss! But oh dear, the room service food can sometimes be ordinary (and expensive). Think $45 for lamb, $10 for a fairly ordinary glass of wine and, to make matters worse, $5 for delivery (isn't that what room service is). It sometimes arrives cool and is a bit ordinary--for the price. The breakfast in the dining room on level 8 is the real problem. Not only do you frequently have to wait a really long time to be seated, but the coffee is truly horrid (I normally have tea as a result). The hot food is OK but hardly 5 star fare. What I REALLY object to though is that the eggs are cooked using battery cage eggs; I know this because on the bench near where the omelettes are cooked, there are cartons of cheap eggs marked "cage eggs". Hardly desirable for both animal welfare and human health purposes. I was shicked whenI recently saw this and walked away. The chicken sausages are dire--hard as rocks and full of emulsifed fats. In summary, the Swissotel in Sydney is a goodish hotel but probably you could expect more for 5 star. Certainly, I'd go elsewhere for food. If you can get a special, well and good; but if not, I'd be inclined to go to the Hilton or Westin if for around the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic spot, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideMermaid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at Swissotel Sydney after much searching on the internet for a reasonably priced one night stay. I wanted to stay 5 star, as we had only one night together before meeting up with family, and thought it might be something a little special. I wanted to spend not much more than $200 though, which seemed like a push in central Sydney. I ended up taking a room at Swissotel Sydney with Wotif.com.au for a special "breakfast included deal" in an "upgraded room" for $240, which I thought was a great price so grabbed it. The hotel itself is a surprise, with the entrance right next to Myers (between the two doors actually) and a small 'greeting' area just inside the main door, before being directed to a set of lifts to take you to the 8th floor where reception was located. The reception area was roomy and the conference/cocktail lounge area was right next to the check-in, so we had to dodge around very well-dressed business people with glasses of champagne and beer in hand. The reception staff were professional and I do remember a smile. We checked in earlier than anticipated, at around 1130, which wasn't a problem. We then proceeded to the 21st floor via another set of elevators. Our room was pleasant enough, although very small. Infact with our suitcases on the floor there wasn't much room left to walk around the bed. There was an unnessasarily large wardrobe with lots of drawers (which always puzzles me in hotels, as I've never once unpacked fully). Anyhow, our suitcases were too wide for the wardrobe, so we had no option other than to leave them out on the floor. I did ring reception to enquire if we were actually in the 'upgraded room' and she advised us that we were. There was nothing special about it, that's for sure. Except perhaps for the $1000 coffee machine that was located on the office desk. It certainly didn't add anything to the room, and if that constitutes an upgrade on the basis of the coffee machine, then it's really not worth it. It did. However, provide us with lots of laughs watching my husband try and get the thing going, by just looking at the diagrams imprinted on the plastic. Nothing, it seems, is easy! Incidentally, Wotif really hammed it up about the coffee machine, and I was expecting much more, don't know what really, but didn't expect the machine to be shoved on the desk almost as an afterthought. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom and was nice and bright with black and white checked tiles. Nothing to complain about here, except of course as with most older hotels there is no exhaust fan, which really annoys me! The room is so steamed up that it's unusable for the next person, and it's nice to have a fan in the room I think if there is more than one person using to toilet each morning, if you know what I mean. We couldn't open the roman blind to the window in the bathroom, as I quickly found out, or the people on the 21st floor of the office block directly outside the window would have had a right laugh. I loved that the hotel was right next door to Myers (my husband might not agree) and it was a treat just "popping next door for a sec" to find yourself in the middle of a mid-year sale! The best bit of the stay was the buffet breakfast by far. It was certainly the most extensive buffet breakfast I've had, and there has been a few. The restaurant decor was gorgeous, and the chairs were very comfy which was nice first thing in the morning. There was a lot of activity but didn't seem crowded. They had a few nice touches, like the real honey comb dripping honey on to a serving tray. We didn't use room service or the restaurant for a main meal, so can't comment. Except to say the room service menu was extremely pricey, something like $25 for a toasted sandwich (by memory, apologies if that's incorrect, but it was a laughable amount). The hotel is within easy walking distance to Darling Harbour and we went there for lunch and dinner and to visit the quarium. Overall there wasn't anything not to like, but the room was a tad disappointing and I now wish I had paid the extra $50 and stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbour which was the other hotel I was tossing up. There they had rooms with a view of the opera house or bridge, and after looking out at a few office blocks from our room at the Swissotel, would have been a real treat for not that much extra.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with just one minor hitch”
Reviews.Author: Kavya
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Swissotel Sydney. The room was very comfortable, the housekeeping was impeccable, the staff were incredibly friendly and the location is fabulous. My only gripe is that I had to ring the hotel after my stay to ask them to remove the hold on my credit card, even though they had also charged my accommodation to it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service by a swissotel”
Reviews.Author: cbandme
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at swissotel in singapore two months ago and given 5 star review this place gets a fallen star.The parking is not on hotel site but 4 streets away.Their is no place to stop outside the hotel.The one door man was flat out trying to deal with the many arrivals.We booked the executive suite.Rooms are supposed to be ready by 2pm but we had to wait till 3pm as ours wasnt ready. So why did we pay extra for an executive street .Its like paying business class to be last on the plane.Being winter time we asked room service for one extra blanket to be told their wasnt any.No lounge area television to watch world cup football.Does this hotel know whats going on in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: thompso2
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but well-designed, and the bathroom was very spacious and luxurious. The public spaces were airy and bright. The service was polite and attentive, and the doormen were happy to loan us an umbrella during a spring rain. We joined Club Swiss Gold, the hotel's loyalty program, before our stay and were quite charmed to find that this garnered us a note from the manager with a half-bottle of local wine. It was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, very comfortable with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Miffcolby
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night in May at the Swissotel. It was extremely comfortable. Very convenient for shopping being right in the centre of sydney. Didn't get to try out any of the facilities as we were leaving very early in the morning. Did like the card system to use the lift to get to your floor. Felt very safe and secure. Would recommend this hotel . We did have a great deal for the classic room at $180 normally the rooms are a lot more expensive. If in sydney again and they had the same price we would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Sydney the night before boarding Cunard's Queen Victoria for a cruise. We wanted something special before the cruise, and based on word of mouth decided that Swissotel was worth a try. The hotel was excellent. Happy, friendly service and an upgrade to a suite met us at the reception desk. The room was large, spacious and comfortable. Comfortable beds - a must - made for a good nights sleep. The hotel is located near the Pitt Street Mall and the new Westfield Sydney (formerly Westfield Centrepoint). It will, once open and complete, be excellent and the hotel is nicely located to allow access to this. A short walk to Circular Quay and in a good part of Sydney, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but,”
Reviews.Author: coober
Reviews.Content: Good value but little or no atmosphere, the rooms are a good size and the beds are comfortable. The restaurant for dinner and breakfast is average and expensive. Stay and sleep but dont eat. Many other options at AU $ 220.00 p/night.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, next to the Sydney Tower, 5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: TonyIOM
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is in the heart of the Sydney CBD. It is in easy walking distance of all the fun and facilities of Darling Harbour, but a little more from The Rocks district. However even the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens are less than 20 minutes walk, or a very short cab ride should it be raining. Next to the Sydney Tower, so easy to find! The lobby and reception are up on the eighth floor (reached by lift/elevator from the small unimposing street level entrance) with the rooms above, so they all have great views across the city. Light bistro-style value lunches are available in the spacious lobby on weekdays, plus a more upscale restaurant on the same floor for dinner. Breakfasts are also available at half the price in the next-door Myer's shopping mall, or stroll to Darling Harbour or diagonally across the street into the Queen Victoria Building for great eating options. Rooms? Well, what a 5-star international hotel should offer, no more no less. We didn't explore the other leisure facilities ... the outdoor pool, spa and so on. But the location couldn't have been better to access all the various central attractions of Sydney. All the staff with whom we interacted were thoroughly helpful, friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - very central”
Reviews.Author: sergio2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Large rooms, very central location, very friendly staff. There were no views (at least not from our room) but given its location it is kind of hard to get views with all the buildings around. And everything else was excellent. Not a place with great character but then again staying in the central city usually means not spending much time at the hotel, and the time spent there was relaxing. Recommended. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: superlucky_01
Reviews.Content: First of all, I tried to ring the hotel to find out about the package they pull up on Wotif. When I rang the reservation department, it was gone through to Central Reservation. Well... the thing was !! the person on the phone wasn't sure which package I was talking about. I advised her to go to Wotif and check it. And she keep saying she cannot find and also there is no package like that which I was talking about. I was curious and checked again while I was on the phone. It was there!! so I asked her to put me through to the hotel. Well it was bit late time.. but I expected someone answer the phone as it says 24 hours reception. NO ONE answer the phone... I tired 3-4 times but no one answered my phone call. Well.. so,... whatever I just booked the hotel through the Wotif. Finally on the check-in day, I came into the door with my friend. There were about 2-3 staff at the ground floor. They were talking each other, but no welcoming us. At the reception, she wasn't that friendly but helpful. I suggest her they might need friendly manner not only with answering the guest. I wanted to check the late check out. The person at the reception at late night around 10pm was good and freindly. Also, we had drink at the bar. He was freindly eough :-D Also when I came back to the hotel after 1am, there was no one at the reception.. Now I understanded why they didn't pick up my phone the other day. ROOM - When I entered into the room, I tired to turn the lights on. I turned on the light in the little space just at the front of the toilet (front of main room door). HOWEVER, there was NO LIGHT in bedroom side. I turned on all the lights in the room (bed side, lamp on the table, and stand lamp). The room was very dark. ROOM was great except the lights system. Big enough to use myself and my friend with two double beds. and it was clean and good codintion. Bed condition was very good. clean linen and bed covers. room was quite to sleep even if it was just obove the swimming pool. In the morning, when I checked out the person at the reception was very kind and freindly which was different to check-in staff. He asked us 'how was the stay and feeling?' with freindly voice and with nice smile. :-D It was great stay. we enjoyed it. The price of package for 2 peopel was greate $210 (with the tax) includes b'fast and free drinks for two. Staff at the reception and bar was good (average). Room was good (except the light). I will recommend this hotel for enjoy with your freinds.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Every Hotel Should be run this well”
Reviews.Author: AzureBlueTravel
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival it was a little misleading. You enter street level and are met by a very friendly concierge and multiple bellpersons who except your luggage and send you in the correct direction of 3 elevators which bring you up to the 8th floor, a huge well managed and sparkling clean lobby. Main counter (well manned) ,large bar area, restaurant and casual area. Our room was on the 21st floor with spectacular view of Darling Harbor and Hyde Park. The room was immaculate. The bathroom was very spacious, well maintained and extremely clean (a rareity nowadays) Something was amiss one day, I left a note and It was corrected that day. It was a pleasure staying at this hotel. Location was within walking distance to just about everything. Sydney Tower was located about 100 meters down the street. Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House were also close bye. Associate Director Of Sales - Leisure/ Daniela Bromfield and her staff are to be complemented for their attention to detail and compassion with customers/clients. Thank you for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Highly reccommend.”
Reviews.Author: hot101
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for my birthday/mothers day and we were so happy with everything. I couldnt possibly think of a negative thing to say about Swissotel Sydney. The Conceierge met us out the front and was very helpful. We were directed to the 8th floor to reception were a woman named Ute checked us in. She was so pleasant to speak with and gave us an upgrade to a beautiful room on the 22nd floor looking towards Centrepoint Tower. We had an espresso machine in our room and after I couldn't get it working they sent the engineer up at 10pm and he showed us how it worked. He then gave us loads of extra coffee. He was so nice & helpful as was all the staff. We had the buffet breakfast in the restaurant on the 8th floor and we were seated within 2 minutes. There was so much food on offer, anything you could want for breakfast is available, The chefs cook omeletes, eggs & pancakes to order and the waiters are very efficient with topping up your tea & coffee & clearing the tables. We had a great nights sleep. The pillows & mattresses were very comfortable. The mattress did feel a little hard but I woke up feeling rested so it wasnt as bad as other people have said. You can also ask for an underlay if your prefer a softer bed. Swisshotel is a very short walk to Darling Harbour and the Queen Victoria Building is half a block away. I loved staying at this hotel and found it much nicer than other, more expensive hotels I have stayed at. The staff are friendly & helpful & not pretentious like you may find in some other 5 star hotels. We will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the swissotel with my partner...”
Reviews.Author: Sarahjolo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the swissotel with my partner for our anniversary. It was amazing. They upgraded us to an executive club room which was huge with a balcony overlooking the city and views down to darling harbour. They also delivered champagne and stawberries for us. The room was perfect, very clean and most comfortable bed. We had a beautiful breakfast in the morning with every type of food can think of. We got massages in the spa in the morning which was so relaxing. I would definantly reccommend this hotel to anyone - I have stayed in alot of places around the world and the Swissotel was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor beds”
Reviews.Author: loopylou1559
Reviews.Content: After being on a cruise around New Zealand for 2 weeks I wanted a treat before the long flight back to the UK. The hotel has a lovely lobby and with first impression were great. The room had a lovely view over the city towards to Darling Harbour from the 16th floor. The beds in the room were totally sub-standard not what I was expecting for a 5 star hotel. They were very thin and the springs could be felt through them, I then asked at reception for a matress topper as I could not possible get a good night sleep on that mattress, the staff which they were happy assist with my requests . The hotels pool areais quite small but great for a quick swim after busy day round Sydney. Overall was expecting far more from the Swisotel than I actually got especially for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Much much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ruby_girl_10
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as part of a mystery deal on lastminute hotels. Having read many reviews on this website must say I was really worried, but I shouldn't have been. Check in was smoothe staff were polite, and wished my partner a happy birthday adding that we had a very nice room which we did. It was large, looked recently refurbished with a view of city buildings and skyline including some glimpses of water at Darling Harbour. The bathroom was large and clean as was the rest of the room, though the bed was very hard. Breakfast was included, there was no wait for a table and while the variety was standard, the food was hot and eggs were being cooked to order. Tea if ordered whether in a cup or pot was via a teabag, with newspapers brought to your table on request. But the highlight (also included in the package) was the 30 minute massage each at the Amrita Spa, it was delightful, with a delicious smell wafting through the room and soothing music playing - many thanks Rosita for a really relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: kiranrohera
Reviews.Content: this hotel is like a lodge not even a single star hotel dont even bother of booking into this hotel . its old shabby and not managed well the rooms are like the 70s lobby style is like the 80s .staff is like the 2050 robotic . i would suggest the westin which is just round the coner fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - make sure you book an executive suite”
Reviews.Author: travelwithlisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a girls weekend. We treated ourselves to an Executive Room which included evening capapes and drinks also breakfast the next morning. This is the way to go and is well worth the bit extra. Hotel is in okay condition - I had thought it was in good condition until I noticed the stained curtains and wall when I sat down to enjoy my breakfast. We will be back and will recomend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: Its easy to miss the entrance to the hotel as the Macy store takes over most of the lower floors of the building. The hotel reception is on the 8th floor along with the crossroads bar and the hotel restaurant. Our checkin was ok. Our room was on the 17th floor with a view overlooking the ourdoor pool and jucuzzi. Our room was standard size. There is aircon in the rooms but we couldnt get the room to the right temperature it was often stuffy in the room? The bathroom had a bath and seperate shower. Hairdryer provided. We had to request extra towels and toiletries on two occasions in a three night stop. Our room had a mini bar which was rammed full but we didnt use anything. The usual desk and chair and also one small easy chair. We had a kettle but there was never enough tea bags sugar or milk and we had to ring down and visit reception so many times I lost count! On a couple of websites Ive read bathrobes and slippers are provided. Not in our room. The spa has on outdoor rooftop pool which is supposed to be heated?? a jucuzzi which didnt have enough water in it? The fitness centre and sauna we didnt use. We also had to search for towels when visiting in the afternoon. We had a cocktail in the Crossroads bar one evening which were $15 and $17 and handmade by the barman. Breakfast was another story! We endured breakfast on two mornings. I had good expectations as Ive stopped at the Swissotel in Zurich. On arrival to the restaurant we waited far too long at the 'please wait to be seated' sign? The Restaurant nor the staff were busy? I had to request teabags on two seperate ocassions on the first visit. Also the fruit juice stand wasnt stocked that well two had runout. The breakfast display in my opinion was poor. There wasnt much choice in cooked meats or cheeses. The bread/rolls were basic and some felt it had been on display too long. The fruit was ok but there was no yogurt? There was a fresh honeycomb rack which looked interesting. The 'cooked' breakfast I have to say in all the countries in the world I ve been this has to be the worst ever. Everything was stone cold both mornings and we visited at different times. A hotel with 4 stars and they cant even heat baked beans.......The bacon sausage mushrooms tomatoes and various potatoes looked great but all stone cold. There were two chefs cooking fresh eggs and pancakes but the two poached eggs we had were under cooked. Very poor. We did mention it to the hotel and they said they would pass our comments on? This Swissotel is nowhere near the same standard as the Swissotel in Zurich which Ive stopped at so I found the Swissotel in Sydney dissappointing and not what you would expect from the Swissotel brand. I would not choose to stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoaArizona
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 6 days. The location is fantastic for arrival on the train from the airport. When you get off the train just walk through the mall & up the escalator to the hotel. We got a 7 day train ticket for $48. each which also works on the buses & ferry to the zoo. The Town Hall train staion is very close by. The hotel was very quiet and the room was large enough & the bathroom was very nice. We wanted to store some things in the mini bar & asked to have the contents removed but there would have been a $40. charge so we crammed our stuff in there anyway. The only thing that was annoying was the keys didn't work well & had to be recharged constantly at the desk. You have to use them to operate the lift as well as your room. We recomend the Bridge Climb & the Tarongo Zoo & of course walking around the Opera House. The Botanical Gardens is very beautiful & you definately need to be there just before sunset in time for the GIANT bats to come out in masses. Food is very expensive & there is a grocery store up the street from the hotel called Woolworth's. We recomend a restaurant at Circular Quay by the rail station by the Starbucks called "One". Best salmon I ever had! You should also go to The Australian Hotel in the Rocks district for Crocodial & Emu pizza's. Try the Kangaroo some where,it's like sirloin steak.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service - will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Travelloz
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Swissotel everytime I came to Sydney. The location is perfect and the rooms are nice. However, for A$225 a night, I expect much better service. Firstly, my requested wake-up call did not come, so I overslept and missed my meeting. Then house-keeping took away my extra key card that I left in the room. This is a clear breach of security. When I called front desk 3 times to ask for a new card, nobody picked up the phone. The Sheraton on the Park is offering rooms at the same rate - stay there instead. It's just round the corner (also central), nicer and with better service.

Reviews.Title: “lacks something but not sure what it is”
Reviews.Author: SueTilley
Reviews.Content: This is a functional hotel with polite and courteous staff. Absolutely nothing wrong with anything and yet it lacks that certain something that makes you want to come back. Very close to all the action and transport links.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sydneys top location”
Reviews.Author: Basawake
Reviews.Content: Being in the best town on earth we had 3 wonderfull nights in this big very luxe Business hotel. The entry of the hotel is a bit weird. Yoy have to start by taking a elevator to the first floor. After than, the big and wide lobby shows were Swissotel stands for: Luxury. Allthough the hotel is like many other 5-star business hotels clean, good service and expensive... This hotel is favorite becouse of it's location. It's really in the heart of it all. This hotel is on marketstreet and walking out of this hotel you are immidiately in your shop-till-you-drop street. Darlin Harbour, Opera House etc... its all within a 10 - 15 minute walk. Mc Donalds is just around the corner (free wifi internet here) and good food can be found near Darlin Harbour. The metrostation is around the corner and the (expensive) monorail is opposid of the hotel. The rooms look nice, are clean and big enough allthough I expected a bit bigger when we entered the hotel at first sight. There is no dvd player in the room. Wifi internet is available (pay extra) but we just went to Mc Donalds (free Wifi). Breakfast is in buffet style and serves everything you need in the morning. Want to have a better option at same price? Go to the Holiday Inn in 'The Rocks'. The hotel has the same quallity as Swissotel, but The Rocks surroundings are great, nice public and near all the good stuff. Looking for the best hotel in the centre of Sydney? Take Hilton. I've been here twice and it has by far the best service and facilities, you need for a good business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Service gone walk about”
Reviews.Author: Poppageorgio
Reviews.Content: What a great location bang smack in the middle of town. Unfortunately bang smack in the middle of homeless people lying around the the block makes this hotel seem very slummy. The room was very nice and check in was very smooth. Concierge was very friendly but our bags did take awhile to make it to the room on time. The lobby coffee shop was fantastic. overall this hotel is very nice but I do believe other 5 star hotels in the area offer better value and higher service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: aussiemumdad2kids
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - between Pitt Street & George Street. Easy walking distance to everything. Staff were excellent, from check-in to housekeeping. Room was spacious had an excellent size bathroom and most importantly - the hotel is very quiet. Tasteful bar area in foyer/reception which was a nice relaxing way to end a night out. If you are looking for a quiet hotel with excellent service & can walk to most attractions I think you would be pleased with the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, nice rooms, bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: eriksc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Swissotel for three nights in a suite. The room was great, large and clean. Staff was helpful. Very good location nearby everything. We felt the rate for the room was quite high, probably due to a late reservation and various events going on in Sydney. It appeared breakfast was not even included, but after we asked how this could be possible, staff was kind enough to include breakfast anyway. All in all, another good stay at the Swissotel in our favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't mind living there!!!”
Reviews.Author: TianPou
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights and would have loved to have more time to stay much longer. Very good hotel , great rooms and service. You are right in the city's centre and can walk to almost anywhere in the centre !!! it could not be better located especially for shopping and also for shorts walks to anywhere in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworld100
Reviews.Content: Great place with a view of the city; get a corner room. Breakfast is wonderful and service is marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: keitarom1971
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price with adequate service. It's OK for me to stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and soul-less hotel, but good location.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS60
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of central business and shopping district, right on top of one of the city's big department stores. This is a plus, but we didn't find the ambience at all warm. Good for a few nights' stay but we didn't want to linger! The decor is stark, boring, lots of marble in the massive foyer area that also houses the bar and restaurant. This area possesses the kind of functional charm found in an airport departure lounge. The night we arrrived there were lots of young people in the bar talking really loudly and the din was so bad we could hardly hear ourselves think; practically no soft furnishings to soak up the noise echoing around the place. Not conducive to a quiet drink. Our room ('classic') was functional, bathroom fine, bed comfortable, clean. Poor storage space - apart from 2 bedside drawers there was only one small drawer for clothes apart from the modest hanging space. Swimming pool was nice, although not over-large. Staff business-like, but not really welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY - VERY COMFORTABLE & CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: contenttotravel
Reviews.Content: We spent the holidays at the Swissotel and could not have picked a more central location to be in. We found the hotel spotlessly clean, and the front desk staff polite and so very helpful-same for the concierge downstairs.In fact they could not do enough for us. The room was a good size, bright and very comfortable. Bathroom was large, and again very clean. We needed some items from housekeeping, and within minutes, a very polite and friendly woman with a big smile, was at our door. The breakfasts offered only a fair variety, unusually long line for your eggs to order,and sometimes required a wait in line for a table. A little disappointing given how impeccable everything else was, but you could always find something to eat and enjoy. No more towels at the pool at around 5pm sent me running upstairs to get our bath towels. Adjoining the pool is a spa, and I do think a system should be put in place so that when this happens, someone from the spa can place a call to get more towels. Not a major issue but one that I think the hotel should address. Finally, the key system for the elevators-There has to be a more effecient way because the room keys seem to malfunction when you insert them in your floor slot. Occasionally they worked, but we frequently had to come downstairs to have our cards rebooted in order to get upstairs to our room. That said, I would certainly recommend the Swissotel ,even given the minor issues mentioned above. We were able to get a very good deal, our stay was most comfortable, and we walked everywhere in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in great location”
Reviews.Author: momotarokawaii
Reviews.Content: Great location, centre of the city! You can walk to Pitt street malls QVB or any other tourists spots. The room was spacious and had large window. Lunch at the hotel also nice and good deals!

Reviews.Title: “I love the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: jwyh
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience at Swissotel. I stayed there for a night (I'm from Sydney). Booked it on lastminute.com for $142, which was a great price (secret hotel). I had originally booked for a king bed room but had to change to twin because I needed a smoking room. Room did not smell at all. I have to say, for a standard room the quality is fantastic. I would expect it for a 5 star hotel, but I absolutely loved the bathroom. It looks exactly like it does in the pictures.. It's spacious, well designed. The only thing was I would've preferred a spa bath - you probably have to pay extra for that! Beds were very comfortable, the seats and armchairs in the room were beautifully decorated. Pay tv, my favourite channels were fox 8 and cartoon network! Location: I work in the city, so it took me 5 minutes to get to work the next day. But for other people not from Sydney, the location is very central. 10 mins walk to Chinatown, 2 minute walk to the main shopping area, buses around the corner, 15 minute walk to Circular Quay. Prime position! Check-in/checkout was a breeze. Didn't have to wait long at all and I had booked literally 2 hours before on the lastminute website. Service was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but the Hilton leaves it for dead”
Reviews.Author: KelPe
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at his hotel during a trip to Sydney for our anniversary. My first comment is that although their website, and the site I booked the room on, both quoted their valet parking at about $41 a day, it's actually $55 a day - or at least that's what we were charged. When we queried it we were told "no its $55, if the websites say that, they shouldn't". Our room was very small but comfortable and reasonably tidy - although the windows were noticeably dirty. It was extremely quiet which made for a good nights sleep on a very comfortable bed, and although I'd read reviews warning that part of the hotel overlooks a construction site (and our room looked down on it), if this was operational we didn't hear a thing. My main comment is that the staff at reception were quite unhelpful and aloof. In the restaurant we found staff to be falling over themselves wanting to assist us, however of the 3 times we needed to speak to reception, twice we found that getting assistance was quite a struggle, and one of the women we dealt with was almost rude. One other comment, the buffet breakfast is $35 a head - quite pricey - but all fresh and delicious food, and for $5 I had one of the best coffee's I've had in Sydney. Overall a nice place to stay, however if you're looking for 5 star service, stay at the Hilton around the corner - the staff there have a much better understanding of customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, pity about the service!”
Reviews.Author: sydney_beach_gal
Reviews.Content: The good: Swissotel is brilliantly located, heart of CBD. Nice room with spacious bathroom. Comfortable bed. Nice outdoor lap pool and spa area. The bad: Parking is four blocks away - would have been handy to include a map and details on their website! Slow check-in/check-out. I find it rather insulting to be charged a bond on check-in when the hotel already has my credit card details - I hardly look like an 18 year old rager! Service was totally ambivalent - nowhere near the appropriate standard of any decent hotel. Long queue for breakfast, decent but rather uninspired selection. Dirty plates and glasses piled up around the buffet is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “I was VERY surprised and in a GOOD way”
Reviews.Author: atlcycle
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is part of the Fairmont/Raffles hotel chain. I had just stayed in a Raffles...wow!! and the Swissotel was sooo close to being as good! I don't give compliments out this high often. The staff was very friendly, the room was very nice, and the location was spectacular.... I lived in Sydney for 2 years many years ago and was coming back (again) to visit friends. I hunted found a GREAT rate at the Swissotel. Highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was absolutely impeccable -- from staff to rooms”
Reviews.Author: DisplacedGothamist
Reviews.Content: I booked Swissotel Sydney to finally see a part of the world I had been dying to see forever. I thankfully had a friend who lives there and she told me Swissotel was quite swank. I managed to get a great deal through a travel website, so I took a chance and booked it. Wow. That's all I can really say is WOW. From the moment I arrived, to the room service, to maid service, to concierge -- I have never felt so pampered by a highly skilled group of professionals. This is truly a five star hotel experience. The hotel itself is above a shopping district (see photos) and high above the sound of traffic and downtown noises. The rooms are clean and modern, and a decent size with the bathroom offering both a shower and separate bathtub. The beds are comfortable and the linens cozy. But in all honesty, outside of being thoroughly delighted with my room, I was blown away by the staff and how I was treated. This is a hotel you go to when you want to spoil yourself. I wouldn't recommend it for families, because it has an adult, hip vibe to it, but I wouldn't say don't book it with a family either. Will I go back again and recommend it to friends? You bet. (P.S. If you've been to any five star hotels in New York City, this is quite comparable).

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Farehamvoyager
Reviews.Content: Poor service lets this hotel down. It has a good location but also badly-trained staff. When I arrived, late at night and tired, the first room I was allocated was dirty. I couldn't get into the second room as the key didn't work. It didn't work in the lift either (you have to put your key into a slot before the lift will move - a very annoying system). Eventually a porter helped me. I was told the restaurant was open - but it wasn't. Room service took ages to arrive and wasn't as described in the menu. Not a good start. When I returned to the room the next day at 2.30pm, it hadn't been serviced which I thought poor for a four-star hotel. Housekeeping then told me it would be done by 4.30pm! I complained and someone arrived more swiftly. When I left, I was told there would be a credit card charge. 'News to me' I said and refused to pay - it was immediately removed from my bill. More positively, the room was large and pleasant. But service was dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “A sorry excuse for a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: krissylou
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at Swissotel Sydney for my birthday weekend. There were some good points but mostly bad and I will never stay at, nor recommend this hotel. On our arrival concierge greeted us and it was no trouble getting a ticket for self-parking - they were very friendly and helpful and I couldnt fault any of them during the stay, we were always greeted by them every time we walked past. However, check-in was a disgrace. We waited at least 15 mins before we were invited to the reception desk - even though there was only one person in front of us. Then the girl who checked us in was unfriendly and unhelpful. I think it is great that Swissotel employs multiculturally but it is an issue when the person checking you in can not speak english properly and therefore you cant understand what they are saying - this is appalling considering this is an english speaking country! I asked if breakfast was included in the cost of the room and she made me feel like I was trying to rob them as she said to me if I could prove that this is what it said she would be happy to oblige - I was simply enquiring so I could plan where we would go the following morning! We got our keys and got into the lift but found the key to be very temperamental and would only work after a few tries on both the lifts and the room door. The room was nice but outdated and not what you would expect in a 5 star hotel. The tv was also difficult to turn on and would have to be pressed for about a minute before it decided to turn on. The room looked over a building sight but this couldnt be helped. We went to use the hotel pool and went searching for some towels, only to be told rudely that there werent any left. We had to go back to our room and get our bath towels then ring housekeeping to bring us some more - why couldnt the girl who was working in the spa (next to the pool) have called housekeeping to let them know??? Again, not something that would happen in some of the other 5 star hotels. Finally, on check out, after we were barely greeted by staff, we came across another blunder! The girl asked for the credit card so she could charge parking to it. We were told on check in that it would be charged immediately. Also, without our knowledge $100 was held on our card for parking. Once again the girl could hardly speak english so I was having trouble understanding what she was saying and the more I tried to understand the more frustrated she got! She then told me that it was only visible to us on our card because we had a debit credit card rather than a normal credit card. Again, this was never explained to us on check-in! I have stayed in a lot of hotels where self-parking is involved and I have never had money held because of it. She then proceeded to say that the $100 would take 7-9 working days to be put back in the account. When I asked why none of this had been explained she timidly apologised and sent us on our way. I was so disappointed that the stay ended this way and I strongly recommend you choose another 5 star hotel like the hilton or sheraton which are 100 times better and more efficient!!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of city and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: srishi
Reviews.Content: Real heart of city, walikng distance to The Hyde Park, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour. Touching distance from Sydney TV tower, Queen Victoria Building and monorail. Very clean and efficient service all round. Highly recommended after coming from 5star hotels in Kuala Lumpur and Genting Highlands in Malaysia.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, nice and comfty”
Reviews.Author: tuebidoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel for a couple of nights during our honeymoon trip. The location of the hotel is very central right in the central business district. Plenty of shops and dining options are close by. It is also only a short walk to Darling harbour, Opera house and the Royal Botanic Gardens are about a 15 min walk. Staff was friendly and helpful, especially the concierges downstairs. Upon checking in we were told that the room was "not one of the best rooms" but they were fully booked so we changed rooms the next day. Turns out the reason it was rated as not so good was that the bathroom did not have a window. This first room also faced East towards a large construcion site. That was a little noisy especially early in the morning. We got another room the next day which was fine. The rooms are a little impersonal as is the whole hotel but what would you exspect from a large downtown hotel? Still the beds were comfortable and we enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star hotel. Does not live up to it's own advertising.”
Reviews.Author: aodsod
Reviews.Content: Booked direct and paid for this hotel 4 months early and still did not get the room we requested without alot of moaning (not what you expect from 5 star hotel). We were bumped from the room we booked because someone else decided to stay on longer. Were offer an upgrand to a suite. If you are offered a suite be sure you are a heavy sleeper as all (according to hotel staff) suites are wrapped around the lift shaft and face onto the next door building site that starts at 7:00am 7 days a week. We eventually got the room we booked. Facilities very good. Breakfast food selection poor for 5 star hotel and after 9:00am gets worse, staff more interested in clearing tables than serving guests, and some at the best of times should not be working in the hospitality industry (including some of the management). Have recommended on the hotels customer survey that they get the staff to read the advertising brochure and web site information they produce. So that they know what they are supposed to be delivering.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: NotACreativeName
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 5 nights as part of our honeymoon. It was a reasonable price in a very good location. If it weren't for a few nagging issues, this hotel would be great. The issues: 1 - Internet Prices: ranging from $13/hour down to $100/week, the prices (using your own computer) are outright highway robbery. 2 - The elevators: Once in the elevator you have to slide your room key before you can hit the button to go to your floor. The problem was the key would never read right on the first try. Often it took 4 to 5 reads to work. When other people are on the elevator too, this becomes really annoying and makes the elevator ride far longer than it ought to be. 3 - A top sheet: I like to sleep with a top sheet. Their beds don't include them by default. Despite calling house keeping three nights in a row, the maid would still remove the top sheet from our bed each day. In the end I used the hotel safe to keep our top sheet so I could have it without calling house keeping each night. Except for those issues, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bendalong
Reviews.Content: the room was furnished comfortably. Very clean and the bathroom was amazing. Only problem I had was it was extremely busy when i checked in and I was checked into the wrong room ie requested a twin and was given a double. So there was a long wait of several hours to fix it up and they misplaced my luggage. Apologies were given and I put it down to it being an extremely busy weekend but still disappointing. Unfortunately our view was of the hole in the ground from the redevelopment of centrepoint tower.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel was worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: After spending more than 6 nights in Sydney, I feel as if I have a pretty good grasp of the city and what it has to offer. The majority of hotels are located in what is referred to as the CBD (Central Business District). This area of town is easily accessible to all neighborhoods (or suburbs as Australian's call them) and is also convenient to downtown attractions (i.e. Darling Harbor, Sydney Opera House, Botanical Gardens, etc). Use this central location to explore beyond the CBD otherwise you will miss the best Sydney has to offer. The hotel has sizeable rooms and helpful and attentive staff. The workout room, pool and saunas are on the 10th floor and while none of them are very large they are bigger than several other properties I visited in Australia and clean so I used them daily. I did not visit the restauarant. Across the street is the Queen Victoria Building which is loaded with excellent cafes and coffee shops providing both delectable breakfast (at a fraction of the cost) in a breathtakingly beautiful building. We also opted to have our dinners in neighborhoods outside the CBD - something I would encourage all travelers do. The lobby is bustling and quite pretty (located on the 8th floor). I found the concierge staff which are located on the ground level at the entrance to be very eager to help and extremely courteous but not as knowledgeable as other properties. However, I do give them credit for trying which I always appreciate. Overall, I would consider staying here again even though there are other properties in Sydney I also liked and would consider visiting again as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure”
Reviews.Author: Cavanboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 6 nights, and not sure if I would return again if in Sydney. The location is excellent and the concierge know their stuff, but sadly I think it ends there. When I checked in I was informed that I had been upgraded, but on further inspection it was the room that I had actually paid for in advance. The room itself had a balcony (for which I paid extra), but no views as such, not like it was described on their website. The Hotel was busy and I was told to check on a daily basis if I wanted to change rooms. I was hassled most mornings at breakfast, because my name did not appear on the list which it should have been. Definitely not a 5 Star Hotel..Internet charges outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Losing the edge to please customers and stay on top of the game”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Paul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here often enough to consider Swissotel our preferred Sydney hotel (my wife is a Club Swiss Gold member). We have stayed in 'Swiss Advantage Room' or 'Swiss Executive Club room', depending on the deal that is available. On this occasion, we stayed in their Advantage room (Room Number 2511). Which is located on the top floor. I am not sure about their standard room (known as Classic room) but Advantage rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. We arrived late in the evening and the hotel was pretty full, as we found out later. After we checked-in, we just dropped off our bags and went to get a bite to eat. When we returned to the room, we went straight to bed. We could hear construction noise from the ground level. We tried to ignore it and sleep but it was still causing us grief. We could hear the truck's reversing beeps to bulldozer smashing and dragging concrete - this is happening at midnight!! After 1:00am, I went down and spoke with the receptionist. He called the night manager (James). He was surprised to hear that construction was still going on at that time of the night but informed me the hotel is full. After fair bit of searching on the room allocation computer (initially could only find a standard room), we got a replacement room on another side of the building (one bedroom suite Room 2220). As hotel was full and comparable room to the one we booked was difficult to locate, it did take over 40 minutes to get the replacement room but James did come through for usâ€¦ admittedly with some assertive requests. I was told that construction does end earlier in the evening (normally) but be advised, as good as this hotel is, half the hotel rooms face the construction side. If you are a light sleeper or have good hearing, you might want to request the quiet side of the building. As a final note, a concierge on the ground floor recognised us from our previous stay and welcomed us with a big smile and came up to us and said hello. I am not sure if day-time reception staff work long hours and were tired but smiles cost nothing. A genuine, warm welcome goes a long way with me.

Reviews.Title: “surprising disappointment”
Reviews.Author: scottyedog
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive level room and indicated that there were three adults and requested two queen beds. Upon arriving, we were provided with a king room, which obviously doesn't work well with three adults. The person bringing our luggage to the room was great and offered to immediately help us change rooms. The second room was a room with two double beds. As other guests have indicated, their furnishings are showing wear and tear. The room was on the small side, however this was not that big of a deal, except it looked so much different than the pictures. The carpet was somewhat dirty. The first kind of mishap happened when we asked about the "shaving" outlet in the bathroom and were told that the outlet in the bathroom could be used for other devices. This ended up frying my curling iron which had to be replaced (at our cost) for $100. The next incident happened when we asked for a wake up call, and set the alarm in the room. Neither the wake up call happened or the alarm worked the next morning (when we had a tour scheduled that left at 8:00am). We called and asked about the wake-up call and they apologized and gave an excuse for why it happened. Three times total, they didn't call for the wake up call when we called and asked the night before. Each time they apologized and provided an excuse. The phone in the room also didn't work. We contacted maintenance and they came to the room and said that the problem was with the phone in the bathroom, but they wouldn't be able to fix it. This caused our phone to work sporadically, which was quite frustrating. The television signal in the room was fuzzy and made it to where you could barely see what was on the television at the time. They said that there was a problem with their satellite. We were quite surprised that for such a nice hotel (rated 4 stars) that their television would be so small and is located on the top of a dresser which makes it quite low. Again, this is not the way that it was pictured in their hotel pictures. The staff in the executive lounge area were not overly friendly or helpful. We asked about restaurant suggestions and they gave us a vague suggestion to go to Darling Harbour. We could have figured that out. They sometimes acted as if we were bothering them when we had questions. There were two staff members who throughout the day would be sitting in the reception area chatting and when asked questions again, they acted as if they were being inconvenienced. The breakfast was good. The first day we were there, the bread for the toast had mold all on it. They did replace it and apologized. The bircher museli was excellent. The coffee machine in the executive lounge never worked. Overall, the experience in the hotel was not what we expected. We tried to speak with the manager at the front desk and when we told them about the issues we had, he acted as if we were just being a pain. We have stayed at other Swissotels throughout the world and have had great experiences. This was not one of them. I don't think that the hotel quality is worth the amount of money paid--especially given the extra we paid for the executive level (although as mentioned above, we did enjoy the breakfast). I have stayed in several other hotels in Sydney which had far larger rooms, fewer issues (ie no wake up calls, phone and television worked). Unfortunately, we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calfie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money. Centrally located, but very discrete compared to other 4/5 star hotels. The decor is getting a little bit old. But when I am in Sydney I always stay here because it is reliable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Close Proximity to Sights! Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: 4FLTravelers
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Swissotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the personnel went the extra mile to make our visit enjoyable, and the location was perfect. We had a delicious breakfast every morning while planning our day's activities, and the concierge helped us figure out the best transportation strategies to achieve our plans. Before our departure, the front-desk personnel printed our boarding passes, and the porters even weighed our luggage. Everyone and everything were wonderful. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again if/when we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Discrimination!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JulianLee
Reviews.Content: Discrimination was found from Technical Staff to Duty Manager. I will strognly advise Asian don't choose this hotel. I have visited more than 40 cities, this Hotel is the most terrible one.

Reviews.Title: “Average with some problems, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: M55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days part business, part leisure. The location is excellent if you want to be in the centre - opposite Sydney Tower, a short walk to Darling Harbour, shops (eg at the beautiful Queen Victoria Building) all around and free shuttle to Circular Quay /harbour. The rooms are good and the staff friendly and attentive. Our, and others, main complaint is that we often had to queue for a table at breakfast as there were not enough tables and/or staff to keep up with guests arriving and they had problems replenishing the food/ drinks . There was an element of chaos with staff trying their best to cope. No problem if you went very early or late. If you do not have a laptop you have to pay for internet access in a tiny two computer 'business centre'. We also had building works staring early most mornings right opposite our room. Overall I would look elsewhere next time .

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff, clean comfortable rooms, good food”
Reviews.Author: walkabout99
Reviews.Content: not the hotel to stay in if you have a car because theres no where to park. entrance to the hotel is on the first floor, on the ground floor are lifts and staff to attend to your luggage etc. We stayed here to experience sydney it is right in the centre of everything, 10 minutes from the harbour, lots of places to eat and shop. The room was very clean and comfortable, it did not have a nice view but we were out all day. We had breakfast every morning and there was everything you could want and eggs were cooked upon request. the satff were excellent. lunch was a fixed price and everything was freshly cooked. reception staff.were just as good. we bought a travel pass for one week and used it for all ferries, trains and busses even though we stayed for 4 days it was cheaper. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizTaveller
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. I travel all over the world and I think this is one of my favourites.. I checked in this morning early around 9am, no hassles with the staff they got me a room immediately and were friendly and attentive. The rooms are really great I seem to get a really nice room everytime I stay here so I am either getting upgraded everytime or the rooms are just nice.. Always clean and comfy. New flat screen TV, more tv channels than most hotels offer.. Only a couple of things they could do better 1. Minibar and room service rates are too high. the food is ok but it's really expensive 2. Did not really like the staff at the restaurant, but the room service people are nice 3. Internet access is really slow.. They need faster broadband 4. having to use your key to get to your floor in the elevator is good for security I guess but it's a pain.. How about key access at night Overall I still think it's one of the best hotels in Sydney at a reasonable price in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous - look forward to coming back!”
Reviews.Author: purple_rain29
Reviews.Content: Hotel was spotless. Got a beautiful room next to the Chairman's suite on the top floor. Everything was as we requested. Extra towels and 2 double beds. Service was brilliant. We arrived early with a banner and conference materials and were allowed to check in at 12.30pm. We also scored a late check-out of 2pm and staff were more than accomodating to hold our luggage and hailed us a cab on busy Pitt St during peak house! I especially loved the Nespresso machine, spaciousness of the rooms and the pillow menu. All in all, was very impressed and I quite frequently stay in 5 star hotels. I would definitely come back to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Habibi09
Reviews.Content: Central location during the day, good for shopping, close to the underground and to a big park. In the evening there's not much to do, no life. We got a good lastminute rate and so it was a good choice for us. We had to complain to get an upgrate since our room was in front of a new , loud cunstruction site. The breakfast is normal, nothing special like all the rest.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in town ....”
Reviews.Author: SusanS13
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy stying in this hotel. The location, the room, and the food is all the best. For sure I will choose Swissotel for my next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but poor service”
Reviews.Author: simontheref
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights as part of a 3 week trip from the UK to Australia. Good location, around a 20 minutes walk to Circular Quay and less than 10 minutes to Darling Harbour. The hotel is also located within seconds of the Myers Department store and just around the corner from Queen Victoria Building that houses a number of shops. The hotel in itself was comfortable but felt it lacked a personal feel. The rooms were spacious and the kings size bed in the Classic Room was certainly more than King Size and in need ensured a good nights rest. A positive was the free late check out although this did not go to plan as detailed below. The Swimming pool should have been heated but it was too cold to swim in and the Jacuzzi was not the best I've ever been in. My gripe with this hotel compared to other 5 star hotels was the level of service 1. We arrived and despite having secured a deal for breakfast and club executive longue access, the receptionist initially insisted that we had room only! Having queried this and showed her the reservation document, she still insisted it was room only. It took me a while to explain what the reservation document said and eventually she made a call to clarify the situation. After 3-4 minutes the situation was resolved- They say first impressions go along way! 2. The club executive longue was ok, good evening service but it still lacked a 5 star feel with the staff being very stand off. Breakfast was not as good as that served downstairs in the main restaurant with limited choice and no offer of additional food being served up. For example omelettes were served in the main restaurant but no service was offered to provide this in the Executive Longue. In other club executive longue I've been in, staff have been very attentive but not in this one. We were rarely asked our room number except for one woman who scared the hell out of us when she demanded your room number- Attendance at a customer relations course is my next suggestion! 3. On the Saturday morning we decided to eat Breakfast in the main restaurant only to find a Queue of over 30 people waited to be seated. Having waited in a non-moving Queue for a couple of minutes we exited and had breakfast in the longue upstairs. 4. The reception staff struggled to communicate with their grasp of English not being the greatest. This is probably harsh on some of the staff, as the male staff seemed to have a better understanding than the females. 5. Having arranged late check out which despite getting it for free- I was more than willing to pay for it -we arrived back in our room to freshen up and finish packing only to find housekeeping in the middle of cleaning our room. Would I stay in a Swissotel again- very unlikely- not impressed 4.5 stars at the most!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: hk123j
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel was wonderful. It was conveniently located near the St. James train stop, next to a huge food court in the Sydney Central Plaza, near Queen Victoria Building (for shopping), and in walking distance from the Aquarium/the Rocks/Sydney Harbour Bridge/Sydney Opera House/Chinatown. We arrived at the hotel super early (8am) and they had a room ready for us. We walked in and the room was clean and spacious and we had a windows along the whole length of the room which made it very bright and sunny. The bathroom had a shower and tub which was a nice touch. My friend and I were really tired and sore from all the traveling so we treated ourselves to a massage at Amrita Spa. My masseuse, Nam, was wonderful. I got a Thai massage and she really worked on my problem areas. Afterwards, I felt so relaxed. One thing I did not like was that the spa did not have any products to use in the shower (except liquid soap). I paid a pretty penny for my massage and at most spas that I have been to, they provide more amenities than was offered at Amrita. We also had dinner at JPB. It is a nice restaurant with a fun Fondue dinner. It is all you can eat meats/seafood/salad. The service was excellent. I would definitely stay here again if I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Swissotel, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: cathycres
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Swissotel four nights. The room was very clean and large there was plenty of room for 3 ladies with 2 queen beds and a very comfortable rollaway bed. The bathroom was also very large with a tub and shower and it was very well stocked each day. We enjoyed a wonderful breakfast buffet each morning that was included with the price of the room. I would gladly stay there again if I returned to Sydney in the future. The location of the hotel was close to restaurants and shopping, very easy to walk to many locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lankyswan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for last two nights of our holiday, interesting location above Myers department store, if driving look to be in the right had lane so you can park near to the hotel, take the first spot you find otherwise you may have to go round the blocks again, there is a concierge desk at street level and they will take your bags for you.We took the hire car back then checked in at reception on the 8th floor, our bags were already in the room.A fantastic location close to all major attractions in the city, close to rail and other transport links.From our room we had a great view of the Sydney tower, the room was a good size well appointed.Staff were excellent will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: blazerg
Reviews.Content: We could not beat the price for this hotel. Tip: Check many booking agents and then book directly with the hotel. They offer a price match on their website with a discount on any rate you find elsewhere!!! The location is close to the airport train (helpful tip: it costs 15dollars a person for the train and a taxi is only about 35...) The front desk staff was efficient with taking our bags. The room was not ready as we arrived quite early, but when we got back, our bags had been delivered to the room. The rooms were clean and comfortable and a decent size. We had a room on a high floor with a view of the Sydney Tower next door. It is a pleasant walk to the Rocks/Cirular Quay, the Botanical Gardens and the Opera House. It is very close to Darling Harbour, but not worth a visit there if you are pressed for time. It is also just a block away from a Woolworth's grocery market where you can load up on snacks and drinks to avoid the minibar charges. Tip: if you are renting a car, look at the agents in Darlinghurst on William Street. It's a twenty minute walk (mostly through a nice park) and the rates are about half what you will find right in the central business district. Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel for a weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: BarbKs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the centre of the shopping area of Sydney. We had a room on the executive floor, which means you can use the executive lounge. The lounge is very nice, on the 24th floor, so has views out to the west of Sydney. You can see the blue mountains from there. In the everning there are drinks and food from 5.30. For breakfast you can choose from a hot breakfast or just continental in the lounge. Could have done with a couple more morning papers, but otherwise worth the money. The rooms have king beds, good airconditioning and facilities. What you would expect in a 5 star hotel in an international city. There is valet parking, a bit pricey, but similar to other hotels in the area. Its right near the QVB and Town Hall railway station, so you could get there very easily by train from the airport. Staff were welcoming, and nothing seemed too much trouble. Our friends got a package that included massages in the spa. They enjoyed it, the spa was lovely. The pool is in the sun in the afternoon, but the water was a bit cold to enjoy. We had a good weekend stay. I'd recomend this hotel , particularly if you were going shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: PassportPhilatelist
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Great location -- This is by far the biggest plus of this hotel. You can walk to key tourist attractions like Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, the aquarium, etc. The Queen Victoria Building (shopping mall) is right across the street. Close to transit. There are plenty of restaurants and supermarkets nearby. * Clean rooms * Spacious bathrooms * Comfortable bed * Good baby crib provided * Individual thermostat in each room, allowing you to specify a temperature (not just fan speed and heat/AC) * Fairly quiet being so many stories up from the street * Excellent breakfast that's great if it's included in your stay (but probably not worth AUD 30) * Fitness center is included with stay. It's adequate equipment-wise. Cons * Internet/wi-fi is expensive (AUD $25/day). * Elevator up to reception, then walk, then elevator to rooms. This gets annoying. * Draftiness from the windows even when the curtains were closed. * Impersonal nature of the place. Front desk staff is helpful when you ask them, though they don't go out of their way. They also don't seem to have enough front desk staff for the number of guests. There was always a wait to talk. * There is construction on a lot that one side of the hotel overlooks. The rooms on that side are probably noisier during the day when there is construction. I think this is a pretty good place to stay for families with young children -- the rooms are spacious, the bathrooms are huge and include a separate tub (good for bathing your kid), they provide good cribs, and you can walk to a lot of sites (no need to lug the stroller onto transit).

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value!”
Reviews.Author: moosh24
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is right in the heart of Sydney CBD, close enough to walk to many attractions or at least to public transportation to get to further out. The staff was very accomodating - our flight got in at 7AM and we were able to get an early check-in, which was much appreciated! We had the breakfast buffet there a couple times - a little pricey but good. The room was a little on the small side but for what we paid and how little we were in it, it really didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “A little retreat in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: cateeliza
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for the October long weekend and booked this hotel through a secret hotel deal. From the moment I turned up early to drop off my bags until the moment I left the service was exceptional. I was always greeted and wished a good day by the staff at the street level and the man who processed my check-in was welcoming and helpful. My room was on a corner of the hotel so I had 2 large windows and ample light, I had views of the water (in the far distance) and also a pretty view of the city lights at night. The batchroom was fabulous and the shower was roomy with excellent water pressure. My only concern (although short lived) about the bathroom was that there wasn't a standard Australian power outlet, rather it had an international power outlet. Upon further investigation I located a power point just outside the door which was close enough for me to use my appliances with ease in the bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and I had 3 exceptionally good nights sleep, there is also a pillow menu which I didnt need to use. The hotel was perfectly located for shopping (literally outside the door) and also only about 1 minute away from the free city loop bus, the Sydney explorer bus and also the monorail. St James train station is about 5 minutes walk up the road providing easy access from the airport. I didn't eat in the restaurant, however, I did order the continental breakfast in my room which was well priced and delicious. Housekeeping staff were thorough and my room was well maintained over my 3 night stay. I will definetely visit this gem again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: Tracy2471
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our wedding anniversary whilst staying in Sydney. Well my only comment can be I really can't believe this hotel made it to 5 star hotel. Having stayed in 5 star hotels previously I was disgusted at this hotel. The room was very poor, uninviting, lacking towels (a bath towel and a hand towel each). no bath robes, filthy windows and extremely rude staff. I could write pages on this review but if anyone would like to know what was wrong with this hotel please feel free to contact me directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaydub80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel in Sydney for 5 nights. I was very pleased with the stay. We arrived very early (8AM) and our checkin was at 2. They held our bags and had our room ready before 11AM. Our room was clean, had a large bathroom and lived up to my expectations for a 4-star hotel. The staff was extremely pleasant and we had a great stay. The hotel is also centrally located in the CBD, within walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and Chinatown.
