Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Great location, quiet room, great view, lots of natural light - highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: LovesDogsinSF
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Sydney is very well-located and in a happening part of town. Service was impeccable. Breakfast was good. The room was very quiet. There must be double-paned windows because I heard nothing from outside. There was also a huge bathtub and separate shower, which is always nice. I'd recommend this for everyone except someone looking for a hotel with historic charm. This place has modern rooms and modern furniture. It's got good public spaces in which to meet with friends. The lobby has a comfortable bar in the middle. GREAT location for the things I did as a tourist. I had lovely views out the windows of St.Mary's Cathedral, Hyde Park, and the Sydney space needle (or whatever it's called).

Reviews.Title: “Great place, terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: EddieVH
Reviews.Content: Where to start? I went to my room, there was another family in it! They upgraded me but my swipe card no longer worked when I went to check it out (I ended up with 8 swipe cards over the first 2 days!) Every morning at breakfast they had no record of me or my room (I was there for 6 breakfasts, surely they would have got the hang of it?) The wake up call came half an hour late People phoned the hotel to speak to me, the phone rang for over 10 minutes on 2 seperate occaisons and then someone else was advised that I was not staying there! I feared the worse 2 days from the end of my stay so checked that there were no added charges on my room - I was advised that there weren't. Guess what happned when I checked out.........a whole load of added charges had appeared! The hotel is great but the people and processes they have there are stink

Reviews.Title: “good value good location”
Reviews.Author: PerthRuss
Reviews.Content: stayed for the bledisloe weekend, good choice of hotel and to top it off the kiwi's won, great stuff.

Reviews.Title: “So disppointed after great reviews”
Reviews.Author: Joy6328
Reviews.Content: As I write this I am curled up in my Swissotel bed... that has no sheets. And thats after checking in to find that they had provided only one towel and there was no milk to make tea. Also - for a 5 Star Hotel - they only had 2 kinds of tea - Chamomile and English Breakfast. Even the 4 Star Hotels have at least 4 different kinds... But on to the good stuff - the location is phenomenal, smack bang in the middle of the city - with Myer on one side and David Jones on the other - you could not ask for better location. The rooms, while large, are disappointing in quality. Everything feels worn and budget, the mini bar is average yet ridiculously overpriced - $5.20 for a can of coke? The bathroom is nice - but nice in a B&B, not for a supposedly 5 Star Hotel. I admit I got hung up on only being given one towel (while travelling with my Mother), but they also only gave us one bar of soap. So that means sharing between the shower, bath and handbasin... I love that they have joined the doona bandwagon - but why can't we have a sheet as well? Is the Economic crisis THIS bad? All in all, I was disappointed to be staying here - if I hadn't secured a decent rate and prepaid in advance - I would check out tomorrow and spend my remaining night at another hotel - probably the Hilton, which looked pretty damn good from the Street today. Service was okay - nothing to write home about, but overall it is the standard that has let this hotel down. It is definately not 5 Star, and seeing as I wanted to really spoil my Mum on a weekend away - I feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mick051
Reviews.Content: The location, service and accomodation are second to none. The hotel was fully booked for the weekend yet you would be hard pressed to notice. Rooms are excellent. We stayed in a twin room. Orderd room service on the first night which was very nice and had the buffet beakfast which was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms and Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: playarater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights and were upgraded to the corner premier room - and what a room it was! Spacious, huge bed, great views, good in-room facilities, massive shower and bathroom, plus a load of other little add-ons such as complimentary water bottles and Lindt Chocolate delivered every evening made our stay all the more enjoyable. The location is second to none: 2 minute walk to City Centre Monorail; 3 minute walk to Town Hall train station; 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and its vast array of restaurants; 15 minute walk to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge; and loads of shops and food halls available on it's doorstep - Don't look any further than Swissotel if you plan to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, look no further”
Reviews.Author: westvalle
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay at the Swissotel. As others have said the rooms were great, beds comfortable. We had a fabulous deal through orbitz that included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, varied and delicious. Who can pass up nutella and warm croissants for breakfast? There were also made to order eggs, breakfast meats, lots of fruit, danishes, cereals, yogurts. My only gripe with the hotel was the add on charges that others have mentioned. At check-out I was surprised to find a $22 charge for a local call to a cell phone. And an additional charge for a local call to a restaurant. Other than those excessive charges I thought the hotel was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much better than this...”
Reviews.Author: SouthernAZTraveler
Reviews.Content: For the location and price, you can't get much better than this. In a sentence-stop your endless TripAdvisor search and book this hotel now. Rooms are clean, spacious, with tons of "extra" amenitiies that are lovely. I found the concierge to be extremely helpful with any and everything that I needed. Never ate at the restaurant, so I can't comment on it. I can say that I thought the spa/fitness center and beds were amazing. I can't understand why some people have had so many gripes about these two things on this site. Great location, great price, awesome hotel-book it now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, expensive add-ons”
Reviews.Author: Rutman
Reviews.Content: We received a great rate at this hotel through hotels.com, so staying here was pretty much a no-brainer. The location is fantastic ,if what you want to see are all the museums and touristy sites. Since it's located between subway stops, so you will probably find that walking or taking a bus is your best option. The CBD is very compact, similar to San Francisco, so walking isn't much of a problem. Our biggest surprise in Sydney was the cost of....well, about everything. The breakfast buffet is $30 at the Swissotel. They do offer a 20% off cupon on the full breakfast, so be sure you ask for enough to cover your stay. A family of four will spend $96 a day for breakfast. There are other breakfast options in the area (Silks, VellaNero, or the QVB) that will help you cut that down, but don't expect to get off for less than $15 a person. Lunches and dinners.....well, the price goes up from here. The Swissotel charges $25 a day, or $99 for a week. Finally, if a fitness room is important to you, look elsewhere. For a hotel this size, two treadmills (one was inoperable for a week of our stay) and a set of dumbells just isn't enough. There were people waiting for up to an hour to use the equipment, everyday. All in all a great place to stay if location is your most important need and you don't eat breakfast or workouot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ridiculous fees.”
Reviews.Author: abacabdan
Reviews.Content: Nothing but nice things to say about our room and the hotel in general. Well located, a sort walk to two train stations and Darling Harbour. Stylish lobby, comfortable rooms (including a gorgeous bathroom), and generally helpful staff. Couple small complaints. First, some of the fees were ridiculous. I was charged a "connection fee" for making a toll free call to an Australian number. Also, unless you really need it, skip the $20 per day internet. There is a Tom n Tom's coffee shop next to Town Hall with free wi-fi. Also, the concierge was always friendly but a bit hit or miss with the advice. We wanted to get away from the tourist areas to grab dinner, but every time we asked, the concierge kept directing us to Darling Harbour, the most touristy part of town, next to Circular Quay. Lastly, it seems surprising in this day and age that the front desk would assume that two men traveling together would want separate beds. Gay couples travel too. Simply asking "twins or king" would be more appropriate than "you'll want two twins, yes?" Not a big deal, but I guess I expected better for a cosmopolitan hotel. Oh, and while we were there there was construction going on on 3 different buildings around the hotel. A bit noisy in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “12 days of never needing to question the hotel selection, Priceless”
Reviews.Author: BookerTee
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is a great choice for anyone wanting access to tourist points in Sydney. I use a wheelchair and I didn't have any issues. But what i did have is a trip of a lifetime and my very own place to relax and think about the wonderful day as i planned for the next day. And this was all done on my room Balcony as I enjoyed my evening wine. Wonderful wine can be had at the hotel. Or you can just go a few blocks over to where you ride the subway and their is a little store with a big selection. l rented a car but I really didn't need to. Go and enjoy Sydney and the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: swissabroad76
Reviews.Content: We are a couple without children, 33 years old, and stayed in SwissÃ´tel Sydney for 7 nights end of Jul 2009. Positive: - Very centrally located, all major attractions within walking distance. - Concierge desk gave valuable advice on what could be done within a week's time in Sydney and surroundings, and helped us with car rental and tour bookings. - We didn't pay a premium on the tours the concierge desk recommended, as we discovered they charge the same price as if you book on site. - Very friendly staff who did their best to meet our special requests immediately (e.g. housekeeping went out of their way to find a suitable adapter for my laptop, and found one within minutes). - Hotel personnel doesn't expect any tips. We still gave them AUD 1 - 2 depending on the service. - We booked online over Tripadvisor and got very attractive rate (around USD 120 per night). - Concierge desk gave us parking space for our rental car for free as a compliment during 2 days (otherwise AUD 42 per day!). - Very comfy bed and a "pillow menu" to choose from. Negative: - The shower door leaked, so the floor outside was always wet, and the toilet didn't always flush properly. - There was only one small built-in closet to hang coats, but no other space to store our clothes, so we had to "live out of the suitcase". - Switchboard to control lights and aircon didn't work in the first few days. - Internet access was quite expensive, choices were around AUD 13 per hour, AUD 25 per day, or AUD 100 per week. - Concierge desk did not communicate very well internally. Although we were promised free parking for 2 days, we had to explain it several times to other concierges who weren't informed about it, and when checking out, we had the sum on our hotel bill. However, it was handled very courteously within a few minutes. We learned you should remember the name of the concierge who promises you anything. All in all, if you want to enjoy Sydney city life without having to take public transport or taxis all the time, it is a very recommendable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tasmaniantiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid July. Perfect location in the centre of the city- 5-10 min walk to most attractions within the city. Close to trains buses and the monorail. The staff were always very helpful and friendly-nothing was too much trouble. Our room on the 21st floor was quiet, spacious and with a great western city view.

Reviews.Title: “can i live here?”
Reviews.Author: jetlagsux
Reviews.Content: this was the nicest hotel i've ever stayed at. our room had a hallway and a great view of the tower. our bathroom had a tub and glass shower and there were great little things like a vanity mirror and a closet that lit up when opened. the bed was really comfortable with a downcomforter. BUT when i tried calling the concierge and housekeeping several times over my stay, the phone was only answered once. it was easier to ask the concierge on our way out. i think they are short staffed because after conversing with other guests, this was a common problem. but this was a minor inconvenience to the amazing-ness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the noise caused by nearby buidling site next to the Sydney Tower”
Reviews.Author: michaelchoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel service ,location and the facility are excellent.However, if your rooms are facing the sydney tower, then the trouble occurs as we will face the building site.Every mornig the drillling and digging machines will start to wotk at 7:00 am till? pm ,My room was above 18th floor but still you would be annoyed by the drilling machine noise.I think the construction will be lasted for some years,So check before you choose this hotel to go,otherwise, I agree it is a perfect choice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - centre of CBD”
Reviews.Author: j0belly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night for a weekend away . It truly is in the centre of the city - directly above Myers in Market street. The check-in was efficient and staff friendly and professional from the valet driver to the reception staff. In hindsight we regret we didn't indulge in the hotel's "high tea" - the food looked fabulous and was obviously popular. We stayed in a classic room - it wasn't huge but it was roomy enough for 1 night. The bathroom has a seperate shower and bath and was spotless and well fitted out. The rooms were quiet and we slept undisturbed. We drove from Newcastle so we used the valet parking - quite expensive at $42 overnight - but we couldn't find any cheaper within walking distance in the CBD. All in all - a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad service”
Reviews.Author: oermen
Reviews.Content: The reception was very rude, and i got stuck in the elevator the last night i was there.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fiftee
Reviews.Content: we had a great time and was very pleased with the motel location,the staff were very friendly and helpful they couldnt do enough for you.the room was spotless and had a great king beds. we enjoyed walking around sydneys tourist and night spots and found them to be so close. i would highly recomend this motel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sarahaahayes
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel, would reccomend for all type of travellers. We arrived after a 36 hour flight at 7 am and were brought straight to our room, no hassles. The room was very spacious and they put us at the back of the hotel because of the works going on at the tower. The bathroom in the room was great with a huge bath which is great for a long day in the city. We had breakfast one morning in the hotel, its a buffet and over priced, but i find that in most hotels. Nothing is more than a 10 minute walk, and if ur not into walking the train is just across the road. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great night's accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: angrytraveller23
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the afternoon and our car was taken by valet parking space quickly, but could also see the line of cars behind us, it felt a bit rushed, but given the close proximity to the CBD, it would be very difficult to have off street pull in facilities. Reception area was bright and airy, like the quick check in, and close proximity to the shopping district. Liked the 11 am check out, gave me time to go shopping first. Great hotel, will visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: stripper1
Reviews.Content: If your staying in Sydney you won't find a hotel as central and as comfortable as the swissotel. When you arrive at the doorway on the street,you go in and take the lift to the 8th floor and your confronted with a huge entrance hall with the reception,a bar,restaurants,conference rooms.It's like going into the cupboard and walking out into Narnia! It's huge,wooden and has the feel of the 1930's.Just gorgeous.There is another set of lifts that take you to the floors that your rooms are on. The room i had was huge with 2 king size beds and a rather good view though not of the bridge or Opera house but a view of the city which was fine.The usual draws, large cupboard,desk,coffee table and chairs.The bathroom was of the same proportion with white tiles with a splattering of black.Two sinks,a large bath with separate shower and fluffy white towels.With the rooms you also get a complementary morning paper of your choice.On the 10th floor is the spa where you can book different treatments.Also the Gym is situated there along with the outdoor heated pool.All in all this is a great hotel for location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishDave
Reviews.Content: We had a five night stay in this lovely hotel in Sydney on our visit to Australia. We had upgraded to the Club Level Suites and all the facilities of the Executive Lounge were available to us, so we took breakfast there each morning and availed of the evening drinks and canapÃ©s, you could also drop into the lounge during the day as they had plenty of cool drinks in the fridge (Alcohol fridge locked during day). The food was excellent with plenty of variety and a great view looking over Darling Harbour. The hotel is right in the middle of the main shopping area and walking distance to Darling Harbour (10 mins) The Bridge, Opera House, Rocks all about a 20-30 min stroll away. The public transport system is also on your doorstep so a great location. Rooms in the Club level were of good size with separate sitting area and so much space so it was well worth the upgrade. The entrance to the hotel is a little deceptive as it is a small lobby on ground level but one you take the lift you enter a far bigger reception area with a big bar/eating area then you need to get another lift to your room. Staff were excellent and very helpful and helped with arranging tours etc. Hotel also has swimming pool and fitness area and all are kept clean and tidy. The Sky Tower is only up the road from the hotel and is a must for the view of Sydney and the food to is excellent. We had made our reservation months in advance for a table for two at the window but on arrival we were ushered to a table on the level above the window tables as they told us they were busy, they had taken our drink order before we were shown to our table so we quietly told them, we had booked 4 months in advance and even they could not give us the window table as requested they could cancel the drink order and we would come back when one was available. Guess what !!! they found us one straight away and it was a beautiful scene seeing the sun set as we had our meal. All in all, could not fault the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - loved it”
Reviews.Author: The_hodge
Reviews.Content: The 2 stay night stay at the Swissotel was a birthday treat for my boyfriend. Upon arrival we were presented with a voucher for lunch at the bar and the food was delicious! The steak was unbelievable and it have it for free was completely unexpected. The breakfast delivered to the room the following morning was gorgeous and the service throughout the stay was second to none. There is also a jacuzzi and rooftop pool. A very central location and the room was spacious and spotless. We loved it and I would recommend this stay to anyone. Try hotelclub.com as we found a good rate for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_wee_kipper
Reviews.Content: Booked this via a last minute website, and was very happy with the place. I arrived two hours early, but there was a room available and early check-in was no problem. I had their "basic" room - which consists of a nice king bed, large work desk, two chairs, big built-in wardrobe, and a very nice bathroom with walk-in shower and separate bathtub. I had a view over the Sydney Tower building site but didn't find it very noisy - if you are more sensitive to noise ask for a room on the other side of the building. I didn't hear any guest noise except the rare bit of chatter from the lift area. The bed is quite firm, which is what I personally prefer, so this may not be the place for you if you like soft beds. There is a large LCD tv in the room with local and some Foxtel channels. Housekeeping were very prompt when I called up for extra towels to wash my hair (it's very long). All the staff were extremely friendly, helpful and discreet. The woman at check-in gave me a discount voucher for breakfast in their restaurant, but I didn't end up using it. If you want to eat cheaply, the Central Plaza food court just around the corner has lots of options to suit all tastes, the Retro Cafe across the street is also good, or you could get on the monorail and travel 5 minutes to Darling Harbour or Chinatown and find a restaurant or cafe there. Recommended for a truly comfortable stay in the heart of the CBD. Booking via some websites you can get a room here for only a few dollars more than a three star hotel, and it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better last time”
Reviews.Author: stlouiegirl81
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at Swissotel Sydney in 2007 was a bigger thrill than my most recent trip in June 2009. I was very much looking forward to staying there this trip based on my last stay, but I liked the hotel better when it was newer because it seemed cleaner. My husband and I agreed that the chairs in the Crossroads bar in the lobby needed serious reupholstering. The dirty arms and obvious spilled food/drinks on the chairs actually made me feel grossed out to sit in them. I do still like the room.s Well, I actually think the bathrooms are the best part of the rooms for the full length tub and cool Swiss design. The spa has a very nice menu, but I decided I'd rather spend my money on new clothes than spa treatments. My husband and I agreed that our flatscreen TV was too small to actually watch from the distance of the bed. In summary, the Swissotel is a very nice place, but it just seems some details have been overlooked, and for the same price, I question if you could find a nicer, more updated place. That said, the Marriott near Hyde Park costs more per night, and my husband and his colleagues agree that Swissotel is a better value - a nicer place for less money. If you want to shop, then I would recommend Swissotel because it's by the QVB, Myer and David Jones. But if you want to sightsee, then I am very fit (work out daily) but quickly tired of the walk to the Circular Quay, and I preferred the Mantra, even if it wasn't as clean or stylish. As this was my 5th trip to Sydney, I was looking for some "off the beaten path" suggestions for restaurants and things to do from the concierge. I found the concierge completely useless, and that I could have done a better job myself! They are still recommending the same restaurants they told us about in 2007! And, on a Sunday night at 9 when we needed dinner, they told us about 1 restaurant, which we'd already eaten at and did not like. If we weren't willing to go there, they said nothing else in Sydney would be opened! Pardon me?! Even I could list a few places. My husband and I went for a walk and found a few choices of places that still had kitchens open. They best part of staying at Swissotel Sydney is the style / decor and closeness to shopping. The worst pary of staying here is the useless concierge, long walk to Circular Quay, and furniture that needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: Chazwazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Sydney for 3 nights over the Queen's B'day long weekend - got a great deal 3 nights for the price of 2. It was only for the Classic Room, but wow what a room! The room was really big, with a king bed, desk and lounge chair. And the bathroom was amazing! There was a separate shower (the best shower ever according to my husband!) and bath and all the usual amenities. We had a view of Sydney Tower from our room, ok granted you had to crane your neck a bit to see the top, but we usually get a view of another building, so it was a nice change! The staff seemed really nice, we didn't try out the restaurant or get room service, so can't comment on that. The location is really good - just around the corner from the monorail station and a block away from Town Hall train station. The only thing we can fault the hotel on is that the curtains don't block out the light, My husband is a really light sleeper and the first ray of light usually wakes him up. They really should get block out curtains. Overall though a wonderful stay, will definitely return when in Sydney next :)

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: Sin123
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family last May and I've been around the world but this stay has been memorable. The service was excellent and Staff was polite and helpful. Rooms are comfortable and roomy, clean surroundings and the bar is nice. Reception area is efficient and the Concierge are lovely they are most helpfull in evry way!!! The hotel is in the heart of the City and I would definetly come back and stay here next year......... Well Done Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: traveler927534971
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Sydney on 68 Market Street in June of 2009 on a three-day business trip from America. Orbitz had a special deal on this place, and I found an additional online Orbitz "Promotion Code" via Google which took another 10% off my stay. Therefore, I paid only ~115 USD/night inclusive of all taxes and fees!!! Anyways, here is my experience: Room: I had the least expensive room; however, I was very satisfied. The room was very clean, spacious enough for 1-2 people, and had a nice desk for work. The TV is a ~26" LCD display which has CNN, FOX, Cartoon Network, local programming, pay movies, etc. I liked the control which allows you to operate the air conditioning, room lights, and wake alarm right from the nightstand at the bed! Very thoughtful! Minor gripe: there is a construction site next door which has construction workers operating during business days from about 08:00 to 16:00. More important gripe: the bed is VERY firm. I prefer a softer bed, so this was a moderate gripe for me. Internet in Room: Big Disappointment. The charge is around 25 AUD/24 hours, and the connection is VERY slow (about 0.5 Mb/sec). I get faster speeds in the US on a cellular 3G connection! Exercise Facility: There is a small room on the 10th floor with cardio LifeFitness and a few other strength machines. There are two stationary bikes, two treadmills, and one eliptical. There are also two televisions in the exercise room. All of the equipment I tried worked well but none of the machines had cup/bottle holders for your water. Pool/Hot Tub: Adjacent to the exercise room there is a beautiful pool (lap swimming is possible), hot tub, and some lounge chairs for sun tanning. The pool and hot tub are heated quite well. Main restaurant: I had the 30 AUD buffet breakfast, and it was disappointing. I chose to eat breakfast here since the restaurant opened at 06:00 (excellent for a business traveler), but the food items were not fully setup until around 06:45. There is a cooking station for cook-to-order items like eggs, waffles, pancakes, etc, but the cook did not seem to want to cook me anything. The food quality was good, but the lack of being fully open at restaurant opening and attitude of the chef left me with a bad feeling about this place. Location: Excellent! For business travelers, you are right in the heart of the Sydney CBD. For touring, you are about a 10-15 minute walk from Circular Quay (ferries depart here to Taronga Zoo), and you are less than a five-minute walk to Hyde Park. INSIDER INFORMATION: Take the AirportLink train from the airport to St. James rail station to get to the hotel. The fare is 15.20 AUD each way (less on a return ticket), and the service is very good. Also, St. James station is less than a five-minute walk to the hotel (three blocks). A cab from the airport will cost you at least 45 AUD each way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with unexpected freebies”
Reviews.Author: Numbats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel as a 40th birthday treat and opted for the Romance package. It is right in the heart of everything - the State theatre just across the road and the main shopping precinct all around. Our view was over Pitt St Mall and the straining steel cables that hold Centrepoint Tower upright. We loved that - though admittedly others may not.. Our chocolate stawberries and champagne were awaiting us on arrival. Later on, we discovered the club lounge - Ive forgotten which floor. This was great - a good selection of quality wine and hot and cold foods all FREE and constantly replenished. I am sorry to say we ate and drank so much we had no need of dinner! The valet parking is neccessary and expensive as there's no other parking for KMs. And it took a long time - an hour I'd say - to reclaim our car in the morning. But that seemed a small glitch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wandererplus
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a great stay at Swissotel. We arrived very early and they were able to give us a room by 10am at no extra cost. The rooms were comfortable and clean. We had a view of the rooftop pool and everything in the room worked (not always the case when you have such a reasonable rate). The staff was very helpful and willing to provide current converters on request. The concierge staff was always willing to help set up a trip or give directions. We did not try the hotel restaurant since it seemed a little pricy and because there were so many other options in the neighborhood. Great location, in walking distance to Darling Harbor and the Quay. Our only problem was that the room keys needed to be reset almost daily (the staff said that some of the local malls had some sort of magnetic system that would wipe the keys), but overall we were very happy. While its ambiance had more of a business feel, my 14 year old still had a great time. The unheated pool, while chilly for me, was great for him and I enjoyed the heated whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: shazzashort
Reviews.Content: I booked this through an on-line wwebsite without knowing anything about it becuase the rate was good, but i was plesantly surprised. great facilities - including pool & spa on the roof (which was heated and in winter it was so good!) beautiful foyer. room quite small for australian standards but for the price we paid you couldn't complain. very convenient location, would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean central location but problem finding food after 6pm”
Reviews.Author: winmei
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 4 night stay at this hotel and paid AUD195 per room and managed to get a Swiss Executive Room (free upgrade). The hotel is modern and clean and staff were generally friendly. We got a room on the 23rd floor and it had decent views and we did not have problems with noise as what some other travellers had experienced. The keycard entry system was OK and the trick is to slide it into the holder slowly. Pluses: 1. very central location - right next to Myer department store and Pitt St Mall 2. clean and modern interior, representative of a 4-star establishment 3. pillow menu available 4. rooms were large and airy There were only a couple of negative points:- a. after 6pm, there were hardly any places to get food, with the exception of a 7-11 about 1-2 blocks away and some sushi cafe around the corner; as such the only places to go for meals were to Darling Harbour, Chinatown or to the suburbs; the hotel has a restaurant but we didn't try it but we did sample the room service and it was decent stuff b. staff did not inform us when we checked in that we were entitled to use the Swiss Executive Lounge for free; we only found out about this perk through friends upon our departure; in most other hotels that we have stayed, the staff would have simply given us a gentle reminder about this

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulnaden
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the city shopping area you enter the foyer and are greeted by a great concierge team who do their utmost to look after you and your bags.We had arrived early at 0830 knew the room would not be ready so went to explore a bit of Sydney.There was a food court under the hotel so to speak so got cups of tea there then walked up to st james park. Finally got to our rooms about 1130,nice spacious and roomy with the comfyist beds (2 doubles) ive ever slept in.B/fast is expensive,Â£15 each for the full (hot items) b/fast (Â£10 for continental) and the hot items turned out luke warm for us.There is a diner opposite,Â£5 for bacon,eggs tea and toast. Drinks are also 4* prices with a beer at Â£4 a glass and a coke Â£2.50.For dinner there are fantastic places to eat in Sydney so we did that,you are looking at Â£25-Â£30 each for main course only at the swissotel.Great pool and spa area,rooms well maintained and cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the best location!”
Reviews.Author: AlexTennis
Reviews.Content: I made another review earlier that I didnâ€™t get a response on my email from the Swissotel for several days after I made a reservation. Finally, I got a response from both the staff member and the General Manager with an apology for the delay. The actual stay was very lovely! The hotel is very modern, comfortable, with friendly staff and has a great location. I was upgraded to the executive level and had a great view from the room and an exclusive access to the executive lounge on 24th floor which has great snacks in the afternoon (such as cheers, fruit, wine, champagne, salami, etc). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place in the heart of the CBD district, you literally walk out side and you are in the middle. It is also located next to all major shopping streets of the CBD. Great room and it was very clean. Attentive stuff made the stay really nice. We did not try the breakfast buffet. Nice was the Nespresso coffee machine in the room with complementary pads for usage.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: nswscrapper
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit, but my first alone. I arrived from a flight at 9.00am and was able to check in immediately - a great start to the stay! My room had everything i could desire. There was no view but that didn't concern me at all. The quality of inclusions was excellent and the bathroom was truly special. Everyone I met was so helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again. I was on the 13th floor. Just an aside - I travelled from the airport to the city via shuttle (KST SYDNEY AIRPORTER) and it cost me $20 for two trips - great value! I hope to stay at the Swissotel next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: buzybeeme
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I thought it would be a luxury experience for my daughter and me while vacationing in Sydney. But, this hotel is not at all friendly for young kids. First, the pool which is supposed to be heated is not heated and was too cold to swim in which bothered us since that is a fun part of staying in hotels. The biggest problem was our experience at Crossroads Bar. We stopped in for a light dinner after a day of touring. I ordered a pina colada with a virgin colada for my daughter. The server gave my drink to my daughter. She had been drinking it before I took a sip I mine and realized she had my drink. Our waitress notified both the server and the bartender. The bartender asked if my daughter was okay, but the server was more concerned with trying to blame the bartender for the mix-up. They didn't even bother to comp the drinks. I notified the manager in the morning and she just said she'd put it in her report. Considering giving alcohol to an 8 year old is a legal offense and could have poisoned my daughter, I expected a formal apology from management at the least but did not get one. They did not show the appropriate level of concern for my daughter's safety. For those people without kids, this hotel might work based on location which is its selling point: centrally located (a block from Sydney Tower and the Town Hall train station). They also gave us early check in which was greatly appreciated after our long flight. The room was small and the construction outside was annoying, so I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone anytime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location..”
Reviews.Author: glencdawson
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel offers great value for money and is in a very central position in the heart of the CBD. The small hotel lobby is on Market street, next to the Myer departmental store. On arrival we were met by the helpfull concierge who escorted us and our luggage up to the reception area on the 8th floor. Our room which was on the 16th floor was clean, very modern and had a superb bathroom (one of the best I have ever had in a hotel). It had ample storage space, an LCD TV, a safe, minibar and tea/coffee making facilities. However, from the window we just had views of other nearby buildings. (Some of the rooms on the higher levels would have had considerably better views of the city). Despite being in a very busy location between George and Pitt street, we were never disturbed by any street noise as the hotel is shielded by other buildings and the rooms are quite high up. The hotel also boasts a gym with extremely modern equipment, a half decent outdoor pool, a jacuzzi and Sauna/Steam room. In terms of location, the hotel is right in the middle of the main shopping area of the city and is around 5minutes walk away from Darling Harbour. There are also several nearby train stations. Circular Key and The Rocks are around 15 - 20 minutes walk away (depending on the traffic lights!) A cab from the airport costs around 30-50AUD's depending on the time of day. We didn't eat at the hotel, so couldn't comment on the restaurant / quality of food. Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel. It did seem to offer excellent value for money, considering the price of some of the neighbouring hotels. The only slight drawback for us as tourists, was the distance to Circular Key. We did seem to spend a considerable amount fo time down there and therefore found ourselves walking up and down George Street several times a day. For us the ideal location would have been on The Rocks, but appreciate that the hotels there cost considerably more (and are not necessarily of as good quality as the Swissotel) .

Reviews.Title: “Swishotel!”
Reviews.Author: TTDIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned following a five night stay in this wonderful hotel in Sydney on our first visit to Australia. On arrival from an early morning flight, we were given access to our Junior Suite which was most welcome. All the staff played a large part in the enjoyment of our holiday, with nothing being too much trouble.The suite itself was extremely spacious, modern, well equipped ,bright and very comfortable.The Nespresso Machine was particularly appreciated ! All the facilities of the Executive Lounge were available to us so we took breakfast there each morning and availed of the evening drinks and canapes. The food there was excellent and with a lovely evening view of sunset over Darling Harbour who could ask for more? The staff were most attentive and the whole atmosphere we found to be quite homely! The hotel itself is right in the middle of the main shopping area and walking distance to The Bridge, Opera House, Rocks etc. The public transport system is also on your doorstep so a great location. All in all we had a marvellous time at the Swissotel and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel - When you experience luxury at its best, You won't want anything less”
Reviews.Author: jetsnotary
Reviews.Content: If you are going on a trip to Sydney. I strongly recommend SWISSOTEL for accommodation. This hotel is in the heart of the Sydney CBD, very short walk to train station, QVB, malls, landmarks and the international airport. Swissotel is a 5 star luxury hotel and the room's are pristine, elegant and the amenities superb. The staff from this hotel are extremely friendly, from the hotel guest reception, the housekeeping staff , the manager at the club lounge and most specially the CONCIERGE department. They are extremely helpful when it comes to helping you organize day trips, recommendations on places to eat, and directions to any places. Business clients will enjoy most when staying at this hotel, the Club Lounge has all the amenities needed for a busy person on the go and all work can be done with the internet, fax and phone facilities readily available at the lounge. Forget about fine dining, the food at the club lounge are superb !! It is inclusive if you reserved a room with the club lounge priviledges. I highly recommend this hotel to all and will let anyone I know who decides to visit Sydney. This is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy customer”
Reviews.Author: jadelish
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels but it's fair to say that Swissotel is a cut above the rest. My last memorable stay at Swiss was on my wedding night where the staff were more than helpful, significantly the concierge team went above and beyond their duties. Not only did I receive a complimentary wine upon my arrival, concierge also organised a private car service the very next day that took me to the airport for my honeymoon. Well done Swissotel, my stay there was icing on the cake (after a long and busy wedding day)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: AussieGoGirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times now and I have been impressed each time. The rooms are always clean and rather spacious, the breakfasts are comprehensive and you are right in the centre of town above Myer and literally just behind Pitt street mall. One complaint I did have was that the conference facilities are small and FREEZING with no natural light. We asked them to turn the AC down, but the temperature remained in the teens. Otherwise the stays have been comfortable and pleasant in a 'Swiss' kind of way, not opulent by any means, but clean, comfortable, practical and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Rooms and Service”
Reviews.Author: kiwimissy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Sydney CBD and shopping areas. We stayed three nights and had a superb time. Our room was very large - we had a room with two double beds, a large bathroom, with bath and shower. It was sufficent for three adults comfortably. The pool is also an asset and whilst we didnt use it the gym/spa area looked just as good. We had one maintenance issue and after reporting it to housekeeping, we had it fixed in 15 minutes. Excellent service and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: wumpus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Swissotel on Market St. three times now in the space of 14 months, this time for 12 nights in an Advantage room. The location is great - right in the middle of the of the city. It's a short walk to circular quay, and I actually quite like the route. The bathrooms are always good and spacious, very clean and well serviced, and the showers have a good flow of water. The bath is easily big enough to soak in. The staff are very friendly and helpful and there's always a smile and a hello as you go in and out. The rooftop swimming pool on the 10th floor is a nice bonus. It gets the sun from around 1pm onwards and again is very clean and well managed. The gym is basic but works pretty well. There's a good range of dumbells that meet my needs and it's never been too busy. I personally find breakfast a little disapointing for the cost, and prefer to eat out. i can recommend several places within 3 mins walk with honestly a better quality breakfast for less money. Sorry Swissotel - I tried a few times and decided against. On balance though, I keep going back and rebooking. It meets all of my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bedding is a bit uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: sjcan8119
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to be within Sydney! I was a visiting and wanted to be in the heart of it all! This is one of the places that I would go back to just because it was so close to everything. The room was comfortable enough, but I would have to say that it is time to replace the mattress as they were not so comfortable. The bathroom was a great size and comfortable for relaxing (soaker tub, large shower). It also was large enough for two people to get ready! The hotel was quiet and the review were very nice. I did eat in the dining and I was impressed with the quality. Overall, nice place to stay and would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: FrankM_9
Reviews.Content: Restaurant very good. Problem with bathroom was resolved very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rm215
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel in December for a weekend in Sydney to take in a show at the State Theatre - which is directly across the road! The location is great - central to all of the city attractions, shopping and numerous eating venues. A short stroll and you catch the monorail to Darling Harbour or Paddy's Markets. Or grab a bus to the harbour and Circular Quay - including a free bus option. Just around the corner is the Queen Victoria building, above you and around you the Myer complex (six floors of it), Pitt Street Mall with an array of buskers and performers (and lots and lots of people!!) We had no problem with the two lifts issue. They both run regularly. The service from staff was excellent right throughout our stay - from concierge to room service to house keeping - and we got the Endless Weekend option upgraded into a Swiss Advantage Room (25th floor) at no extra charge. We had breakfast in our room rate - but probably wouldn't have eaten there otherwise and only had a dessert on one evening, preferring to sample the local offerings. The food is pricey, but we expected that. The rooms are comfortable and bright, excellent showers and if you're used to a softer bed, ask for the pillow top option (like egg carton foam). Being so high up we had no external noise issues. We'll have no hesitation staying there again if in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: stevebeads
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel twice over Xmas 2008 and New Year and both times had the same great comfortable experience. The hotel is centrally located in the CBD which makes it easy walking distance from Circular Quay (and hence the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the Rocks), Darling Harbour and Chinatown, plus all the shops are on your doorstep. If you're less mobile, there is a free bus that shuttles between the CBD and Circular Quay, plus you're very close to train stations (for the airport, Kings Cross, Bondi Junction) and spitting distance of the SkyTrain to Darling Harbour & Chinatown. The hotel reception is actually on the 8th floor of the building and is spacious and well decorated. I stayed twice over Xmas 2008, and there were building works happening on the Sydney Tower which my rooms (23rd floor, East facing) overlooked, but there was no disruptive noise at all - I slept superbly! (note - the works did not affect the view either). The room itself was spacious, bright, fresh and very comfortable. And the bed was so good I wanted to take it home! If there's anything I can criticise, the expresso machines in the rooms are only good if you like your coffee by the thimble. Also the service at the bar was absurdly slow. Neither issue caused me loss of sleep ;-) If I'm lucky enough to return to Sydney, I'm definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: pompeyron
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were required to be in Sydney for two days due to business, but also managed to find some tme for sightseeing. We both found the staff to be curteous and helpful at all times. The room was quite comfortable and the airconditioning worked well. We were able to take a walk down to the harbour from the hotel without too much exertion on our part and we are not exactly the fittest of people. We had a buffet style breakfast where we could help ourselves to as much as we wanted, and coffee and tea was included. we would certainly stay there again if back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “super sydney”
Reviews.Author: guidedug
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Swissotel in Market Street, Sydney with my wife and daughter aged 3.5 in mid December .We had a great time in Sydney . The hotel is very handily placed for most of the main attractions in Sydney . Its within walking distance of Darling Harbour , Circular Quay , Opera House , Sydney Bridge , Sydney tower (next door ) ,Botanic gardens and the Rocks , even walking at the pace of a three year old . Its is very handily placed for the monorail and the tour buses that run up George Street . We booked a family room - kids themed room . This comprised of two double beds , one for the adults and one for my daughter which had kids duvet set , numerous cuddly toys , kids table and chairs . It also had a DVD player in the room with kids DVDs available for hire . It was the first time we had seen anything like this and made my daughter settle very quickly . Beds were comfortable and quiet , we were on 13th floor . The hotel has a smallish outdoor pool which is meant to be heated but it wasn't very warm when we where there in mid December , especially on the cloudier days . Breakfast is buffet style and there was a reasonable choice . Conceirge staff were very friendly and helpful . They could even recommend a kids buggy/ stroller hire , which was a godsend as in the early evenings our daughter got tired and is a bit heavy to carry so the stroller was great. ( Can be hired from Rocks Pharmacy , opposite Police Station) . Only downside , like most hotels these days , is that the internet access/ costs is complete rip-off compared with Internet cafes . We did a fair of site seeing , Taronga Zoo , Sydney tower , Opera House , Open top bus tours , Sydney Aquarium to name a few . I did the Bridgeclimb on the Sydney Bridge , its is fab and not to be missed , We did the beaches Bondi, Manly and Coogee beaches and played in the surf . Had great mojitos , though pricey in Argyle bar on Argyle Street and good food in Rocks cafe . Overall , i would say that the Swissotel is in a great location and I felt reasonably priced . We would return and have recommend it to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed; too far from harbor”
Reviews.Author: sueinnj
Reviews.Content: My criteria for picking a hotel in Sydney was finding one with an outdoor pool and outdoor deck. The Swissotel had both, however the pool felt like a dungeon with high walls and no views. The pool is on the west side of the building, so no direct sunlight is possible in the morning and by afternoon there is full shade from the high surrounding walls. The room was stuffy and the A/C did not adequately control the humidity level in the room. The heavy duvet on the bed was too much for summertime, however there was no separate sheet or blanket and I was either drenched in sweat or freezing as I slept. Noise from the hallway (including the ice machine) was easily heard in my room. My room was on the 15th floor and had a view of other tall buildings. The location is quite far away from the harbor, so I'm not sure even rooms on higher floors facing north would see the harbor. The furniture in the lobby bar/restaurant was worn and the portions in were tiny and the staff up-tight. The guests were rather young & loud while I was there. I think there must be better places to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a great experience”
Reviews.Author: IOLZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel prior to going on Australia /NewZealand Cruise. We found the Hotel to be of a very high standard. The room and beds could not really be faulted. We had Contiental Breakfast and found this was very reasonable and enough for us to start the day. Delivery of cases to room could have been a bit quicker but we were let into the room early which is a good bonus.Hotel is near Darling Harbour which is wonderful to see and meals fantastic. We had trouble however with a Company called Boutique Tours which run tours to the Hunter Valley. I booked on the Internet four days prior to travel and gave my Credit card details. No e-mails or phone calls before I left and therefore booked with Activity Tours who were great. Now find my Credit card has been charged for trip we did not have. To date still no word from Boutique Tours.Maybe some sort of scam. You,ve been warned.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rita20
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in january and were traveling with our teenage children . we arrived and although we had booked a double room and twin room . we were given 2 double rooms on 2 different floors and the receptionist said nothing else was available, our teenagers son and daughter were not happy. she was not pleasant and eventually agreed to put a rollaway bed into the room and she would change for another room the next day. when we enquired the next day she had not done anything and we had to wait until the following day . when sorted the rooms were nice poor views . alot of noise from corridors. i would not stay in this hotel again especially with children.location is great

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NDu7
Reviews.Content: My Stay at Swissotel Sydney was fabulous. A 5* experience within a 5* hotel. I found the hotel staff to be friendly, caring, efficient and they always had a smile. They made our three kids feel like special. The rooms were lovely, large with the little extra touches. The location is fantastic for shopper and the kids enjoyed the walks to Darling Harbour. A great stay, Thank you Swissotel Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Arrived New Year's Eve for a 3 night stay. Welcomed at the entrance on the ground floor by the concierge (who were always polite and greeted us on arrival and very helpful when we needed a taxi to the airport - which was about $30). The main reception in on the 8th floor where there is also a bar and restaurant. The bar served great pizzas and meals until 11pm which was handy, although the service was a little relaxed! Breakfast was not included and was $30 each, although there are plenty of other places to eat close by. We arrived at 1pm and as check in was not officially until 2pm we were not surprised that our room was not ready. The receptionist offered to ring our mobile when our room was available but 2 hours later had still not rung although we went back to reception at 3pm and were advised it was! We stayed on the 21st floor and had views over the city roofs only. The room was comfortable but the bed and pillows were very firm. Nice corner shower and coffee machine. The location was great in the middle of the CBD (but still quiet as so high above ground) but next time we would stay nearer The Rocks or Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Sydney is in a great location and the unusual hotel entrance is no problem.Our first impession of the reception area was very good nice and open and modern.Check in was very smooth and even though we arrived at 8.00am our room was ready. The room on the 22nd floor gave good views over the city and was spacious and well presented.The room had a large comfortable bed good size flat screen tv and space for a sofa as well as a desk. The bathroom was large and very clean with both a bath and seperate shower and was very impressive. Overall the service from all the staff was very good especailly on the lounge floor,this is well worth the extra cost. The only problem and issue was with regard to the bed linen,the sheets on the bed and duvet cover were not that new to say the least but housekeeping swifly sorted this out ,however the replacement bed cover was still stained and had frankly seen better days.I would expect a better attention to detail in a hotel of this standard. Apart from this fairly minor issue I must say trhat this is the best hotel I have stayed in ,in Sydney and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Special treatment on a special birthday”
Reviews.Author: Belle069
Reviews.Content: For my 65th birthday my husband and I were treated to a wonderful night at the hotel. The location of the hotel is fantastic in the heart of the City, very easy to locate and within working distance to many attractions. The room was superb, the staff very efficient and helpful. Not used to such luxury we were pleasantly surprised when a bottle of champaign and a birthday wish was delivered to our room from the lovely staff there. We felt very special and I had a wonderful 65th birthday. I thoroughly enjoyed our evening there and would highly recommend a stay at this very central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimsumdolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one week at this hotel. We had booked a flight+hotel package from a travel website and requested a "swiss advantage" room, which was supposed to be a room on a higher floor. The taxi dropped us outside the hotel, and immediately a bellboy came to help. The reception is on the 8th floor and we got our room keys promptly. The room was paid for but we were of course asked for a credit card for the extras. Our room was situated on the 23rd floor, executive floor, but we did not have access to the executive lounge. The room was odd-shaped, and overlooked a massive construction site. It was extremely noisy that afternoon, but thankfully it got more quiet the next day.Maybe because it was around christmas? The Internet connection was not working for the 1st day and we thought almost 30AUS$ for a 24h connection was a rip-off. During our week-long stay in the hotel, none of the bell-boys greeted us on the way in or out. The staff (technicians, housekeeping) we met on our floor would not even look at us! The housekeeping was the best, our room was always spotless and our amenities refilled. Once though, I called the room from the outside hoping to talk to my husband and it was the maid who answered saying no one was there! We had room service one night. An ok club-sandwich and the most awful spaghetti with meatballs I've ever seen. They even smell disgusting...We didnt try any restaurant or bars. I would only recommend this hotel for the location, super central, and next to many shops, the harbour, chinatown,... One more thing, we could not believe that we were charged an extra 1.5% on the bill because we used a VISA credit card!

Reviews.Title: “A Very 3-Star Experience at the Swissotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Global01
Reviews.Content: On planning my first trip back to Australia after an 8 year hiatus, I was looking for a centrally located property with superior facilities and a very high level of personal service. After significant online research, I unfortunately selected the Swissotel. While the location is certainly very central there were plenty of other higher-end properties within a 5 block radius. Unlike most of the other properties, this hotel does not have any form of driveway, port cochere, etc. , so the taxi driver has no choice but to drop their passengers curbside. Rather, as close to curbside as possible - This is a VERY busy city street; the hotel is located directly opposite a major theatre and is technically within the physical building of a major department store. When I arrived, there were already cars double parked in front of the tiny hotel entry way, so I was let off in the middle of the street with no bellman in sight. After dragging my bags into the the street level micro-lobby, I was directed to the 8th floor for a proper check in. There was a huge line-up at checkin, but my room was actually ready. I had booked a junior suite and that is the room type I got. The room itself was respectable, clean, and generously proportioned. Unlike many other reviewers, I found the bed to be quite comfortable - it is rather firm, but of a good quality with above average bedding materials. The inclusion of an in-room Nespresso coffee machine was a very nice touch. The rest of the room was rather unspectacular. Think Sheraton Four Points - not at all bad, but not 5 star. The biggest failing of this hotel was the staff. They were all very young and inexperienced and it really showed. The front desk staff maintained a calm pleasant demeanor, but were unable to process all but the most simple of basic service requests. If you were not out of your room by 1pm forget about getting the room serviced - "It is not possible" was the reply from housekeeping. The lone bright spots in service were the executive lounge staff who were very competent, albeit not as personable and friendly as is the norm. The biggest standout surprise was the hotel security - this gentelman actually seemed to function as more of a manager than the duty managers did. He actually repsonded directly to guest concerns and after a few days, I noticed other guests actually seeking him out for resolution of their issues. I noticed that many of the positive reviews of this property were from those staying a short time (1 to 3 days) Perhaps that, combined with some rather attractive online pricing makes this more of an aspirational 5 star - entry level luxury if you will. The bottom line - if you get the hotel at a favorable rate and are looking for clean and close you'll probably be just fine. If, however, you are looking for something special - keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Swissotel Syendy”
Reviews.Author: NikkoleC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel for our wedding/honeymoon. We had the best time! The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to help us and make sure we had a wonderful stay. Our room was clean and very comfortable. There were a total of 13 people in our party and everyone had a wonderful time. The hotel is in a great location, close to shopping and right in the cbd. It's walking distance to Darling Harbour, Hyde Park and Royal Botanic/Opera House. It is also close to monorail stations and train/bus stations. Get the executive club when you book w/ breakfast, pre-dinner drinks and internet access. Tracy and the club staff are VERY HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jacko657
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the hotel was nice, concierge very polite and helpful. The lobby and check in is upstairs via the elevator. I found the reception staff blunt and not entirely friendly, it was not a very warm welcome there. My hotel room was spacious and very clean and the bathroom was gorgeous, big bath with separate shower enclosure which I loved. I did not eat in the hotel but had some drinks with friends in the bar, slow service but nice atmosphere. The hotel is very close to Darling Harbour and a few steps from George Street which is a straight walk down (about 10 minutes) to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The concierge staff are very helpful with booking trips and will advise you on a variety of companies. The hotel room was very cosy and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: Jawsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 6 nights in late November. It's well-situated - only one block away from Town Hall station and an easy walk from Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. There was a building site next door, but we had no experience with noise from this. The staff were very polite and helpful, and the room was lovely. A good size room with a king-size bed which was very comfortable. I slept very well there! The bathroom was a good size. All very clean and pleasant. We didn't eat at the hotel or have a drink there - we had breakfast just over the road in the cafe, which was lovely. The bar seemed very popular though. Some people have complained about having to get 2 lifts to their room... this is really not a problem and shouldn't put you off! There's no need to find your way through a shopping centre first as some seem to have suggested! All in all, a very comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney ,An excellent place to visit and stay with your loved ones”
Reviews.Author: kanchangairola
Reviews.Content: I can never forget my trip to Sydney, Australia with my husband in Nov 2007. I was five months pregnant and desparetely wanted a holiday for few days. so my husband took me to this surprise holiday in Sydney. we stayed in swissotel, which was lovely place , the room was so cozy and gave us full view of the city. The hotel is in the Market place. The Oprah house was just a walking distance from our hotel is a magnifiecient piece of architecture, all the attractions are simply mindblowing. Though I was pregnant , I walked and covered many places on foot as walking in the lovely weather was amazing. Be it Bondi beach or Sydney tower or the Casino or Sydney harbour bridge or the Hyde park and other places , all the attractions are worth visiting. And hey not to forget the food , being an Indian I craved for Indian food which is easily available in sydney. What a place , I m again going to visit in 2009 with my Little Daughter and husband. Sydney surely rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Swissotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Vitorio21
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel in Sydney is beautiful, and is located in the heart of downtown Sydney near Darling harbor. This hotel is definitely the place to stay if you enjoy a higher-end experience. The rooms were small, boutique rooms but very comfy and well appointed. We had a king sized bed with a down comforter and a pillow menu. The bathroom was decorated in blue and white tiles, and the separate shower was the best part of the bathroom. The a/c worked great and we had a small, but nice flat screen television to watch. The views were great, although there is construction going on next door but it was not bothersome at all. The lobby of the hotel is very nice, with a restaurant and a bar in the center. There is a heated pool and jacuzzi on the 10th floor, where the spa is. The staff are friendly and very helpful. We didn't eat at the restaurant or have drinks at the bar. We went out into the city and experienced Sydney, eating breakfast at various places like cafes in the QVB and near the Opera House. We had dinner at a few places (Medussa's, Kobe Jones). Kobe Jones is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: sunnyj1279
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is very central, just 5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. The Service from all the staff was very professional. The room was extremely clean.. However, the beds were very uncomfortable. My husband who likes a firm mattress also found the bed too hard. There was an option on the "pillow menu" to have a foam underlay but when I rang housekeeping they told me that they didn't have any spare underlays! So we had three very uncomfortable nights! On a positive note, the rooms are very quiet. Breakfast in the hotel is very expensive....$30 per person...not much of a selection and the scrambled eggs were overcooked & cold as was the bacon. Better to go to the cafe next door to the hotel for a full breakfast for $11.90.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneJessicaMay22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst on business in Sydney, as my company has an agreement with the Swissotel. On arrival, I was asked for a credit card, even though my stay was to be fully charged back to my companys AMEX. I informed the front desk of this, at which time they told me I couldn't stay there, unless I gave them a $150 deposit, even though they had the security of a company credit card. This happend to my two co-workers also. In the end, they ended up asking to hold either a cell phone or a drivers licence as security. I was completely disgusted, as this happend at about 11pm at night. I handed over my drivers licence, and a member of staff from the front desk informed me that unless I gave them a credit card in the morning all services would be cut off to me. I had a message left on my phone to contact reception at my earliest convienience the next morning, so I did so before breakfast. I told them that they should call my company, and they would confirm that there was a full charge back to the company credit card. That night we had dinner in the restaurant, which took 3 HOURS to arrive. Other people were coming and going before we were even served. After dinner, we asked for the bill, and the waiter took it upon himslef to just spilt 4 ways, as there was four of us. This was not convienient, and we asked him to reverse it, and charge our individual rooms for what we actually had. This took him 45 minutes, and he still got it wrong, so we asked to go back to spliting it 4 ways. Mini bar and tea and coffee facilities are also extreamly minimal. I did not enjoy the rudness of the staff, and their demands at all. Especially since our company reguarly uses The Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Winter in November 2008”
Reviews.Author: shahbazi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, with a close friend, with view to see the city and enjoy a touch of luxury. and some fun and relaxation at a price!! Front staff were fantastic, friendly and efficient. We were shown to our room, but needed to change rooms, as friend was a light smoker, advised hotel of this fact when Booked and paid for a luxurious smoking room, with top notch facilities as advertised on net, but received average 3.5 star room. (we booked hotel based on the advert and thought what the heck . lets slurge. - we could have saved a packet. - anyway - somewhere else ohh well!! :(( Still can't work out why we paid top dollar yet asked for a smoking room on booking Viewed rooms on 21st floor, LOVELY! - what we paid for - unfortunately put on 11th floor, and skipped on some of the special touches. which makes a holiday special. a bit of a letdown guys Breakfast was expensive,! Bed comfortable. one chair in room for a couple made little sense to us. Bathroom was very spacious and spotless. Overall , pleased with hotel compared to a couple of others in area. but totally disappointed we paid for the top of the range and got middle class. I would return sometime, maybe next time not take a smoker friend. Perhaps the hotel secretly reserves the really Super/luxury first class rooms for the non-smokers of this world - okay ! cough cough ! :(( (i admit smoking is a not everyones cup of tea) but If i pay/book for a service at a premium i should be advised that you can't have this on the 11th floor and should have been charged a lot less for the lack of facilities advertised View was not of harbour like we thought we were getting ,but of a concrete jungle of walls and buildings . Overall - they deserve a praise and a big thank you! for effort and dedication and pleasant atmosphere inside hotel building. PS Supplying bigger coffee cups in room may be a real bonus to us coffee addicts. & far more supply of coffee, and Fresh milk would be more suitable to the class of hotel, rather then long life substitute. Next time We shall try a less expensive hotel in the city and probably end up with exactly the same service and facilities as we got at the swiss - but for a reasonable price. Merry Christmas my friend - it was nice to see you again ~ always remembered for the great company and the fun times that weekend~~ PS love the shops close by ~~

Reviews.Title: “100% worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Weraroa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Swissotel Sydney with my partner for 2 nights and I must say it was an amazing experience. The hotel is in the best location possible in the middle of the city and the level of service we got was just excellent. When we first arrived at the hotel, they boys in the concierge area were very polite and directed us to the reception area in level 8. When we reached level 8 it was great to see so many smiling faces looking at us and making us feel welcome in the hotel. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and the staff members in the bar, reception and restaurant area make it even more delightful. The girl in the reception was kind enough to give us an upgrade to a higher floor, actually the highest floor possible. She was very warm and welcoming and certainly made us feel like we were being well taken care of. All in all this hotel is not only in a great location but the service and facilites are great!!!!!!! I recommend this hotel for everyone that is coming to visit Sydney either for business or just a little vacation. Definately worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “most inaccessible hotel of the world”
Reviews.Author: ABBPhl
Reviews.Content: This is an example of a poorly planned, new hotel tower on top of an old department store. To get to your room requires 2 different elevators and a hike across the lobby. Pity of you arrive by car; NO PARKING ; NO CAR DROPOFF. No Taxis either at most times! Getting luggage in and out of the place is next to impossible. The restaurant is way undersized and gets overrun during peak periods; better use one of the local coffee shops (also less $$$).

Reviews.Title: “Great Locate & Sincere Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: NorthPoleMpls
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Swissotel Sydney and it easily has one of the best locations in the city. This is a great city to explore shopping, restaurants, and other parts of the city. For those who are foodies you will be pleased to know that their chief concierge Jason will recommend a restaurant based on his experience of going there, he avoids recommending restaurants that are touristy. My partner and I travel for food among other things & both of us were concierges in the past so this was a pleasant surprised. On the last leg of our trip we stayed at another hotel & Jason was still willing to help us with tours, reservations, etc. Jason & the staff go above & beyond. The hotel & the rooms are contemporary & beds are comfortable. You should definitely consider staying here while you are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Experience a True Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lles77
Reviews.Content: It's true first impression last!!! Firstly, I must admit that Market St is a challenge only If you are driving, as it actualy reminded me of Asia/New York bad traffic!! from the moment we arrived a friendly hotel staff welcomed us with a warm smile and we were escorted to reception on the 8th floor!! wow what a difference from the lobby in ground level it feels that heaven opened the door for us. Reception clerk were freindly and fast. Swissotel is in the middle of the city, you can walk to the Historic Rocks for approx 15-20 mins, Darling Harbor 10mins and shopping is just around the corner. This hotel is a TRUE hotel so do speak, the staff are freindly and approachable specially the concierge staff who are helpfull and Mr know it ALL. Thank You Swissotel you will see us again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Smiles and a Breakfast to die for...”
Reviews.Author: dandazz
Reviews.Content: I would like to begin this review with something like... "Having spent many years traveling the world, and staying in many amazing and varied Hotels across the globe..." But that would be a lie, I rarely travel, and even less so together with my family (Wife & 2 daughters). So it was with great anticipation to book a family room at the Sydney Swissotel for a weekend in Sydney, a rare treat with my family. Upon arrival I was gratefully guided into a parking spot in the front of the Hotel on a busy Sydney street, by the efficient concierge, and was then directed to reception, a counter of smiling faces. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make my daughters feel welcome, which my wife and I thought was a nice touch. The room was comfortable and spotless. The kid's loved the heated pool on the 10th floor overlooking the CBD. I'm a huge breakfast fan from way back (breakfast was included in our package) so I went for it and wasn't disappointed, everything you could possibly desire was on offer or could be quickly made to order. To sum up, my family and I had a great city escape in a terrific hotel with great staff, whether your traveling alone, with a partner or your family. I can't recommend the Swissotel Sydney enough 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beachbabes02
Reviews.Content: Great stay, Perfect location to all sydney sites. Staff all wonderful. Services great. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RGYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Our large executive room on the 23rd floor was ideal for the last few days of our visit to Australia. The hotel is located slap bang in the heart of Sydney's shopping area. We decided to use the rail link from the airport and were pleasantly surprised to note the hotel is only a five minute walk from St James station (n.b. there are steps to contend with from the station platform). We received a warm welcome from reception and our room not only had a great view but was also very well equipped. The bathroom had both a large tub and a large shower. The very large bed was comfortable and there was also a large desk. We were pleased with the attention to detail in the room. We made use of the Executive Club on the floor above. The staff here were very friendly and helpful. We took breakfast there rather than go down to the main restaurant. The selection was good and the atmosphere relaxed. We also had drinks and canapes there each evening. On one evening we had dinner in the restaurant. It was of a very good standard. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Circular Quay and The Rocks. Overall we were highly satisfied with this hotel and will certainly use it again when we next visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: RDBTLR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of our Honeymoon and our return home to Sydney. We have stayed with the Swissotel before an always love it. This time is no different. We spent a little extra and booked a room on the Executive Levels which gave us access to the lounge. We always enjoy this.
