The staff were so wonderful to us from check in, to breakfast in the lounge and the staff remembered our name after only two days! This was great. It was the perfect end to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: thkl070
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping: within steps of David Jones and Myer, between Pitt Street and George Street and accross the road from the QVB. All Sydney's attractions are nearby. Good pool and (small) gym. The construction site next door might wake you early.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: p750777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first wedding anniversary for three nights. We were upgraded to a corner room which was lovely. The room was newly refurbished and with lots of natural light, a bacony huge bathroom including large walk in shower with Molton Brown amenties. The location is excellent for central Sydney close to all shops and just 10 minute walk from Darling Harbour and a 15-20 minute walk from circular quay. We used the executive lounge once which offered free internet access and snacks/drinks. These were adequate although more limited than in other hotels we have visited. Overall this hotel offers excellent value for money, good rooms and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “rates were good but 5 star???? Not sure. Definitely not the beds anyway”
Reviews.Author: BrisCaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a weekend to spend time with some friends from inter-state. I have to say that I got a good rate and so I cannot complain too much but I really dont see where this is a 5-star hotel. The rooms we had were extremely small and pokey - in fact the one my friends in was so small they were practically climbing over furniture when they moved about it - and when I went to visit them it was downright claustrophobic. Things I particularly DID NOT like: - The bed ...OMG. It was possibly the hardest bed I have ever slept in with the exception of the dreadful places I have stayed in China and Taiwan. The bed was so hard that the only way I could get some modicum of sleep was to get all of the pillows in a line and lie on top of them. Interesting to note that my friends didnt have an issue with their bed so either they had a better one or I am just super fussy. I did leave my comments in the review card about the beds. I mean I just COULD NOT sleep. it was awful. - And then if not getting even a slight bit of sleep was bad ...I was further annoyed on Saturday morning by the sound of jackhammers and machinery as the guys worked on the nearby construction site. Yes, not exactly a problem of the hotel but extremely annoying when I was actually for once taking some much needed R&R but just didnt get it. - No power points in the bathroom. Not an issue except if, like me, you have a hair straightener...nowhere to plug it in. I had to stand outside the bathroom by the mini bar to do my hair - the worlds smallest bar fridge. It just had no depth and you couldnt fit anything in it. I guess the hotel wants you to use their drinks etc at their exhorbitant rates but if you want to put some of your own stuff in there then you just have to empty all of theirs out first and even then you are struggling to get anything in there - Having to use two sets of lifts to get up to the room. The first day I was in and out all day and it was so frustrating to have to go from street level to the 8th and then across the lobby and to the lifts to the room. Not a great deal you might think but annoying when you are getting tired from walking. - Using the key card for the lift. Yeah, I know security wise this is great but what annoyed me is that the swipe didnt always work first time and some slots worked better than others (and some worked not at all) Things I DID like: - the location - cant fault the location. Right near the Pitt Street Mall and close to the Monorail if you want to sight-see that way. Easy walking distance to Darling Harbour and Circular Key - there was a pillow menu but I didnt discover this until it was too late. I think if you stay here - pay the bit extra and go to the "Club" level. Maybe there you might find out whether this is really a 5 star hotel or not. In hindsight I wish I hadnt stayed here. I had recommended the HarbourView in North Sydney to my friends and I wish we had all stayed there as the experience here was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but bar service could improve”
Reviews.Author: bon_vivant_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night recently as a member of a large group on a business trip (30-35 people). The lobby and rooms are elegant, stylish, very clean and well appointed and the reception desk staff were friendly and helpful. Group check-in and check-out was efficient. There were however a few issues which spoilt the broader experience - firstly the bar service was appalling with nearly every member in our party reporting some issue. Incorrect orders, wrong items on the bill, bills never arriving (no complaints here on that one!), long delays in orders being filled, unavailable wines that later were successfully ordered by others, topped off by a total lack of clarity regarding whether it was table or bar service and reprimands from waiters for approaching the bar. I was given the incorrect bill three times and finally paid in frustration after trying to explain I was being billed for 3 white wines when I had ordered and was drinking a red. Isolated incidents are understandable however this was almost a culture of incompetence. Our whole group found the experience less than satisfactory and a bit odd considering the food and service in the adjoining restaurant was of a very high quality standard. One recent post noted that some items on the 24 hour menu were not actually available 24 hours. This was also my experience however I ordered an alternative with no problem and it was served promptly. Despite my frustration re: the bar and room service on the whole this hotel is fantastic and I would definitely stay there again or recommend it to a friend. The location is superb and the rooms are lovely and well looked after. You will enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excellent - Day Spa Appalling!!”
Reviews.Author: Paristresbon
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel was a wonderful place to stay in Sydney. I booked with the hotel directly and this easy as I spoke to a very friendly and helpful person. We arrived early and our room was ready for us which was great considering we had been travelling all morning. The room was spotless, beautiful bathroom, great coffee machine and was made up each day to perfection. Nothing was a hassle for this hotel. I rang and asked for extra towels and they were delivered promptly and with a smile. Breakfast was nice, included an egg chef and was relaxing. I will definitely return to the Swissotel Sydney. HOWEVER, beware of the Amrita Day Spa. I had my legs waxed on the first day and they tore skin off my legs. I couldn't get to sleep on the first night as I thought something was in the bed. I got up to check it only to discover that I had red, swollen stripes on my legs from where they had torn off my skin. It looked disgusting and was awfully sore and painful. I went down to the Day Spa first thing the next morning to the most unhelpful and sarcastic spa manager you could find. She was not willing to help, or really couldn't care less, I persisted and asked her what she was prepared to do about it. She said "so, do you want your money back?" I told them that was the least they could do. She had to ring her boss and he said yes. I practically had to beg for some cream to put on it and she could find anything to put some in. I could go on and on, but the fact is they damaged the skin on my legs, were not prepared to do anything about it - did not even apologise - and were rude and aburpt. I will be making an official complaint about this to the relevant authorities. DO NOT USE the day spa!! That said, it would not deter me from staying at the hotel, I would simple choose another day spa!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Swissotel!”
Reviews.Author: FRR94114
Reviews.Content: Following 5 days of business in Melbourne, I decided to spend a few days of R and R in Sydney before heading home to the States. I didn't know what to expect when I arrived, but was pleasantly surprised when I walked into the hip and chic 8th floor lobby. Check-in was fairly easy despite the desk clerk's unfamiliarity with English. When I walked into the room I was very pleased. I found the room to be spacious, well appointed and comfortable looking. One thing that caught my eye was the extremely low slung bed â€“ perhaps a not-so-subtle homage to the hotel's largely Asian clientele. I requested a higher floor at check-in and they graciously accommodated my request. That higher room afforded me a sweeping view of the city, including Hyde Park. Swissotel is a wonderful oasis in a great city - would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best I'v stayed at”
Reviews.Author: brissygirl_8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels during my travels and I have developed quite a skeptical attitude to most, however the Swissotel has re-established some faith. The staff were exceptional from reception to the porters. They were always well mannered and more than willing to help out even before you asked them. That is the most outstanding part of the hotel and Iam sure that others who have stayed there also will agree. The rooms are spacious and beautifully clean and the decor is fresh and inviting. I will for sure be staying there again whenever I am in town. Congratulations to all the staff and management for such an impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Geo2008
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Swissotel Sydney On Market Street and enjoyed our stay. We had a corner room with views out across the city. Rooms are not huge but are comfortable, clean and quiet. Breakfast was included in our three-day rate and it was excellent. We also had one evening meal at the hotel. While the meal was good, the prices were a little more than we expected. Location is excellent and in walking distance of tourist attractions, shopping and underground rail. It is a quaint hotel in that the hotel is built above Myer shopping emporium and to check in means taking dropping suitcases with a porter at the small off-street entry and taking a lift to the 8th floor which opens out onto an elegant lobby and reception. Staff were courteous and help-yourself bowls of Granny Smith apples near the lifts were appreciated. Happy to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngieNSW
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! We stayed at the Swissotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a corner premier room - while it did not include breakfast (and a breakfast package for this room would be good), everything else was fantastic. The room was clean, the furnishings lovely. After coming back to the room for the evening, the bed was turned down with chocolates and water - what a nice surprise. The bathroom was spacious, with a host of toiletries to use, even a sewing kit! The hotel is located in Market Street in the centre of the CBD. The Queen Victoria Building is 2 minutes away, Myer department store below the hotel, and only a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour - so the location is perfect. The staff were pleasant - but special credit must be given to the concierge staff who were exceptional. Happy to answer any questions, get taxis, provide maps - and all with a smile - some of the best service I have ever experienced at a hotel. Good concierge staff contribute significantly to the experience of visiting a hotel, and I cannot speak highly enough of the concierge staff at the Swissotel. All in all, a lovely hotel - when we visit Sydney, we won't be staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: sandluc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Sydney quite regularly and we always try to stay somewhere different (the 5 star hotel options in the CBD are huge). The Swissotel however is such good value and has such a great location (for shopping) is sometimes hard to justify other hotels. On this trip we booked a 1 bedroom suite which included breakfast and drinks in the executive club. $A314 a night gets an immaculate large room with modern fixtures (2 x flat screen TV, espresso machine, large bathroom) and good executive services. Its location is perfect for shopping and it's not far to walk to Circular Quay or the markets if required. This hotel definately doesn't have the stuffy atmosphere found at many of the other local 5 star hotels and although it isn't super luxurious, it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spoilt somewhat by poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: yeemui
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Sydney for 3 days in mid August. The room was smaller than we imagined (we later found out that the twin rooms are bigger), but the bathroom was lovely and big, with separate shower and bath. What spoilt the experience was the poor hotel service. For example, on our third night, the bathroom toilet started leaking - when we reported it to housekeeping, they failed to send anyone to look at it, despite promising to do so; then, when I called back 45 min later, when it was getting late and we wanted to get the children to sleep, the hotel staff actually asked "how bad exactly IS the leak?", before deciding whether they should help that night or not! All in all, we expected a lot more after reading other reviews and the hotel Web site.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for 5 nights in July. The hotel was absolutely adorable. We have booked an executive room. Our room was very spacious, beautiful and had an amazing view from the 25th floor over the city, the Skytower and the Hyde Park. The staff was very nice, the executive lounge very cosy. They offered breakfast ( a cooking station would have made the lounge perfect) and pre dinner drinks and canapes. The lounge had free internet access, which was great. For breakfast we had the choice between the executive lounge and the main restaurant. Both were great. The location was great too, within walking distance to the main tourist attractions of the city, especially near to Darling Harbour, right above the biggest Shopping Street.. I would definitely stay there again. The hotel and the staff made us feel homey far away from home!

Reviews.Title: “All around - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjczech
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because Orbitz had an incredible deal. Like, $150 per night and I had a coupon code. So I figured, lets try it out. Overall, I was impressed. Location is decent and you can walk to Darling or the Quay easily. We rarely took taxis. Near lots of shopping. The pool looked nice but it was a bit cold out. The internet access was $25/24 hours and the wireless didnt work well. But they sent up a Cat5 cable and all was well. Free internet wouldve been better. Hotel has a well stocked bar with 70,000+ wine bottles. Cool deal! If this place could use anything, it would be a better area to pickup taxis and perhaps cut the internet cost. Otherwise I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SueinNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 very enjoyable nights in this comfortable hotel, having obtained a good rate from Expedia. The location, very near to St James & Town Hall stations and a block from the Queen Victoria Building, was superb. Darling Harbour was just around the corner and Central Quay a 10 minute (down hill) walk, with the option of the ferry for the uphill return! The Tower next door helped me get back from wherever I ended up! The bedroom was smallish but comfortable and the bathroom was generously sized and well-equipped. Staff were pleasant and unobtrusive. I didn't eat at the hotel- there were food courts and restaurants around the corner- so can't vouch for this. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a pleasant stay in the heart of the city (as opposed to on the waterfront).

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed - 5 Star I Don't Think So!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenODon
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 day stay at this 5 Star Hotel and I'm sorry it doesn't deserve this rating little alone the price tag you pay for a room. Since I would be checking into work I needed internet access and really liked the sound of the Executive Club Lounge with the extras included. Upon arrival around 1pm we were informed our room wasn't ready which was fine as check in is 2 pm so shopping or sightseeing was suggested until 2.30pm what!!! The room should have been ready by 2 pm. Finally arriving on the 24th floor room 2416 my work mate and I found that we only had a King size bed, we requested 2 x double beds. A quick phone call to reception I was informed they would see what could be done, 10 minutes later another room was found a Suite on the 12 floor Room 1213 BUT they could only supply a King bed with a roll away. OMG!!! What the hell, this is going to be a great 2 days for me. The bathroom were nice and spacious, great tub and separate shower, loved the toiletries, turn down service every night with bottle water and chocolate. Since we had paid for the Executive Club Lounge breakfast was included and the food was pretty good with drinks and finger food at night. The Executive Club staff were lovely nothing was a hassle for them, I just wished the internet was faster and I didn't realise they had 2 computers for the guest to use, I didn't need to bring my laptop. BTW - It states - high speed broadband Internet access available in the rooms but they forget to tell you on the web its nearly $10 for 30 minutes (ouch!!!) can't workout why it's not included in the Executive Club pricing as I would had loved just being able to check emails in my room at anytime. The problems - 1. Wrong room, moved to another even though it was bigger I still got stuck with a roll away bed for a price of $359.00 a night! 2. Requested late checkout of 12.30 pm which was not noted. 3. Being locked out of our room 6 x times which meant a trip to reception every time to have the swipe cards reprogrammed. 4. Receiving a bill under the door for the accommodation even though it had already been paid for by the travel agent. 5. Being greeted by fire fighters due to a water sprinkler bursting outside the restaurant when trying to get our cards reprogrammed at the lobby. Oh they still didn't have it noted we had a late checkout so I guess that was the reason for the lockout this time. Finally we had, had enough and asked to speak to the Supervisor but since they all were running around like chooks with their heads chopped off this never happened. The lovely lady (which I could remember her name) whom was on duty yesterday morning Monday 11th August who had to fix most of our problems kindly offered us a refund of 1 nightsâ€™ accommodation for the hassles we had. We accepted with a Thank you but sadly we don't feel we will be returning which is such a shame as we loved the Executive Club Lounge. Regards Jennifer

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Swissotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: triathelete671
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Sydney for our first year anniversary and her birthday. Our stay at the Swissotel was phenomenal. The service was above and beyond all expectations. William, the concierge, was wonderful...he made reservations and had a great table reserved for us with a view of the Sydney Opera House. He also pointed us to some great areas of beautiful Sydney. The room was spotless. I highly recommend staying at the Swissotel Sydney. It's worth every penny. The hotel was also close to great shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, but disappointed with rooms”
Reviews.Author: samgobigs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Swissotel, following reviews on this site. While the staff were efficient in the sign-in, sign-out process, I did encounter a few things that made my stay less enjoyable. The first problem was the room size. The rooms were unexpectedly small. Some websites give the swissotel 5 stars, but this is not accurate. The rooms were designed so there is just barely enough space on either side of the bed for me to move around in. When you look at the photos posted on the hotel's website, the rooms displayed are quite deceptive; the actual room looks about 2/3rd the size. The study desk is small, and cluttered with all the hotel information-related reading materials. The second problem was the bed. The mattress was uncomfortably firm, and I had a difficult time sleeping on it. It was nothing compared to the other beds used in hotels like Sheraton. (i.e. the Heavenly Beds). It took me over 2 hours to fall asleep on these beds. A third problem was the room service. If you need any items from room service (for example a toothbrush), it takes about an hour for room service to have it delivered, which I think is unusually long. So in summary, the stay was a bit on the disappointing side, and I probably would not stay in this hotel again. It is *NOT* a 5 star hotel, but more accurately, a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Much better options in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Risky_Rat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on reviews on this (usually) great site. I travel to Sydney at least once a month for business purposes (I am a consultant and researcher in services marketing), and like to try out all the different hotels, to get a sense of what is good. Most of the time, money isn't a huge barrier, so I am willing to spend a bit more for a good night's sleep, good service, comfortable surrounds, and a relatively good outlook from my room. Maybe my expectations were a bit high in regard to Swissotel. All things considered, it was okay, but certainly not worthy of being in the Top Ten on TripAdvisor, or of being classified a Five Star Hotel. Some particular problems were: 1. I booked on the hotel's online site, and booked what I thought was a better room, and was given a large-ish room. However, the room had frayed curtains, dirty carpet, smelt of smoke, and was generally not very nice (I realise that this is very broad, but it wasn't what you expect from a "quality" hotel). I went back downstairs to reception, and told them that the quality of the room (including the view) was not what I expected when I made the booking. The receptionist wanted specifics, but I wasn't able to be too specific - it just felt old, dated, uncomfortable. I was moved, which I appreciated, and the room I moved to was a bit better, but still not that impressive. 2. The bed was rock-hard. Really, with the advent of technologies such as memory-foam, why do hotels continue to provide such uncomfortable, old beds. The comfort of the bed is part of the core promise, and when it feels cheap, and hard, it really has a huge influence over customer perceptions. 3. Air-conditioning wasn't able to be switched off. This is a problem with a lot of hotels - give your customers the choice. I woke up about ten times in the night, partly because the air-con dried me out, but also because I had to keep adjusting the temperature. And I had a balcony room, so I could have managed room temperature with the window. There were a few other minor things that they really have to look at, such as $30 for breakfast, if you did not book a package - I mean, what are their overheads, when they think it is reasonable to charge $30 for scrambled eggs, bacon, etc. from a bain marie. Just bad marketing as far as I am concerned (and a little mean-spirited), and what it has meant is, that, combined with the issues raised above, plus a few other things, I won't be staying here again, nor will anyone in my company. Some specific details: I paid $289 for a balcony room. Was originally in Room 1220, but was moved to 1820. I booked via the Hotel's website. NB.: I had recently returned from London (in the past two weeks), and had stayed at The Parkcity, which may have spoiled me, and created unreasonable expectations from other hotels. All hotel managers should go and stay at The Parkcity, to see how a hotel in a city as expensive as London can still provide excellent service, attention to detail, and incredible comfort for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler81
Reviews.Content: All right, So I spent countless nights researching and trying to decide which hotel to stay in for my first couple of nights in Sydney, and the Swissotel did not dissapoint. The first thing that turned me to this hotel was the location. Only minutes walk from Darling Harbour and about 15 to Circular Quay, and if you are traveling to Sydney and want to shop, look no further than your own block. My first encounter with the staff through email assured me that I had chosen the right place. Two days before my arrival, I knew that I needed an extra night stay, and after 1 email, my request was completed with the same low rate that I had locked in earlier. I was even more pleased after they were able to check me in around 9AM. My flight had arrived around 6, and i wasn't sure what my wait was going to be like, but after my trip from the airport, and some breakfast, I was all set. I was traveling solo, so I didn't need a big room, but the bathroom was definately bigger than I had anticipated. I had booked the "Classic Room" and knew the room wasn't going to be huge. Overall, the staff was nice, and I enjoyed my stay. The two elevators thing is kind of annoying, but I just dealt with it. I'm not a picky traveler, but do want to be comfortable when I'm sleeping. I would like to say I would stay here again, but I also might want to stay in a different part of the city next time for some variety.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: yellowskyblue
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel earlier in the year â€“ and was impressed with the high level of service. This was the reason I chose Swissotel for my last stay in Sydney. I was very unimpressed by the level of service I (and others) received. After travelling for 11 hours, I was looking forward to a shower and a rest in a room. I arrived a little earlier than expected â€“ and was told that my room would not be available until 2pm. As this was the advertised check-in time, I was quite happy to leave my luggage, and do some shopping in the CBD. At 230pm, I returned and was told that my room was still not available. It was at this point I noticed that there were other guests in the same situation at the Check-in desk. I was told that my room would be available in half an hour, and to return then. After exploring the CBD shops further, I returned to Check-in, only to be told that my room was still not available. Further guests were being turned away from the desk â€“ and told to wait in the Bar, or explore the City and be contacted by mobile. After I was offered this option, I declined. At this point I was extremely exhausted â€“ and asked to speak with a Supervisor. I was again asked if I would like to wait in the Bar or do some shopping. I explained to the Supervisor that I would prefer to wait at the Check-in Desk until a room was found. After dropping my shopping bags and luggage at my feet â€“ a staff member went upstairs, and a room was miraculously found. The way in which the staff handled the situation was dismissive and extremely disappointing. I understand that Hotels are sometimes quite busy, but staff gave the impression that they wanted to move Guests away from the check in desk as soon as possible. The room was quite nice, and I got it for a very good rate on the Hotels Website. Breakfast was included and was very nice. The only other issue I experienced was that my room wasnâ€™t cleaned on one day â€“ even though I had asked for my room to be made up. I ended up catching a staff member in the corridor in the evening to have my towels replaced. Iâ€™m not as impressed as I was with my last stay. Unless the rate beats other hotels in the CBD, I will probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dnr4lyf
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to visit Sydney for my 10 year anniversary. I worked long and hard to review hotels online. After careful review, we choose Swissotel. The hotel was okay. The location was great! Very central and close to almost everything. You are very close to Darling Harbour and about 15 min walk to Circular Quay and China Town. We stayed on the executive level but the room wasn't that big. However, the bathroom were nice and spacious. Great tub and seperate shower. Turn down service every night. Breakfast was included in my room rate and the food was pretty good. I was glad I upgraded to include breakfast. Another great thing about this hotel was that it was a block away from the Sydney Tower which is where I had reservations for my anniversary dinner. I didn't plan that, it just worked out. The beds are firm, but I hear most hotel beds are. Although we were on the 22nd floor, you could hear construction noise. Unfortunately, they started work at 6am. Remember that you are in the city so it's not going to be uber quiet. Friendly staff and conceiarge was very helpful guiding us. Gym equipment was adequate. There was about 3 treadmills, some bikes and eleptical machines. It had weights and benches too. Overall, I would recommend this hotel but if I returned to Sydney, I'd want to try a different one. Also, you have to take two lifts. The one from the street with take you to level 8 which is their lobby. Not much of a lobby though as their bar is right there so there were no chairs to really sit on. Then you take another lift to the rooms. It was annoying but it was alright. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location woeful internet”
Reviews.Author: bizotraveller
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel in the centre of Sydney's CBD is a great hotel if you want to be in the heart of the city close to all shopping and transport. Rooms are nice with large'ish bathrooms. The only problem they have is with their service provider MagiNet. On a number of occasions I have stayed at the hotel the internet has been either very very slow or not working at all. Numerous calls to their provider I get someone in India who doesn't know much at all. I troubleshoot the problem for them by identifying a DHCP server not responding. But they had no idea what I was talking about. So if you're a business traveller who needs internet access to survive, I would look elsewhere for a hotel in the city with a reliable service.

Reviews.Title: “Above the Sydney tower & a great location”
Reviews.Author: nikhilganju
Reviews.Content: On ground level at Market Street, a non descript entrance to this hotel doesnt exactly create the best first impression. However, when you're whisked up to the lobby on the 8th floor (Yes, the hotel starts from there upwards) and checked in to a clean modern room, the apprehensions disappear. I had a comfortable stay without any complaints. The service was satisfactory and efficient, but not necessarily awe inspiring :-) The BEST thing about the hotel is the location. From here, one can pretty much cover all the sights of Sydney on foot. A nice ten minute stroll down pitt street, which is just around the bend will get you to the circular quay from where you can choose to explore the Opera house or the Harbour Bridge or the rocks or take a cruise or.....you get it right? Another ten minute walk will take you to Darling harbour and a five minute trot will find you in the lush environs of Sydney's very own Hyde park. If you're in the mood to shop, there's plenty of options on Pitt & George streets, which are both round the bend. All in all, a great location to explore Blue Sky Sydney! Oh and before I forget, my window put me squarely face to face with the top of the Sydney Tower - another one of Sydney's many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: travelbeebuzz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel twice in a week - once at the start of my stay in Australia and once at the end. On both occasions I had a wonderful time and no complaints at all. I got a discounted rate for the Executive Club Room on the internet - and it was worth paying a bit more for a great room, good view and excellent lounge. I didn't get to sample the cocktails and canapes but the breakfasts were delicious! The staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful. On my second stay I got a room that didn't have a coffee machine (there are excellent coffee machines there and after being in the UK for the last 4 months the one thing I needed was a good coffee!) - I asked at reception if they were able to provide one - instead they gave me a much nicer room with a balcony and said coffee machine - nothing was too much trouble and all of my requests were greeted with a smile. The next time I go back to Sydney, I'll definitely choose Swissotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: blackjake
Reviews.Content: The Swisshotel was our first stop on our Australian holiday. We arrived direct from Glasgow at 8am in the morning with our two small children in tow - aged 2 and 1. I had booked on the internet and got a fabulous deal for our one night stay (including breakfast) and was fully expecting to have to wait until 2pm to check in. But no, we were in our room at 8.30am. Wonderful...except I had asked on my internet booking for a room with 2 double beds rather than a king bed (so our 2 year old would have a bed). I rang down to reception. No problem to change, except the new room would not be ready till 12pm. So, they said, stay in that room and treat it as your own and when the new one is ready we will move your things for you. So we all had a shower and curled up in bed to have a sleep. While we were at lunch our things went to our new room, which was high up and had a wonderful view. The location above Myer is brilliant and you couldn't ask for anything more central. We also loved the pool and other leisure facilities. I thought the customer service was exceptional and made what could have been a miserable morning hanging about into a wonderful start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to end a vacation”
Reviews.Author: kjnielsen206
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel in Sydney was our last hotel of our stay in Australia. At the time the pricing was excellent for its star ranking though I was a bit wary that its location would be noisy during the day but also far from activities. Neither was the case. The staff was really friendly, the room was very comfortable with a great view. While we don't allow our hotel stays to make or break a holiday as some who post here do, this was a very comfortable, safe and relaxing stay. One down side was that a large American church group was conferencing there and we did not want be 7500 miles from home to be surrounded by other Americans. This down side could not be help so we did not let get us down. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to our friends who travel to Australia and we'd stay there again if we get the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel - service could be a little better”
Reviews.Author: Mango53
Reviews.Content: Booked the Endless Weekend package which i thought was great value - included perks such as a $50 myer voucher, valet parking, 4pm checkout and breakfast until 2pm (i.e. if you missed the breakfast buffet which finished at 10.30am, you can order room service - nice touch). I had high expections seeing as it is a 5* hotel and rated 5th for popularity on TripAdvisor. For reference we were looking for a romantic long weekend in a central location with good spa facilities. POSITIVES For a 5* hotel with 5* rates the Swissotel has the usual positives. Our room was on the corner of the 22nd floor with two large windows facing the Centrepoint Tower. Clean nicely furnished rooms, clean bathrooms with plenty of toiletries - first hotel ive seen that has body gel and body scrub, wall mounted flat screen TV and a coffee machine. Swimming pool was heated and jacuzzi was strong. NEGATIVES TV - is mounted on the wall but does not extend and swivels slightly.. As we were in a corner room with 2 windows, the TV was mounted on the next wall and facing the hallway and bedside table rather then the actual bed. This could just be in the corner room though due to lack of space. Room- again maybe because it was a corner room, but our room was tiny. The armchair actually sat flush between the window and bed. Mimimal towels provided in bathroom. Parking - The hotel faces onto Market Street and does not have its own driveway/entrance. There are 6 no parking/taxi stand spots out front and my partner had to wait in the car for fear of getting booked whilst i ran in to get the concierge/porter/bellboy?? to come out and take our keys. He was quite young and i think i heard him speaking Japanese?, was very efficient and friendly I wish I took down his name. The front entrance consists of a concierge desk and 3 lifts, you need to take the lifts up to the main lobby on level 8 (i.e. the first floor available directly above Myers 7 floors). There are no signs to say checkin on 8th floor. Over the next 3 days we learnt to call for the car at least 20mins before we left the room as we were waiting on a couple of occasions and there is only 2 seats on the ground floor. Also if you return after 11pm there is no-one manning the front desk on the ground floor and you need to swipe with your room key to get in. I could see how this would be annoying if you were checking in late at night. Spa - We chose Swissotel as they have an Amrita spa and we were looking at getting several treatments over the weekend. As it was the long weekend they were naturally busy and we were booked in at 9am. As at other spas and as advised in the hotel directory we arrived 10mins early to fill out paperwork, get changed and use sauna facilities. The spa was deserted and hotel staff were vacumming the general spa/lift area. Not very tranquil. No-one turned up until just after 9am and they were slow to acknowledge us and give us robes/changeroom keys. Even if they were running late they could at least send us to the changerooms/sauna before turning on the computer etc. Breakfast - We were told upon checkin that as we have breakfast until 2pm, if we miss the JPB buffet then to order breakfast in the Crossroads bar. We went down to the bar but there was no-one attending. Went to the restaurant and the girl hurridly advised us if you missed breakfast you order room service. I asked if that meant we get charged and she said yes and walked away. By then there was a girl at the bar and we went and asked her, relaying what reception had told us yesterday and what the restaurant had just told us. She went over to the restaurant and basically said she didnt know what to do about it , can they handle it in the restaurant. By then the girl in the restaurant (Alexandria?) explained to us that they have a function in the restaurant today, to order room service, mention that we have the package and we wont be charged...if she had just said that the first time! Room service breakfast was ok, my bircher muesli looked like leftovers from the buffet - just slop and no fruit or yoghurt on the side. They forgot a few things with my partners full breakfast, e.g. the juice, the pastries but were very quick to bring them up when we rang them. Swipe cards - stopped working twice. Also you need to swipe between floors which i think is unneccessary, i.e. from the pool/spa level within the hotel. Usually you just need to swipe from the lobby access floor? We were charged for 2 days valet upon checkout when it clearly shows what package we are on however they removed it when we told them. OVerall although I have listed quite a few negatives I would stay here again minus the spa activities....its in a prime location for a shopping weekend with the girls so I understand the limited ground floor space and parking issue which in turn compounds the time it takes for them to retrieve your car offsite. But for a romantic quality stay within the same vicinity to shopping I would recommend the Westin or might try the Sheraton next time. The rest of our issues arised from wavering service levels, miscommunication and lack of communication from staff - I recently returned from an overseas trip to Asia and felt like i was back there with the same communication issues on the phone with Room Service, with the Spa and with Restaurant reception.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: WeekendWonders
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Swissotel Sydney and it was great. I booked on a weekend special - otherwise this hotel would be out of my price range. The weekend away was a girls weekend away so the hotel was perfect for shopping - with Myer downstairs and the Pitt St Mall. It was also a 15 minute walk to Circular Key & the Opera House, however, the weather was terrible so it was a $7 cab fare. Cockle Bay and the fabulous dining and restaurants was only 10 minute stroll. The beautiful Hyde Park only 5mins. We got from the airport to the hotel via train which was very convenient. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel in the morning before the 2pm check-in. The concierge staff were very obliging, useful and effective. The best things about this hotel were the concierge staff, the rooms (fresh and well maintained), and the location. Am staying here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for your Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a comfortable, central hotel then look no further. Our room was well proportioned and clean, staff went out of their way to help us and our three year old daughter. Slap bang in the middle of everything tourist wise, it's about a ten minute stroll from Circular Quay and five minutes from Darling Harbour. Can't recommend this enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: extra_leg_room
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my final day in Sydney prior to a long haul flight back home. Really nice hotel, with great facilities if needed. Also perfect location for access to shops in the cbd as right in the heart of the shopping area, and only a couple of minutes walk to the bars and restaurants at the harbour. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, book an executive room, just that little bit more special”
Reviews.Author: golfEngland
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Sydney hotels, the Swissotel compares favourably for its CBD location and nearby transport and shops. We booked an executive room, requesting one overlooking the AMP/Sydney Tower and got it! Not too impressed with the street access with two sets of lifts but once inside, the spacious rooms were in excellent decorative order and had a modern bathroom with a large walk in shower as well as a bath. The executive rooms are on higher floors and include free local calls, internet, newspapers etc and access to the Executive Club lounge where a more intimate and scenic breakfast is served. Between 5.30 and 7.30pm complimentary canapes and self service soft drinks and premium brand alcohol are on offer, my husband thought he was in heaven! The downside was that on changing foreign currency, we were offered an incredibly poor rate (half that expected) as the reception staff did not appear to understand the conversion rate. There are a number of banks close by however that offer a much better rate. Also on checkout the man was bordering rude, but this was the exception rather than the rule.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: izziecat
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel in a fantastic location, five minutes walk to Darling Harbour, right in the middle of the shopping areas and a few minutes to the monorail. Hotel clean and comfortable. We had access to the executive lounge which was well worth the extra. Nice nibbles and free drinks for a couple of hours each evening and good breakfast. Staff working in the lounge were so polite and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and shocking service”
Reviews.Author: spannatraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Sydney for 5 nights this April as part of a month long honeymoon trip around Australia and it was by far the worst hotel in terms of value, service and overall experience during the whole trip. Positives - large nicely fitted bathrooms, excellent location, helpful concierge staff Negatives - terrible housekeeping - evidence only of bedmaking and towel changes only (examples brought to the attention of Pamela - duty manager of same toothpaste stain by sink for whole duration of trip, bathroom floor clearly not mopped, used wine glasses and cups not cleared away, amenities not replaced...overflowing sanitary bins in lobby toilets, leaking ceiling in the gym dripping onto the crosstrainer...the list goes on) overpriced additional services eg. internet and laundry more than double that of any other hotel during our stay, appalling breakfast staff eg. having to remind them to replenish bread/cheese/pastries as the buffet plates were regularly left empty. Disappontingly, even after raising our concerns with the duty manager, the toothpaste stain by the sink and dirty cups remained until the end of the trip demonstrating Swissotel in Sydney can't even get the basics of hospitality right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nbydeley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and absolutely loved this hotel! Location was superb, you're right in the middle of everything and could easily walk to Darling Harbour and the main train station. Staff was very friendly, although there was mixups with the breakfast as to whether it was included or not. Upon check-in, we were told it was, but the next morning, they had no record of our name and the front desk was not able to determine whether it was free or not. This seems to happen a lot in Sydney hotels, so double check beforehand! There are plenty of cafes open outside tho, so we had breakfast at the lovely Strand and Queen Vic buildings - much better! Would definitely recommend staying here and would come again - thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Still good”
Reviews.Author: Tess01
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel 2 years ago, I knew what to expect. The location is brilliant for both shopping and sightseeing. You are right in the center city with all the shops, a 10 minute easy walk to Darling Harbour, 15 minutes to Circular Quay, and Hyde Park (which has bus stops with routes that can take you almost anywhere) is just around the corner. The trip up to your room - from street level to the 8th floor in one set of elevators and then across the lobby to the hotel elevators to take you to your hotel floor - gets fairly tiresome I must say, when you do it a few times a day! But the rooms are of good size, the beds very firm but comfortable and the bathrooms are large and surprisingly almost opulent. I was bothered also with key cards failing to work. We were also put in a room which overlooked a building site. I was a bit miffed that we had to ask to be moved due to noise (after the third night listening to diggers and pile drivers going all night), and we were given a quieter room. Why didn't the hotel do this first, since the rooms were vacant? Our extended family group had 5 rooms, but none of them had a view - it would have been nice to be given one. Still, it is a good hotel, in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “End of a wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Cleggy
Reviews.Content: At the end of our month long honeymoon we stayed in Swissotel in sydney. Brilliant location near the shops. Very clean nice big rooms. Great views over the city. The mall beside has a great food court great place for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Fi_07
Reviews.Content: I normally save my reviews for small independent hotels and guest houses but I felt compelled to write a review of our stay at the Swissotel in response to some of the negative reviews I have read about the place. Our stay wasn't perfect but the problems we encountered were put right without us having to complain. We arrived half an hour before our check-in time and were advised that our room wouldn't be ready for an hour. Obviously, this was a little annoying especially when they didn't call us after an hour and when we called them we were told the room still wasn't ready. When we did eventually check-in about an hour and a half after the advised check-in time we were automatically given an upgrade to a Junior Suite. I agree that not having the room ready does not give a good first impression but the quality of the upgrade was more than sufficient compensation. I thought the room was fantastic with views on 3 sides. It was incredibly spacious, clean and well-equipped. Two toilets and two huge flat-screen TVs. I don't know what more anyone could ask for. Contrary to what others have said there were plenty of towels throughout our stay and plenty of reading material about Sydney in the room. I don't know these elements differ between the types of room. We also had a problem where one of the porters dropped a wine bag containing two bottles of wine which we had bought in The Hunter Valley for a friend's wedding. They were very apologetic and were successful in replacing the wine with the same and better wine from the same vineyard. I do think there is a lack of consistency in the service provided by staff though. It is unfair to say all of the staff were unhelpful as some were helpful beyond the call of duty. This was particularly true of one of the Concierges who could not have been more helpful in assisting us with getting our hire car back to Avis. I wish I could remember his name. We did have a further problem with booking a taxi with another Concierge. We booked it for the Friday evening at 1800 and when we went to get it a different Concierge told us that taxis never turn up on a Friday during rush hour so there was no point booking So again, this suggests a lack of consistency amongst the staff. Despite our problems, I would still recommend this hotel for the central location and the standard of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: alchemisttwo
Reviews.Content: At $260 per night, a corner premier room is almost double what I like to pay for hotels. This room was worth it. Very clean, very spacious, very comfortable, and excellent views of the city. The bathroom alone was almost as big as my kitchen. Very nice pool area. Courteous staff. Very convenient location. Walking distance to the aquarium, the sydney tower, the bridge and the botanical gardens. Tons of shops and restaurants nearby. A short 20 min cab ride to Bondi Beach. Expect a cab to cost $40-$50 to the airport, and about $30 to bondi beach.

Reviews.Title: “Riddled with problems”
Reviews.Author: wategos
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 27th to 30th March, 2008. Totally agree with the comments made by Astropoeia/Singapore. This is a beautiful hotel and it is not the first time we have stayed here. Something appears to have happened since our last visit, to sum it up, the staffs attitude leaves a lot to be desired, they refuse to make eye contact to the point of rudeness, where every request is treated like a chore, in fact it is all too hard. From the moment of checking in and advised that our room was not ready due to it being "really dirty" yuk. We waited for over an hour. To the non functioning internet. Although we were upgraded which was appreciated, the room was lovely. But over the three days of our visit we were not acknowledged, as a guest, in any way entering or passing through common area's by any staff. We have recently returned from Singapore, where their customer service skills are honed to perfection. Please Swissotell, Sydney, lift your act

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichieCMontreal
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Swissotel Sydney as I write this. I am overlooking the city from my view on the 24th floor. The rooms are very clean and well furnished with usable and comfortable furnishings. The location is top notch and right in the heart of everything. A wide range of shopping is right out the door of the hotel and beautiful Darling harbor with all of it's restaurants is a short 3 minute walk straight down market street. The service is top notch, check in was flawless. Upon checking in I was told that my room was not ready. After explaining that I had just traveled 23 hours the agent at the front desk worked diligently to find me a temporary room until mine was ready. She called 15 minutes later to tell me that my permanent room was ready and a bellman was at my door within 4 minutes to help me with my luggage and deliver the new room keys. Housekeeping is excellent as well, the room is spotless and turn down service was prompt and efficient. I am staying on the executive floor which is great value, the lounge is very nice and well equipped and the free breakfast is very comprehensive. In particular the constant availbility of beverages is very welcome. For a mere $20AUD more it is certainly worth it. I checked out the pool and health club facilities and they are both top notch as well. To sum up the hotel is very up to date and clean and offers great value for anyone traveling to Sydney. I travel more the 400,000 miles a year and spend many nights in hotels and this hotel certainly offers as good if not better value then anywhere I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Dull Dull Dull”
Reviews.Author: LondonJac
Reviews.Content: What can I say the hotel was very very DULL indeed. Certainly not a 5* star hotel. Although the hotel has a great location - if all you want to do is shop. The hotel lacks any personality at all. In fact I would say that the hotel is missing something - it felt cold and clinical. The rooms are very clean but basic. The bathrooms are large and functional. The lack of towels (1 per person), changed under duress. The only reading matter in the room was a TV Guide - no Where magazine or map. The front desk staff where efficient - very Swiss but with little or no personality. As for the concierge every request was a chore. As we were there for a week it was a bit of a lottery which one of us asked the question - the loser had to ask. Not a hotel I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: cdryden
Reviews.Content: Hello! I stayed in Swissotel in October for a business trip. This was our second stay there, as we stayed there two years previous on our honeymoon. It was MUCH better this time around. However, I just found out they are partners w/my travel points for air miles and I want to add the miles!!!! Must get in touch w/these folks! Good work Guys! Our stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless - One of the best hotels I've stayed in for a long time!”
Reviews.Author: samjoy123
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say and where to begin. I stayed in this hotel for four nights at the end of February 2008 and couldn't fault the place. The only weird thing was the entrance and lobby being on separate floors but you get used to this! I hadn't even got out of my taxi when a porter miraculously appeared and took my bags. This was the start of a service which was to continue to the end of my stay. I'll keep this review brief but the rooms were spacious with everything you could possibly want. All the usual things you expect in a hotel of this calibre together with an iron and ironing board, If indeed you did need anything further then a quick phone call is all that is needed. I couldn't fault a thing in this hotel and would definitely return. The only disappointment was having to leave (which incidentally check out was as flawless as the check in) and embark on the next step of my trip. Hope everyone enjoys this hotel as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Not as enthusiastic”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week on a business trip so my review is moderated by the fact that I saw more than most visitors. The hotel has Singapore Airlines as a customer so it would be of a reasonable standard. LOCATION: It is true that the hotel is fairly well located--10 minutes brisk walk (no way can you make it in 5 as someone claimed, and I am a brisk walker--you can feel the breeze I create when I pass you) to the Darling Harbour. There is also a foodcourt below the hotel after you walk out of the building. But the hotel is on a one-way street with no proper driveway space outside the hotel--you park under the monorail, get out on the wrong side of the road, and then get to the hotel. So the bus makes a detour every time in heavy traffic to get to the hotel. Most of the shops around the hotel close at 6.30 pm. As do most restaurants except for a Japanese one with reasonable food but poor service. ROOM: The room is very comfortable indeed. I was hoping for a water view but alas, I was not that fortunate. Possibly the only complaint is that the alarm clock was difficult to set and I'm pretty good at such things. So I resorted to calling the operator for a 5 am call. HOTEL SERVICES: I had the same identical breakfast for the week. Somehow, that is tolerable at home but not in a hotel. I'm surprised at this weak spot given that the food in Australia is fresh and relatively cheap compared with Singapore. A strange phenomenon is that I had to ask for a teaspoon for my coffee every morning. It's somehow the protocol--don't put on a teaspoon unless they ask. The gym is all right although I would not describe it as state of the art. There is a tiny pool. WEAK SPOT: The wired broadband is not cheap. I had the day rate of $24.99. I was told that after 4 days, it would be rounded up to the weekly rate of $99.99. Before checking out, I found that the hotel had billed me everyday at $24.99 a day. I clarified with the reception and they said, ok, we will bill you for four days. But the following day when my colleague went to pay, it was back to $24.99x7. That got sorted but I wonder what would have happened had I not raised the issue. The hotel shares the building with apartments. So everyday, it was: get to Floor 8, walk across the lobby, and then insert card to get to desired floor. It's a bit of a hassle when you are tired at the end of the day. My self-closing door could not close properly and I was not aware of it the first day so it was ajar for much of the time I was out that day. I had to slam the door each time I left. It took 5 days of me nagging the chambermaid to get that fixed. CONCLUSION So I won't rave about this hotel. It's not a bad hotel. But in all probability, I would ok it for a friend but I myself would probably not stay there. There must be more beautiful hotels in one of my favourite world cities, Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: Great central location in Market Street. Lobby is on the 8th floor, nice breakfast room that has a good selection of fresh fruit, pastry, assorted cooked items all of super quality. Room 2201 is comfortable, good views. Fun to have a bath looking out of the window over Darling Harbour. Comfortable bed, quiet room so a good nights sleep. The pool is on the outside, nice and modern, attractive although sun only gets to it at certain times of the day. Executive level lounge on floor 24, good views and nice breakfast or compo drinks and snacks - you can just about get enough to make a free dinner up there. All in all, great value. Choose it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: CSRC
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 22nd floor junior suite with balcony and executive lounge access for an excellent rate of AUD258 per night. This is the cheapest room rate for other hotels of a similar standard in Sydney, so to get a balcony suite and lounge access was quite incredible value. The bedroom was very large, with a small living room attached (with both a normal mini-bar and a large wine fridge). Flat screens in both the living room and the bedroom. The main bathroom was very large with great views, and there was an additional toilet. The balcony gave great views over Darling Harbour and the city and was a real bonus in a city with few hotel balconies. The bed was firm and, although it didn't impede sleep, the oddly hard pillows did to some extent. The executive lounge provided a very acceptable breakfast, soft drinks throughout the day and self-serve canapes and drinks in the evening. It was actually a bit more atmospheric than most hotel executive lounges. The outdoor pool area was lovely, although much improved on weekdays when the throngs had checked out. A nice jacuzzi, steam room and sauna and an average gym are also on the pool level. I have to say I never expected to find value like this in Sydney. The Swissotel is not as plush as properties like the Radisson, but it is very comfortable and spacious, and the value cannot be beaten. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: rabbitEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of a 5 week trip in Australia. Hotel is very central which makes it convenient for all the attractions Sydney has to offer. Room a very good size. Breakfast was first class and really set you up for the day. Staff all very pleasant. I would give this hotel 10 out of 10. Definitely worth the money and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HoosierTim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights over New Years and enjoyed my stay very much. The room was immaculately clean, well appointed and very spacious. I had seen several comments about the beds being too hard. It might have been a little firmer than most but still comfortable and I did not have any trouble sleeping. The central location is what I liked best. Easy access to a City Rail station across the street. Darling Harbour a short walk away. Shops of all kinds right at your door step. A little bit longer walk down to Circular Quay but not unpleasant, I did it several times.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot for shoppers and movie lovers”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Swissotel. This time I had myself and two teenage girls. I chose the hotel because of the location: perfectly adjacent to shops and movie theatres so the girls could pop out on their own and experience some freedom without getting lost. The other advantage is its proximity to the townhall railway station and the monorail station ( a few blocks walk from each along busy (safe) shopping streets or through underground malls). The rooms are spacious and well appointed. I did have to ask for an extra towel for our third guest, but two additional towels were provided with promptness and courtesy. The room is quiet, and we had a good view of the Centrepoint tower and the Pitt St Mall. The pool is very nice, and always a good facility if travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, superlative”
Reviews.Author: Tallhorse
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of four nights, including New Year's Eve. The room was spotless, the bed excellent, the bathroom large and clean with separate tub and shower. The pool on the 10th floor was exceptionally clean and pleasant. As others have mentioned, the entrance is a bit odd. You enter off Market Street between entrances to Myer's Department Store, then take an elevator to the 8th floor. But no matter. Book directly from the Swissotel website for the best prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location. Shopaholics will love it.”
Reviews.Author: avevers
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception area, excellent separate bath and shower cubicle. Clean everywhere, Bose hifi radio, big tv and Nespesso machine added to the comfort. Good staff, great breakfast (excellent range of food to choose from), great stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld38
Reviews.Content: A good hotel locationwise if you are going to Sydney for shopping. Around the corner from Pitt street Mall and across the road from QVB. It is worth checking the hotel website for good deals. Two mild criticisms (1) the hotel entry is odd as you need to take a lift to 8th floor reception and then another lift to your room. (2) On departure there was a charge for the use of the in room bar which I had not used (the staff had not checked the bar before I arrived ?). However reception had no hesitation in deleting the charge when I objected. Hotel staff cheerful and attentive. Good swimming pool. I enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BGDC
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is a beautiful, modern hotel in the heart of Sydney's shopping district. The rooms are well appointed, comfortable and clean with up-to-date bathrooms. We had a couple of minor problems with the room (heat wasn't working correctly and the safe wouldn't work), but both times the excellent staff came up and fixed the problems immediately and cheerfully. You have to take an elevator up to the lobby since the building also contains an apartment building, but once up there you see the beauty of the place. We were able to get a great rate that included the breakfast buffet, which was good and featured lots of Australian and Asian choices. We didn't eat lunch or dinner in the restaurant, so I can't speak to the quality at other times, but it is pricey, as is all the food in Sydney. The hotel is right in the center of hundreds of stores, so if you like shopping you're in the right place. It is a short walk to Darling Harbour, but if you plan to go to Circular Quay and the Rocks frequently as we did, it's a good 20 minute or so walk, which was not a problem for us. It's a nice walk past stores and attractions, and good exercise too. There are buses and cabs if you prefer. Overall a great place to stay for the money compared to some of the other hotels closer to the Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: krusty6375
Reviews.Content: Just back from my honeymoon to Sydney & Thailand. Stayed here for 7 nights. Location was excellent, very central to everything. Room was very nice. Clean with huge king size bed. I had emailed the hotel to check they had received my booking and advised them we were on honeymoon. They upgraded us into an executive room (did not get to use the executive suite tho). Staff were helpful and professional, breakfast was very very good, lots of choice. Would def recommend this hotel to anyone. I booked this hotel through Expedia, got a very good rate. Cost us Â£670 for 7 nights which is a very good price for the city centre of Sydney. Would def stay here again on my nexy visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with great service at a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: globetouristSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Sydney as I was looking for accommodation for a friends birthday party in the city, and found this hotel at a great rate for a Saturday night stay. Arrived at the property only to find my room wasn't yet avaliable, despite it being after the stated 2PM check-in time, however the friendly receptionist placed me in the priority list for a clean room, and this was soon avaliable for me within 30 minutes. My request for a Double-Double room and a non smoking room were also provided for. The biggest surprise was the room I recieved. I amsure is the largest room that I have probably ever stayed in of any hotel in Sydney. The room featured two double beds, a large writing desk, wall mounted LCD television with cable channels, and a large bathroom with seperate shower and bath, and this was all for the rate of $210.00 for a Saturday night in Sydney, what fantastic value! Overall, this is a hotel with a great location, FANTASTIC value and great service. Would not hesistate to recommend it to anyone for any purpose, will definately be staying again when I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Womderful hotel in fantasic location!”
Reviews.Author: AliT73
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in the Swissotel with my Mum, and we were extremely impressed; We were initially given the wrong type of room, but this situation was quickly resolved and we were given a HUGE room with 2 very comfortable doubles on the 22nd floor. The Sydney Tower was just outside the window, but we had a great view of the city and even a glimpse of the bay! The bathroom was spotless and large with a bath AND shower. The room was very clean, quiet and comfy - perfect for getting over jetlag! The breakfasts were a feast, with friendly and attentive service. The location is also fantasic - right above the Meyer department store and in the heart of the main shopping centre. Darling harbour and circular quay are only a short walk away, and train stations, monorail and ferries are close by too. There is even an oustide pool on the 10th floor - not the quietest or most restful place, but great for a sunny dip! We paid Â£90 for our room with breakfast per night, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay - a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Good Service at Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: Bingleypeabs
Reviews.Content: Location is very good for attractions although SH Bridge and the Opera House are more than walking distance. The entrance is a bit weird being a smallish door on the main street leading to a lift that takes you to the 8th floor reception area. Our room on 25th floor was large, light and modern with very good temperature control - one of the most important things to get a good night's sleep. As others have said, the bed was on the firm side but was very comfortable. Special mention for the in-room tea and coffee. These were excellent with espresso coffee maker and various types of coffee. The staff were very good indeed and helped with maps and directions. I must say the breakfast was exceptional in choice and quality. The hotel bar seemed expensive and a little sterile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: gavin117
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in the swissotel sydney. It is a great hotel with a great location. Town hall station in a 5 minute walk, St James station is about 3 mins away. If there are two or more people it is probably cheaper to get a taxi from the airport. Our room was massive, modern and spotlessly clean. the only downside was having paid the hotel bill in full before our arrival, the reception proceeded to charge my credit card again. This was a major inconvience as we were at the end of our 3 week holiday and my credit card was near it's limit. The problem was eventually sorted after a few days but it prevented me from using my card during this time. Although helpful, I didn't even get an apology from the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: frappeo
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is located in the heart of the shopping district next to the Sydney Tower. From the airport, I took the train to the Town Hall Station but the taxis I hailed refused to take me to the hotel presumably because of the short distance. It took me a while to locate the hotel entrance. A walk across Myers Department Store led me to the elevators which took me up to the front desk. Check in was done in ten minutes - five minutes waiting for my turn (it was nearly 7pm) and five minutes for the usual check in routine. My room, somewhat smaller than what I had expected, was cosy and inviting with wood panelling and furniture, and a wall mounted flat screen TV. I had expected picture windows but found apartment-type windows from which I could see all the hotel's neighbouring buildings (a bit too close for comfort). I liked the kimonos and the nifty coffee maker, but could not help comparing Swissotel Sydney with its sister hotels in Bangkok and Singapore whose rooms are much more spacious and had nice city views. Location-wise, Swissotel Sydney is like Swissotel The Stamford in Singapore, with shopping in the same complex but the latter's rooms all come with balconies with full length sliding glass doors, better equipped meeting rooms, an in-house convention centre and the subway at its basement. However, Swissotel Sydney has newer rooms/furniture and is just one block away from the monorail which serves the city centre. Both Swissotel Sydney and Swissotel Nai Lert Park (in Bangkok) appear to have been recently renovated but in terms of service, the latter stands out with its bellhops ever ready to lend a helping hand with luggage and hailing taxis, and smiling and helpful reception staff. Swissotel Sydney's staff were courteous and efficient but seemed to lack the X factor in making guests feel right at home. I think Swissotel Sydney suits the leisure traveller more than the business traveller. Broadband speeds are excellent but the meetign rooms while ok are not impressive; to reach the business district or the convention centre, one would still need to cab it or walk to the train station and monorail respectively. For shoppers with spare cash to splurge on nice hotels, Swissotel Sydney is a good base to drop off shopping bags before continuing with more retail therapy. It is also within walking distance to Hyde Park if one needs a respite from the city bustle, and Darling Harbour, with its watering holes can be reached on foot or via the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay here on a holiday trip. The location is centainly central for the shopping and business districts but is a bit dead at night-time. We ended up dining in other parts of town both evenings. Also the pool area is overshadowed by buildings in the morning so my plans to catch an hour of sun before breakfast were thwarted! Luckily the pool water is well heated. In contrast to other reviewers we found the bed really comfortable. The staff were amongst the most helpful and efficient I have ever come across in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great - clean, efficient & friendly”
Reviews.Author: serialweekenders
Reviews.Content: modern and stylish hotel. staff efficient and friendly. rooms were of good quality with great views and comfortable beds! Breakfast pricey and disappointing. All in all a good business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Tribe1920
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for four nights on our honeymoon in late September 2007. The hotel is very nice - the public spaces are beautiful, the workout room is very nice, and pool is great. The rooms are nice, but please be forewarned: The beds are as hard as a rock. I would honestly say that the bed was the least comfortable hotel bed that I have ever slept in. The view from our room was great - we looked out over the Sydney tower and one of the city's many parks. We tried the breakfast buffet one morning - it was grossly overpriced. The quality was average, but the price was anything but average. I would skip the restaurant and the bar and find places that are a better value. (Actually, the food court next to the hotel has a great place for freshly squeezed fruit juice and there is another stand with decent muffins/breakfast breads.)

Reviews.Title: “Greate Time”
Reviews.Author: endleslove
Reviews.Content: Mostly i travel alot for work and i stayed almost every Swissotel in Europe that is also same standards of any swissotel in the world it was comfortable nice and relaxing holiday for me

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 122309d
Reviews.Content: Located near Pitt Street, this is a great location for walking to Darling harbour and circular quay. Minutes away from the monorail and train services. The rooms are clean, well serviced, and the hotel staff are fantastic. The concierge helped us with everything, we didnt book anything, they sorted everything out for us, there opinions and facts proved very useful for our short stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beauty !!!”
Reviews.Author: Adnansamir
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swissotel in Feb. The hotel is just at a fantastic location. Its walking distance to Darling harbour, Sydney Tower, Showboat Dinner cruise departure centre etc. Bridge climb centre i also very close by though not walking distance. The shower is the best i could get in sydney and also the rooms are very spacious. Staff very helpful as well. Breakfast was wonderful. All in all a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: bistomtom
Reviews.Content: I've live in this hotel for 10 nights in the double-double room and it was a good experience! Room is very spacious as well as the bathroom. (including individual shower space&bath) The check in was processing quickly , staff are friendly and concierge was helpful. The location is excellent & the hotel did worth of money & the reputation i've heard from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, We will be back”
Reviews.Author: 5travellinghackmans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a get away from the kids for 2 nights and stayed on the executive floor to take advantage of the buffet breakfast and nightly 2 hours of canapes and drinks. From the moment we arrived the staff were fantastic and our room was very nice. The hotel is very centrally located but the rooms are not at all noisy. The breakfast is very nice, all self serve and everything you need. Nightly canapes were ok but a little more variety would have been nice, again all self serve. We will stay again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Dubphile
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on one of the higher floors. View was amazing of the skytower and beyond. Room was lovely, very clean and modern. Location was fantastic; near to the train station (for handy access from the airport) and in the middle of the main shopping area. There was a large variety of pastries, meats, fruit to choose from for breakfast - with European and Japanese tastes catered for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: uksunLV
Reviews.Content: Great position, walking distance to both harbours. Good breakfast although not cheap. Not sure I would call it 5 star but it was light airy and good sized rooms. All clean with friendly staff. Close to all the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: BGHNB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both thought this is one of the best city centre hotels we have ever stayed in. Great location right in the centre of town just of George Street and opposite the Queen Victoria Building (QVB). Darling Bay 10-15 min walk The Harbour Bridge (The Rocks) 25-35 min walk Town Hall 6-7 min walk Deluxe Rooms are excellent, (if possible ask for room 20 on any of the floors - it's the only one with a balcony). Plenty of space and well furnished. Bathrooms are also well equipped. Breakfast, served in the main restaurant, is first class, with a selection from a wide range of cold and hot buffets. Gym is okay, if a little small approximately 5 running and x-training machines. I understand from my wife that the spa facilities are very good. If other Swissotels are this good I will definitely be using them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great suite!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiLeo
