Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 3 nights. We arrived after an early flight from NZ and were aware that our room would not be ready until the afternoon. Wewere able to use the spa facilities to change . . . however, after only 30 mins our room was ready! Also, my husband went to arrange some champagne for the first night of our honeymoon, and the hotel immediately upgraded us to a suite on the top floor, which was fantastic. The hotel is in a great location, it has great services and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: voguish
Reviews.Content: My friends and I, all teenage students, booked 2 rooms at Swissotel this June and had the most fantastic stay. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were great and the location was just wow. The Townhall Cityrail station is just a few minute's walk away, the Monorail station is even closer, awesome malls are just on the doorstep, and many major attractions are within walking distant (the Rocks and Darling Harbour). The only thing that I wasn't entirely satisfied with was the breakfast. It was fine, but not great- well, I guess that's because it's free. We'd like to thank a member of the staff at the concierge. Our taxi ran late on the day we left because of the traffic, and we really appreciated the fact that he truly made an effort to ensure that we could leave as soon as possible. We didn't quite catch his name, but Swissotel should be proud that they have such dedicated staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracie58712
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for three nights at this hotel. Our flight into Sydney arrived early (9:30 a.m.) and even though check-in isn't until later in the day, we were able to get into our room early, which was a huge surprise! The room is large, although in my opinion lacking any type of special decor. "Drab" is the word I'd use to describe it. The bed was nice... a bit harder than we were used to, though! The bathroom was huge and very nice, and the sound from the TV coming into the bathroom was pretty cool! Breakfast in the morning was nice, with many options on the buffet line. Room service was fantastic! We don't usually order room service, but had to try the "homemade chips" and loved them so much we ordered them twice! There's an active lobby bar and check-in and check-out were both smooth and easy. Although we didn't use the fitness room or spa, they both looked nice. The hotel is located within easy walking distance to many shops, as well as Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Word of warning, though... the conceirge men do not always give the best directions!!! Overall, we had a great trip and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: MissTam
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend an I had a fantastic night at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful (special mention for Alan at check-in) and the room was lovely too. This hotel is located close to everything in the CBD and we had lovely views from our premier room on the 14th floor. The bathroom is huge and clean and has a separate large bath. The decor was simple and elegant. The only complaint was that the beds were quite hard. My partner and I prefer plush mattress's and pillows. Would defiantly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Service, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: returning_the_favour
Reviews.Content: Had an upgrade to the Executive Club and had a great stay for 2 nights. Particularly impressive was their service for us. Location was brilliant for seeing some sights around Sydney - we walked to circular quay/opera house etc. in less than 15 mins , then caught ferry back around to Darling Harbour. We enjoyed the canapes :) Sausage rolls and curry puffs with drinks was more my style. I would, however, agree with some previous comments about the temperature and maintenance of food in the executive club - partic.breakfast. The loss of 1 star for the review is also because they forgot our turn down service on the 2nd night!! Would go back again though...

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: zootout
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I stayed 2 nights at the Swissotel at the beginning of the month on the 16th floor. I booked a package that included breakfast and what a breakfast. Something for everyone- from bacon and eggs to cereal. toast and fresh fruit. Everything was replenished as it ran out. . The staff throughout the hotel were fantastic. They were all very helpful and very friendly. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The bathroom huge. This hotel is very close to everything in Sydney. Would highly recommend the Swissotel. I look foraward to returning in the middle of July.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: basa123
Reviews.Content: Sydney was our last stop before taking off to LA our home sweeet home. My partner and I stayed for 3 nights I must say the staff are friendly and helpfull in all areas specially the Concierge very helpfull and knowledgable, the Bell Hop always greet us from morning to night. We will defenitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: LancashireAsh
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, right in the centre of it all but quiet and discerning at the same time. Sufficient facilities but everything they did, they did well - internet facilities, pool, awsome breakfasts! Friendly staff, especially Daniel (thanks for the tip about the cricket tickets - sorry you lost for a change). Lovely big, clean room with excellent shower and good views across to Darling Harbour. You can never get lost as the Hotel is almost directly under that useful landmark, the Sydney Tower. Beautiful Hyde Park is 200 yards away. Catch the explorer buses just around the corner. All famous landmarks within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: star_236
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a trip to Sydney for my 1st wedding anniversary after reading good reviews on this site.. and I wish I hadn't bothered. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, right next to Pitt St Mall (fantastic shopping!), near Town Hall Station and a 10 minute walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay, which is one of the most beautiful parts of any city I've seen. The worst thing about this hotel was the service. It was absolutely shocking, across all areas - and I'm far from fussy when it comes to service, promptness and a smile is all it takes to make me happy. The first offender was concierge.. we arrived quite late (11pm), lugged our bags inside, were not greeted at all and, without looking up, the guy grunted 'check-in is on level 8'. No offer to take our bags, no greeting, nothing. No matter who was there, they remained equally as rude and disinterested our entire stay. Check in was just as bad, I've never waited so long, no apology for the wait, no smile or welcome. I had upgraded our room to one on the executive club floors and there was a confusion with this, which annoyed me because I'd expressly told the reservations girl that I wanted it to be a surprise for my husband. We, again, lugged our bags to our room ourselves and were given no instruction as to breakfast, pool and gym levels and closing times, facilities, nothing. The room was nice enough, but NOTHING (and I mean NOTHING) like the hotel's website, especially not the executive club rooms. Our room wasn't even as nice as the standard picture shown on the website, and I wish I hadn't bothered wasting my money on the upgrade. It wasn't spacious at all, in fact a little on the small side compared to other hotels I've stayed in, and we had no view of the harbour at all, as promised by the website. The bathroom was nicely appointed with a seperate bath and shower but we had to ring housekeeping to get 2 towels (when the booking was for 2 people??) The turndown service at night was a good touch, with chocolates on the pillow, and the cleanliness was of an ok standard (if a little dusty). That brings me to the Executive Club. What an absolute joke. Seriously, help-yourself lukewarm party pies and curry puffs do not constitute 'canapes'. And the measly selection of 'hot' food was ALWAYS luke warm, even though we got there at 5.45pm. It took such a long time for them to replenish anything, and as for the cheese board (no cold meats, just a few cheeses and water crackers), once a type of cheese was gone, that was it for the rest of the night. You had to serve your own drinks, which my husband enjoyed because he was free to have triple shots of bourbon, but part of what I paid for was 'service', which wasn't provided at all. The breakfast up there was even worse. Baked beans, ham and cheese croissants, spinach puffs, scrambled eggs were among the foods that always ran out, taking at least half an hour to replace (if they were replaced at all). On our third day there they ran out of cutlery and juice glasses! When I asked the 'attendant' (said very sarcastically - he was completely hopeless) if he knew there were no juice glasses he replied "Yes - I know". No apology, explanation, nothing! I've actually worked business club service in a 4-star hotel and if we ran out of anything it was the absolute sin of all sins, but at the Swissotel noone cared. Breakfast downstairs was almost as bad. Not to mention the fact that they tried to make us pay, even though I'd paid for it in my original booking, the amount for breakfast wasn't refunded when I upgraded, AND the reservations girl who I arranged the upgrade with expressly told me I could eat at both. None of that seemed to matter with staff, who argued with me for at least 10 minutes until we finally agreed to just eat upstairs for the rest of our stay. They had the same issues with replacing food, I've never seen anything like it. Honestly, I'm actually quite easy to please, but I was so disappointed with this hotel especially as it was supposed to be such a special time for me and my husband. Business travellers and those just passing through would probably be ok with it but I don't recommend it at all for people wanting a romantic getaway. Sydney itself was a lot of fun, so much to do, great food and you can't go past the Opera House for impressive, but choose somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice location for shoppers, easy access to all sites”
Reviews.Author: nreitter
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney on March 30, 2007 & took the train from the airport to Swissotel (very easy to do, close to hotel & Swissotel clearly explained how to get there). We stayed the first 2 nights of our honeymoon here & were pleased with our contemporary, clean, up-to-date room. There was a separate shower/tub & they even left a plate of delicious chocolates for us in congratulations for our wedding. Note: they were the ONLY hotel during our entire 2 week trip to even acknowledge that it was our honeymoon though I mentioned it to each while booking. The concierge was great & made all our dinner reservations. This hotel is admist all sorts of shopping & a 5+ minute walk to Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Darling Harbour, etc. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Central Business District”
Reviews.Author: BFMCharlotte
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Swissotel in Sydeny and was very impressed with the overall experience. The room I booked was their "Standard" room but the room was anything but standard. The room was large with nice views of the city and comfortable beds. The bathroom was absolutely huge with a soaking tub as well as walk in shower. I ordered room service that evening as well and was equally as impressed by the food and service. All and all it was a class act. It's not over the top luxury but very pleasant and extremely clean. I would highly recommend the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad ”
Reviews.Author: travellerist
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in early March, although the location is excellent, we will not return to this hotel. We checked in at 2:30pm and the room was not ready. The room is nice but it is dusty. We had breakfast there in the morning, the food was cold and not replenished, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: Swede_Oak
Reviews.Content: What a treat! This hotel has class, style, modern design and delightful service. The location is very convenient to Hyde Park, Central Business District, Shopping and the bays of Sydney. I would return here in a heart beat. The beds are firm but luxurious, with large down comforters and big pillows. The bathrooms are large, light filled and very modern. The carpets are clean and everything is well tended to. We also found the pool and fitness center to be state-of-the art. It's really a good value for its class and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice if you want to stay in the city!”
Reviews.Author: nycrose
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review because we booked all of our hotels with trip advisor as our guide! The Swissotel was a great hotel - - Clean, Large Rooms, Good Gym, Good Pool and solid location. I kept calling it a wanna be W hotel but with larger rooms. The location was about a 15 minute walk to Circular Quay and the rocks. It was nice not to have to take a cab! It's just a solid place to stay. It's an easy place to stay in a central location. Random but true, I had the best Greek salad ever from their room service. Conceirge good too..We ended up booking all of our day tours through them. What else?We did stay one night on Bondi Beach which was awesome too!!

Reviews.Title: “The Swissotel - For the First but Not the Last Time”
Reviews.Author: Vilavisitor
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Swissotel for the first time - and it certainly won't be the last. A girlfriend and I stayed for two nights and could not have been happier. Our rooms were on the 24th Floor with access to the Executive Lounge. The rooms were extremely comfortable with an expansive view over the city and a glimpse of the harbour. Everything was spotless - especially the bathroom. There has been criticism of the hard beds but that did not worry me. We were able to enjoy Happy Hour in the Lounge in the evenings and there was a very substantial offering of savouries, biscuits and cheese etc. which easily substituted for our evening meal. Breakfast consisted of eggs, bacon, cereal and fruit etc. There was also free computer access. I found any staff member I had dealings with to be extremely pleasant and helpful and thought the hotel had a very nice friendly atmosphere. The location in the centre of the CBD is excellent and we enjoyed being able to come and go throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hoyaworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second part of a honeymoon (first part in Fiji) and had a great time. It's a very sophisticated comfortable hotel in the heart of the shopping district. Our room had a great bathroom (huge tub and separate shower), excellent view, and nice sitting area. We also enjoyed tea one afternoon and spent some time in the hot tub and pool outside. Activities in Sydney that we enjoyed: 1) Bridge climb! 2) Opera house - saw Pirates of Penzance 3) Shopping! 4) Wine country tour 5) Great restaurants 6) Friendly and very trendy locals! I'm ready to be a "yummy mummy" too!

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Rob1233
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. The lobby bar is great (with a very reasonably priced happy hour), the breakfasts were first-rate, the pool and gym were immaculate and the rooms were large, new, and very well appointed. The staff were also extremely professional throughout.

Reviews.Title: “OK accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SuperSpy
Reviews.Content: As New Year's is prime tourist season in Sydney, we managed to get a room here-better than nothing. It's in the center of town, several blocks from the harbor which is where most of the action is. From the street you need to take an elevator to the 8th floor, cross the lobby to another set of elevators to get to your room. Something of a hassle if you're in a hurry. If you plan to use their laundry services - beware. They charge $9.00 for one washer load...but the soap is free. Under different circumstances we would have picked another place closer to the water. Our view - rooftops of the office building next door.

Reviews.Title: “First Swissotel Stay and love it!”
Reviews.Author: TB-SD
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at a Swissotel property, and we were very pleased, especially with how crazy busy Sydney was for New Year's. Although I read a recent review about bad service, we did not experience that. We enjoyed great breakfasts each morning to start our day. The gym and pool are a little small, but still enjoyable. Our room was very comfortable, but the beds are quite firm (maybe a little too firm for us). The hotel is in a great location for exploring Sydney; close to the trains, monorail and just walking. Overall, it is a great hotel chain, and would entertain stays at their other properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, would return”
Reviews.Author: Bindoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (a Monday). The hotel reception were helpful and accommodating to our early arrival, stored our luggage and phoned us on our cell (mobile) phone to let us know when the room was available. Our room was very spacious with a large bathroom with sep. bath and large shower cubicle. We had a view west across the roof tops with water glimpses. Although near the lift we had absolutely no noise problems and enjoyed a good nightâ€™s sleep. Yes the beds are firm (refer other reviews) but not uncomfortable and rather like many we have slept in France and China. The breakfast was excellent with friendly waiters. The concierge was helpful and knowledge of the area. The location is wonderful (above the Myer Department Store), minutes from the QVB historic shopping complex, Hyde Park etc. We arrived via the Town Hall Station and left via James Street Station (direct route to airport) and both were short easy walks. We also walked to Darling Harbor but the monorail was also right there for your use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: justsomeguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from October 21 through October 29, 2005 and it was excellent. I had a standard room on the 21st floor which had two huge windows and a bit of a harbour view. The Hotel is within easy walking distance of Circular Quay and Darling Harbour and St. James/Town Hall City Rail stations and the monorail. The staff was especially friendly and helpful. I have no complaints about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return, beds are very hard!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The swissotel has to be the best location for those of us who love to shop and for that the hotel scores great marks, however when staying in a hotel I would expect to be pampered or at the very least not longing to return to my own bed. This is exactly what I was doing at 2am when I couldn't sleep because the beds are so hard I would have been more comfortable on the carpet. The bathrooms look lovely but at a second glance the floors look like they need a good scrub. The staff were lovely but I wouldn't consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not all its cracked up to be!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the swissotel Sydney on market street In March 04.. The Hotel Looby is very classy....tho the rooms are not. We i arrived at the hotel late at night..was ushered to a room. Which was the wrong room it was a single room, but at least it had a view It took them nearly 3 hours to transpher us to the right room but crappy --- veiw of a cream wall and the windows didnt open. Ok the rooms are clean and cute....but very very small and plain for the amout that you pay for them...The bathroom is tiny also ( in the brocher it says that the bathrooms are marble, they lied). The beds were ok, tho they do not change ur sheets everyday, unless you whinge about it, and they only give you one towel each, which is hard for females.. We got breakfast included in our stay, breakfast was really nice, but stay away from the scrambled eggs, cuz the chief dont know how to cook them. Also had lunch there once. really good food but very very expensive ( got a club sandwitch and a cheese burger $ 57.00 dollars)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, exclusive, high in the sky view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were ushered up to the 8th floor where the hotel started. Bell hops, porters, nearby. Ushered into a beautiful room overlooking the bay. WONDERFUL. I would recommend it to everyone I meet!!!

Reviews.Title: “The beds are hard!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you don't like hard beds then this is not the place for you. The bed was like sleeping on a slab of concrete, which I suppose is OK if you like your mattress firm. Other than the horrid bed which totally spoiled my stay this place was modern, very clean and offered friendly service.

HotelInfo.Name: Swissotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 68 Market St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Merchant Court Hotel)
